Headline: Viacom Cuts 250 Jobs From Its Intl Opers - Report
Story: NEW YORK (Dow Jones)--Viacom Inc.'s (VIA) MTV Networks on Thursday announced a restructuring of its international operations that will add another 250 layoffs to the 250 U.S.-based personnel that were cut less than three weeks ago, The New York Post reported in its Friday editions.   Viacom will merge or close some international regions while expanding or relocating employees in others. The company will move some of its Latin American personnel from Miami to Buenos Aires, and transfer a portion of its Emerging Markets/Middle East group from London to Budapest, Hungary, and Warsaw, Poland. The moves, combined with previous layoffs in Asia, will trim 250 positions from MTVN International.   Newsapaper Web Site: http://www.nypost.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  March 02, 2007 05:16 ET (10:16 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: Owens-Illinois Hires Banks For EUR300M Bond, Roadshow Next Wk
Story: LONDON (Dow Jones)--Owens-Illinois has hired banks for a EUR300 million 10-year bond, which will be roadshowed next week in Europe, one lead manager said Friday.   The offering, announced by the company earlier Friday, is to be issued by its subsidiary OI European Group B.V. and will be led by BNP Paribas, Citigroup and JPMorgan, which are joint bookrunners. Co-lead managers are Calyon, Credit Suisse and Scotia Bank. Co-managers are Barclays Capital and HSBC.   The bond, due 2017, will be non-callable for five years. A European roadshow will be scheduled for next week, with pricing likely by the end of next week.   The Ohio-based manufacturer of glass containers said the subsidiary borrower of Owens-Illinois Inc. intends to borrow under its secured credit agreement to repay all the outstanding $300 million of the company's 8.10% senior notes due May 15, 2007.   -By Anousha Sakoui, Dow Jones Newswires, 44 20 7842 9318,  anousha.sakoui@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  March 02, 2007 04:27 ET (09:27 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: : Hospitality Properties Trust Prices $500 Million of 3.80% Convertible Senior Notes due 2027
Story: NEWTON, Mass.--(BUSINESS WIRE)--March 02, 2007--   Hospitality Properties Trust (NYSE: HPT) today announced the pricing of $500 million of 3.80% Convertible Senior Notes due 2027. HPT also granted the initial purchasers an option to purchase up to an additional $75 million aggregate principal amount of notes to cover overallotments, if any. Closing of the sale of the notes is expected to occur on March 7, 2007. HPT expects to use the net proceeds from the sale of the notes to repay a portion of the debt incurred to fund its recently completed acquisition of TravelCenters of America, Inc.     Prior to March 15, 2026, upon the occurrence of specified events, the notes will be convertible at the option of the holder at an initial conversion rate of 19.8018 common shares per $1,000 principal amount of notes. The initial conversion price of $50.50 represents a 15.8% premium to yesterday's closing price of HPT's common shares of $43.61. On or after March 15, 2026, the notes will be convertible at any time prior to the second business day prior to maturity at the option of the holder. Upon conversion of notes by a holder, the holder will receive cash up to the principal amount of such notes and, with respect to the remainder, if any, of the conversion value in excess of such principal amount, cash or HPT common shares. The initial conversion rate is subject to adjustment in certain circumstances.     Prior to March 20, 2012, the notes will not be redeemable at HPT's option, except to preserve HPT's status as a REIT. On or after March 20, 2012, HPT may redeem all or a portion of the notes at a redemption price equal to the principal amount plus accrued and unpaid interest (including additional interest), if any.     Note holders may require HPT to repurchase all or a portion of the notes at a purchase price equal to the principal amount plus accrued and unpaid interest (including additional interest), if any, on the notes on March 20, 2012, March 15, 2017, and March 15, 2022, or upon the occurrence of certain change in control transactions prior to March 20, 2012.     The notes will be sold to qualified institutional buyers by means of a private offering memorandum in accordance with Rule 144A under the Securities Act of 1933, as amended. The notes and the HPT common shares that may be issuable upon conversion of the notes have not been registered under the Securities Act of 1933, as amended, or any state securities laws, and unless so registered, may not be offered or sold in the United States except pursuant to an exemption from the registration requirements of the Securities Act of 1933, as amended, and applicable state laws.     This communication shall not constitute an offer to sell or the solicitation of an offer to buy nor shall there be any sale of these securities in any state or other jurisdiction in which such offer, solicitation or sale would be unlawful prior to registration or qualification under the securities laws of any such state or other jurisdiction.       WARNINGS REGARDING FORWARD LOOKING STATEMENTS     THIS PRESS RELEASE CONTAINS FORWARD LOOKING STATEMENTS WITHIN THE MEANING OF THE PRIVATE SECURITIES LITIGATION REFORM ACT OF 1995 AND THE FEDERAL SECURITIES LAWS. THESE FORWARD LOOKING STATEMENTS REPRESENT HPT'S PRESENT BELIEFS AND EXPECTATIONS, BUT THEY MAY NOT OCCUR. FOR EXAMPLE, THE FACT THAT THIS OFFERING HAS PRICED MAY IMPLY THAT THE OFFERING WILL CLOSE. THE CLOSING IS SUBJECT TO CONDITIONS CUSTOMARY TO TRANSACTIONS OF THIS TYPE AND MAY BE DELAYED OR MAY NOT OCCUR AT ALL. IN ADDITION, THE FACT THAT THE INITIAL PURCHASERS HAVE AN OVER-ALLOTMENT OPTION MAY IMPLY THAT THIS OPTION WILL BE EXERCISED. THE UNDERWRITERS ARE NOT UNDER ANY OBLIGATION TO EXERCISE THIS OPTION, OR ANY PORTION OF IT, AND MAY NOT DO SO. INVESTORS SHOULD NOT PLACE UNDUE RELIANCE UPON ANY FORWARD LOOKING STATEMENTS.        CONTACT: Hospitality Properties Trust               Timothy A. Bonang, 617-796-8149               Manager of Investor Relations               www.hptreit.com        SOURCE: Hospitality Properties Trust  Copyright Business Wire 2007     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  March 02, 2007 08:00 ET (13:00 GMT)

Headline: : PRT Announces 2006 4Q Results, -7-
Mediaset Board Member: Co Plans To Explain '06 Results To Market
Story: MILAN (Dow Jones)--Mediaset SpA (MS.MI) board member Gina Nieri said Friday that the media company will "explain to the market" details of its preliminary 2006 earnings statement which left some analysts perplexed over revenue bookings.   Nieri was speaking to reporters on the sidelines of a conference after Mediaset's shares dropped sharply in Milan. Late Thursday Mediaset, Italy's largest private broadcaster and controlled by the family of former Prime Minister Silvio Berlusconi, warned that preliminary estimates showed its net profit for 2006 should be EUR505 million, well below EUR603.4 million in 2005, as consolidated advertising revenue fell.   Mediaset Thursday said 2006 gross Italian advertising revenue was EUR2.85 billion, down from EUR2.96 billion in 2005.   That was below the company's previous forecast, which was for the 2006 number to be broadly in line with 2005.   The drop reflected the change in Mediaset's advertising bookings policy. The company said revenue from some contracts sealed late in 2006 will be booked in 2007 accounts.   Nieri said a change in revenue bookings unveiled in a statement Thursday was "an accounting operation which is absolutely transparent."   "We have no difficulties to explain that to the market," she said.   Speaking at the conference, Nieri said 2006 was a tough year, with a difficult advertising market, but Mediaset was still able to post "a relevant result" in terms of net profit.   At 1135 GMT, Mediaset shares were 50 cents, or 5.7%, at EUR8.28, while the main Milan market index was slightly lower.   Nieri brushed off suggestions the sharp drop in the share price suggested Mediaset might have a credibility problem with investors.   "We've been listed for 10 years and never had any kind of problem," she said.   Separately, in an exclusive interview with Italian business television channel Class CNBC, Mediaset Chief Executive Giuliano Adreani said the company was interested in Dutch TV program maker Endemol Entertainment Holding NV (34569.AE). Spanish firm Telefonica SA (TEF) is close to selling a 75% stake in Endemol.   "It's a question of time and talks," Adreani said, when asked to explain Mediaset's interest in Endemol.   Company Web site: http://www.mediaset.com   -By Giada Zampano and Sabrina Cohen, Dow Jones Newswires; 39-02-5821 9901; giada.zampano@dowjones.com   (Kenneth Maxwell in Milan contributed to this report)     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  March 02, 2007 07:07 ET (12:07 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: : Riviera Reports Record Results for 2006
Story: LAS VEGAS, March 2 /PRNewswire-FirstCall/ -- Riviera Holdings Corporation (Amex: RIV) today reported financial results for the three-month and the twelve-month periods ended December 31, 2006.  The Company reported record Adjusted EBITDA, as defined below, and operating income for 2006.        Consolidated 2006 Results     Net revenues for the year ended December 31, 2006 were $200.9 million, a decrease of $1.3 million or less than one percent from the same period in 2005.  The decrease in net revenue was primarily related to the leasing of the gift shops at Riviera Las Vegas to ABC Stores in February 2006.  The gifts shops were previously owned and operated by the Company.  In addition, Riviera Las Vegas discontinued two shows, in late 2005 and in the fall of 2006.  These revenue declines in Las Vegas were offset by a $2.8 million increase in Las Vegas gaming revenues and a $1.5 million increase in cash room revenues. Improvements in the average daily rate and targeted slot marketing efforts contributed to these increases.     Income from operations was $25.4 million, an increase of $3.0 million or 13.5 percent from 2005, and a record for the Company.  Included in income from operations for the years ended December 31, 2006 and 2005 was an expense of $1.3 million and income of $65,000 respectively in mergers, acquisitions and development costs, net of a non-refundable fee paid to the Company in 2005. Adjusted EBITDA (1) was $41.1 million, an increase of $1.0 million or 2.6 percent from the same period in 2005, and a record for the Company.     The net loss for the year ended December 31, 2006 was $335,000, or $0.03 per share, compared with a net loss of $4.0 million, or $0.34 per share, for the year ended December 31, 2005.          2006 Developments        *  Riviera Las Vegas net revenue decreased $1.5 million or 1.0 percent      *  Riviera Las Vegas Property EBITDA was $28.1 million, an increase of         4.8 percent      *  Riviera Black Hawk net revenue was $51.7 million, an increase of         0.4 percent      *  Riviera Black Hawk Property EBITDA was $16.8 million, a decrease of         2.6 percent        Fourth Quarter 2006     Net revenues for the three months ended December 31, 2006 were $46.5 million, an increase of $300,000 over the fourth quarter of 2005.  The increase in net revenues were generated from increased casino and room revenues in Las Vegas offset by decreases in the entertainment and other revenues in Las Vegas and a decrease in casino revenues in Black Hawk, as a result of the effects of the snow storms in the Denver area during December 2006.  The Colorado snow storms resulted in approximately $1.0 million in lost casino revenues; however, this loss in Black Hawk was offset by the favorable effects of a new slot product and upgrades to the casino floor in 2006.     Income from operations was $4.7 million for the fourth quarter of 2006, an increase of $2.0 million or 75.4 percent from the fourth quarter of 2005. Included in income from operations in the fourth quarter of 2006 was $3,000 in asset impairment costs compared to $579,000 in 2005, which was related to a write off associated with a proposed walkway to a competitor's property.  Net loss for the quarter of $1.6 million, or $0.13 per share, was an improvement of $2.3 million from the fourth quarter of 2005 when the Company reported a net loss of $3.9 million.     Adjusted EBITDA, as defined below, was $8.6 million in the fourth quarter of 2006 compared to $8.2 million in 2005, an improvement of 5.5 percent. Adjusted EBITDA (1) consists of earnings before interest, income taxes, depreciation, amortization, equity-based compensation, asset impairments, Sarbanes-Oxley Act expenses, and mergers, acquisitions and development costs, as shown in the reconciliation to net income in the tables and notes of this release.          Fourth Quarter 2006 Developments        *  Riviera Las Vegas net revenue increased $530,000 or 1.6 percent      *  Riviera Las Vegas Property EBITDA was $5.5 million compared to         $4.5 million in 2005      *  Riviera Black Hawk net revenue decreased $230,000 or 1.8 percent      *  Riviera Black Hawk Property EBITDA was $4.1 million, a decrease of         10.7 percent      *  The Company has $25.3 million in cash plus a $30 million revolver which         was fully available as of December 31, 2006 compared to $20.6 million         at December 31, 2005        Riviera Las Vegas     "At the Riviera, we continue to focus on providing our customers great value for their Las Vegas Strip experience.  We have invested and will continue to invest in upgrades to our facility and slot mix, as well as continuing to implement key marketing programs for the value-oriented Las Vegas Strip customer," said Robert Vannucci, President of Riviera Las Vegas.     "Our occupancy for the year ended December 31, 2006 was 92.2 percent and consistent with the same period in 2005.  However, our revenue per available room rate (RevPar) for 2006 was $72.37 compared to $66.51 in 2005, an 8.8 percent increase.  Our average daily win per slot unit increased for the fourth quarter of 2006 to $131.67 compared to $97.48 in the fourth quarter of 2005.  We have upgraded our slot mix and reengineered the slot floor to cater to the demands of our customers.  These changes have been very favorably received, and we will continue to provide capital for upgrades to the property," said Mr. Vannucci.        Riviera Black Hawk     William L. Westerman, the Company's Chief Executive Officer, said, "We are pleased with the performance of our Black Hawk property given the significant weather issues encountered during the fourth quarter of 2006.  Our strong EBITDA margin and a fair share of over 142 percent for the quarter and 134 percent for the year, are a testament to our team and the quality of our property within the Black Hawk market."        Consolidated Operations     Mr. Westerman said, "The Company recorded record results for 2006 as evidenced by our operating income and Adjusted EBITDA, which we believe are a result of capital improvements and targeted marketing efforts at both locations.  We continue to evaluate our debt structure, and given the call premium reduction on our Senior Secured Notes in June of this year and the current rate environment, we believe that conditions may be favorable for a refinancing of our notes as a means to free up additional cash for the continued reinvestment in our properties.  Our results for 2006 generated an all-time record for the Company.  In light of the number of distractions during the past year related to the potential sale of the Company, I am very pleased with our team members and their performance."        Conference Call Information     In conjunction with the release of fourth quarter 2006 financial results, Riviera will broadcast a conference call at 2 p.m. Eastern Standard Time today, Friday, March 2, 2007.  Investors can listen to the call via the Internet at www.rivierahotel.com or by dialing (888) 889-5345. The conference call rebroadcast will be available at (877) 519-4471, pass code 8426065.        Forward-Looking Statements     The forward-looking statements in this news release, which reflect our best judgment based on factors currently known to us, involve significant risks and uncertainties including hotel and casino market conditions, increases in energy costs, general economic and political conditions, financing requirements, refinancing opportunities and investment rates expansion and modernization objectives and timetables regulatory requirements and other risks and uncertainties detailed from time to time in our filing's with the Securities and Exchange Commission.  Our actual results may differ materially from what is expressed or implied in our forward-looking statements.  We do not plan to update forward-looking statements even though our situation or plans may change in the future, unless applicable law requires us to do so.        About Riviera Holdings Corporation     Riviera Holdings Corporation owns and operates the Riviera Hotel and Casino on the Las Vegas Strip and the Riviera Black Hawk Casino in Black Hawk, Colorado.  Riviera's stock is listed on the American Stock Exchange under the symbol RIV. Headline: UK Rules Out Ethanol,Focuses On Silicon As Fuel Contaminant
Story: LONDON (Dow Jones)--U.K. laboratory scientists late Thursday ruled out ethanol and water as the cause of the contaminated gasoline which affected thousands of U.K. motorists across the south east of England.   The spotlight has now fallen on silicon particles which have been discovered in recent tests of the polluted fuel, the AA motoring trust, a chartity that does research and public policy on behalf of road users, said.   A spokeswoman for AA confirmed Friday that a small number of silicon particles had been found in the contaminated fuel. She said it was hard to go into great detail about the cause and effects until the U.K.'s Trading Standards Office released their test results later Friday.   Tesco PLC  (TSCO.LN) has also begun to focus its own tests on silicon. In a statement released late Thursday the retailer said: "Following advice from industry experts we have now started testing for silicon and other possible contaminants. We are also checking the levels at which any contaminant would start to cause engine problems. We hope to have results back soon."   The source of the contaminated gasoline has been traced back to Greenergy, a U.K. biofuels supplier which transported the gasoline from a Vopak storage facility in West Thurrock, Essex. Vopak, headquartered in the Netherlands, specializes in storing oil and chemical products.   A Vopak spokesman said: "We are trying to work out what the cause of the contamination is and the trail that the gasoline has followed, but like everyone else we are awaiting the test results. It is far more complex than we originally thought but we feel that we are getting a bit closer to the answer."   Tesco, WM Morrisons PLC (MRW.LN), J Sainsburys PLC (JSAIY) and Asda, the U.K. arm of Wal-Mart Stores Inc. (WMT), have all been named as selling contaminated gasoline.   Scientists say that when gasoline containing silicon burns, it forms silicon-dioxide which then forms a very thin sheet on the sensor in the exhaust of the vehicle. This probably gives a false signal to engine computer causing problems.   Spokesman Nick Vanderwell for the U.K. Petroleum Industry Association has recommended caution about jumping to conclusions. "Silicon is only one of many possible contaminants. There are other possibilities (for contaminants) such as metals or lead for example."     -By Rebecca Geach, Dow Jones Newswires; +44 (0)20 7842 9262; rebeccageach@hotmail.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  March 02, 2007 06:58 ET (11:58 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: Subprime Lender New Century Says Annual Report To Be Late
Story: (This article was originally published Thursday)     NEW YORK (Dow Jones)--Subprime mortgage lender New Century Financial Corp. (NEW), whose shares have fallen by nearly half since it reported deteriorating fundamentals at its lending operation Feb. 7, said late Thursday that it wouldn't file its annual report on time with the Securities and Exchange Commission.   New Century became at least the second lender in the heavily troubled sector to delay the key filing this week. On Tuesday, Fremont General Corp. (FMT) also said it would delay its annual filing. The decision sent its shares down some 24% the following day.   Companies that make mortgage loans to borrowers with weak credit have been hammered by a wave of delinquencies stemming largely from a deterioration in lending standards last year as the slowing housing market pinched volumes. Their struggles have produced broader ripples of concern about the health of the U.S. economy and have contributed to a wave of risk aversion that led to a selloff in U.S. stocks this week.   New Century didn't give a reason for the delayed filing, and officials weren't available to comment, as the company disclosed the news around 10:20 p.m. EST, after its business hours. The short press release only said the company expected to submit a notice of late filing for its annual report to the SEC on Friday.   New Century said late Feb. 7 it will restate financial results for the first three quarters of 2006 to correct accounting errors regarding the company's allowance for loan-repurchase losses. The company postponed reporting its fourth-quarter results and said it expects a loss for the period.   The Irvine, Calif., real estate investment trust also said it expects its loan production to drop 20% in 2007 as the company tightens its underwriting standards due to early defaults on its loans and expected guidance from regulators. New Century previously said it expected its loan production to be flat in 2007.   The trouble in subprime is also affecting larger companies. On Feb. 7, HSBC Holdings PLC (HBC), one of the world's largest banks, said it was putting aside an extra $1.76 billion - 20% more than analysts had expected - to cover bad debts, largely due to higher than expected losses on U.S. subprime mortgages.   And on Thursday, General Motors Corp. (GM), the world's largest auto maker, disclosed that it will need more time to file its 2006 annual report with the SEC. Many analysts attribute the delay to a substantial hit GM might take from the exposure its part-owned finance unit - GMAC Financial Services - has to the subprime mortgage business.   -By Andrew Dowell, Dow Jones Newswires; 201-938-5175; andrew.dowell@dowjones.com   (Lingling Wei contributed to this article.)     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  March 02, 2007 07:32 ET (12:32 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: : LSI Logic to Present at Morgan Stanley Technology Conference
Story: MILPITAS, Calif., March 2 /PRNewswire-FirstCall/ -- LSI Logic Corporation (NYSE: LSI) today announced that Abhi Talwalkar, President and Chief Executive Officer, will present at the Morgan Stanley Technology Conference in San Francisco, Calif., on Monday, March 5, 2007, at 3:45 p.m. Pacific Time.     A live webcast of the presentation may be viewed by visiting the LSI Logic website at http://www.lsi.com/investors.  Following the conference, a replay of the webcast will also be archived on the site.        About LSI Logic     LSI Logic Corporation (NYSE: LSI) is a leading provider of silicon-to-systems solutions that are used at the core of products that create, store and consume digital information. LSI offers a broad portfolio of capabilities including custom and standard product ICs, host bus and RAID adapters, storage area network solutions and software applications. LSI products enable leading technology companies in the Storage and Consumer markets to deliver some of the most advanced and well-known electronic systems in the market today. More information is available at http://www.lsi.com.            Editor's Notes:      1. Headline: : SuperGen to Present Discovery Platform and Pipeline Update at Analyst and Investor Day
Story: DUBLIN, Calif., March 2 /PRNewswire-FirstCall/ -- SuperGen Inc. (Nasdaq: SUPG) today announced it will present information on its CLIMB(TM) drug discovery technology and an overview of its current development pipeline at an analyst and investor event today in Salt Lake City. The presentations will begin at noon EST at the company's research and development facility.     As part of the event, SuperGen will provide a comprehensive overview of CLIMB(TM), which combines novel in vitro and in vivo processes with bioinformatics capabilities to create an efficient and effective system to identify and develop drug candidates.     In addition, SuperGen will present an update on two of its late-stage pre- clinical products: MP470 and MP529. MP470 is a tyrosine kinase inhibitor that is active against a broad spectrum of human cancer cell lines and tumor models. Information will include activity data against a number of targets, including the RAD51 protein, which is an important protein responsible for repairing double strand DNA breaks that can occur following some traditional chemotherapy treatments. Furthermore, the presentation will include information about MP529, the company's second kinase inhibitor in the oncology area specifically targeted toward aurora-A kinase (without affecting aurora-B proteins).     SuperGen will also present information about several new programs, including a new cancer target, Pim-1, and its potential inhibitor, as well as a tyrosine kinase target, JAK2, and its potential inhibitor, which has potent anti-myeloproliferative and leukemic activity.     Finally, the company will detail its current CLIMB(TM) discovery efforts, including its programs focused on DNA methyltransferase inhibition, which demonstrate the power and efficiency of the discovery platform.     The presentations will be Webcast by CCBN and are accessible in the investor relations section of SuperGen's Web site at www.supergen.com.  A replay will be available in the same location for 90 days following the event.        About SuperGen     Based in Dublin, Calif., SuperGen is a pharmaceutical company dedicated to the discovery, acquisition, rapid development and commercialization of therapies for solid tumors and hematological malignancies.  SuperGen is developing a number of therapeutic anticancer products focused on inhibitors of aurora-A, tyrosine kinase and DNA methyltransferase. For more information about SuperGen, please visit http://www.supergen.com.     This news release contains certain "forward-looking" statements within the meaning of the Private Securities Litigation Reform Act of 1995.  These statements are typically preceded by words such as "believes," "expects," "anticipates," "intends," "will," "may," "should," or similar expressions. These forward-looking statements are not guarantees of future performance and involve a number of risks and uncertainties that may cause actual results to differ materially from the results discussed in these statements.  Factors that might cause the company's results to differ materially from those expressed or implied by such forward-looking statements include, but are not limited to, the ability to discover, develop and move target compounds into clinical development and other risks and uncertainties detailed from time to time in the company's filings with the Securities and Exchange Commission including its most recently filed Form 10-Q and 10-K. SuperGen, Inc. undertakes no duty to update any of these forward-looking statements to conform them to actual results.          Contacts:      SuperGen      Timothy L. Headline: Vivendi Claims Deutsche Telecom Stole Its Polish Co Shrs -NYT
Story: NEW YORK (Dow Jones)--Vivendi (12777.FR), the French media and entertainment company, says it has new ammunition in its long-running dispute with Deutsche Telekom (DT) over control of a Polish cellular company, escalating its effort to bring the case under U.S. jurisdiction, The New York Times reported in its Friday editions.   Vivendi asserts that Deutsche Telekom, the parent of T-Mobile USA, colluded with a Polish investor to steal its shares in the Polish company, wiping out a $2.5 billion investment, the paper reported.   The latest development comes more than four months after Vivendi sued the German telecommunications company in Federal District Court in Seattle under the Racketeer Influenced and Corrupt Organizations Act, or RICO, a law originally intended to combat organized crime.   The RICO suit follows years of unsuccessful attempts by Vivendi to recover its investment by persuading European courts that the shares were transferred illegally.   The Times reports that as recently as Tuesday, a Polish appeals court overturned a lower-court ruling, essentially questioning Deutsche Telekom's contention that it owned the disputed shares, a move Vivendi would ordinarily consider a victory. But lawyers for Vivendi say the German company has repeatedly ignored similar rulings in the past.   Vivendi's latest move opens a new chapter in the battle between the two European companies over the control of Polska Telefonia Cyfrowa, the leading wireless operator in Poland, the paper reports.   In October, Vivendi filed a $7.5 billion suit under the RICO law contending that Deutsche Telekom had conspired to cheat Vivendi out of its investment in the Polish company. Vivendi says it now has neither its shares nor compensation for them.   Deutsche Telekom, in reporting its quarterly earnings this week, said Polska Telefonia Cyfrowa had been consolidated within its operations since November.   On Feb. 20, Vivendi filed a 54-page amendment to its RICO complaint, asserting, among other things, that U.S. investors had been harmed by Deutsche Telekom's takeover of the company.   Vivendi lawyers also say they now have documents proving the illegal secret transfer of shares of the Polish company to Deutsche Telekom, which they say were discovered stored in a Polish courthouse in November, the Times reports.   The Times reports that perhaps the most significant new assertion in the amended complaint is that Deutsche Telekom's acquisition of the shares could have inflated its asset base, putting T-Mobile USA in a stronger position to support its successful $4 billion bid in a wireless spectrum auction by Federal Communications Commission that ended in September. Vivendi contends that T-Mobile's ability to raise capital for such transactions was based on false reports.   It argues that the defendants used phone and e-mail networks in the United States to perpetrate a crime, bringing the case under American jurisdiction.   Officials of T-Mobile USA, based in Bellevue, Wash., declined to comment on the case. Michael Lange, a spokesman for Deutsche Telekom in Bonn, Germany, said, "We shall answer these wayward allegations before the court."   Newsapaper Web Site: http://www.nytimes.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  March 02, 2007 01:03 ET (06:03 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: : Intermec Files for Extension of Form 10-K Filing Deadline
Story: EVERETT, Wash.--(BUSINESS WIRE)--March 02, 2007--   Intermec, Inc. (NYSE:IN) today announced that the Company and its independent registered public accounting firm are in the process of finalizing the financial statement review and audit and will not be able to complete the review and audit within the prescribed time period without unreasonable effort and expense. As previously announced, the Company required more time than anticipated to complete the closing process, which is delaying completion of the audit. The Company intends to file its Form 10-K on or before the 15th calendar day following the prescribed due date of the Company's Form 10-K.       About Intermec, Inc.     Intermec, Inc. (NYSE:IN) develops, manufactures and integrates technologies that identify, track and manage supply chain assets. Core technologies include RFID, mobile computing and data collection systems, bar code printers and label media. The Company's products and services are used by customers in many industries worldwide to improve the productivity, quality and responsiveness of business operations. For more information about Intermec, visit www.intermec.com or call 800-347-2636. Contact Intermec Investor Relations Director Kevin McCarty at kevin.mccarty@intermec.com, 425-265-2472.       (Forward-looking Statement)     Statements made in this release and related statements that express Intermec's or our management's intentions, hopes, beliefs, expectations or predictions of the future constitute forward-looking statements, as defined by the Private Securities Litigation Reform Act of 1995, and relate to matters that are not historical facts. They include, without limitation, the statements regarding our ability to timely finalize our financial statement review and audit processes and file our Report on Form 10-K for the year ended December 31, 2006, as anticipated. They also include statements about the applicability of accounting policies used in our financial reporting, our ability to improve profit of our business segments, compete effectively with our current products and newly launched products, effectively complete the closure of certain facilities and redeploy related functions, reduce expenses, improve efficiency, realign resources, increase product development capacity, leverage our research and development investment to drive significant future revenue, and continue operational improvement and year-over-year growth. Actual results may differ from those expressed or implied in our forward-looking statements. These statements represent beliefs and expectations only as of the date they were made. We may elect to update forward-looking statements but we expressly disclaim any obligation to do so, even if our beliefs and expectations change. Such forward-looking statements involve and are subject to certain risks and uncertainties. These include, but are not limited to, risks and uncertainties described more fully in our reports filed or to be filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission including, but not limited to, our annual reports on Form 10-K and quarterly reports on Form 10-Q. Headline: Spanish Mkt Body: E.ON Needs Permission To Buy Endesa Shrs-2-
Story: Madrid-based Endesa, Spain's largest utility by market value, is the object of a EUR41 billion tender offer launched by German firm E.ON AG.   Under Spanish takeover law, E.ON can't buy shares in the open market as long as its tender offer is in place, unless given special permission by the CNMV.   E.ON's bid is facing opposition from Endesa's largest shareholder, Acciona SA (ANA.MC), and potentially also from Italy's Enel SpA (EN), after it acquired a 9.99% stake in Endesa in the open market earlier this week.   Enel has also acquired derivatives that may take its Endesa stake to over 21%. Such a move may lower E.ON's chances of a successful takeover of Endesa.   Company Web site: http://www.endesa.com   -By David Roman, Dow Jones Newswires; 34 913958125; david.roman@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  March 02, 2007 04:31 ET (09:31 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: : Natural Health Trends Corp. Stockholders Filed a Schedule 13-D/A
Story: DALLAS, Texas, March 2 /Xinhua-PRNewswire-FirstCall/ -- Mr. Rudy Ru and a group of stockholders of Natural Health Trends Corp (the "company"; Nasdaq: BHIP), an international direct selling company, announced today that they filed an amended schedule 13-D/A on February 27, 2007.        The Item 4 section of the schedule 13-D/A filing is as follows:        Item 4. PURPOSE OF TRANSACTION      Item 4 is hereby amended and restated in its entirety as follows:     As recently disclosed by the Issuer in its Current Report on Form 8-K filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission on February 26, 2007, Colin J. O'Brien, Terrence M. Morris and Stephanie Hayano have resigned from the Issuer's Board of Directors; Ms. Hayano has resigned as the Issuer's President and Chief Executive Officer; and Gernot Senke has resigned as the Issuer's Chief Operating Officer. In light of these changes, the Reporting Persons are pleased to announce that they now fully support the Issuer in its efforts to return to profitability.     The Reporting Persons believe that the Issuer still faces a number of challenges with respect to the Chinese market in which it does business, especially given that market's unique regulatory environment.  The Reporting Persons, however, have confidence in the Issuer's management in the Greater Chinese market, currently represented by Mr. Curtis E. Broome.     The Reporting Persons otherwise acquired and continue to hold the shares reported herein for investment purposes. Depending on market conditions and other factors that the Reporting Persons may deem material to their respective investment decisions, the Reporting Persons may purchase additional shares in the open market or in private transactions. Depending on these same factors, the Reporting Persons may sell all or a portion of the shares on the open market or in private transactions.     Except as set forth in this Item 4, the Reporting Persons have no present plans or proposals that relate to or that would result in any of the actions specified in clauses (a) through (j) of Item 4 of Schedule 13D of the Act. Headline: UPS Plans To Take Delivery On 10 Airbus A380s In 2012-2013
Story: By Desiree J. Hanford     Of DOW JONES NEWSWIRES     (This article was originally published Thursday)     United Parcel Service Inc. (UPS) is now scheduled to take delivery of 10 of the freighter version of the Airbus A380 aircraft between 2012 and 2013, according to UPS's 10-K filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission Thursday.   Last week, the companies announced a revised delivery schedule for the 10 freighter aircraft, postponing the delivery of them to UPS. Neither side, however, disclosed the new delivery schedule.    UPS was originally scheduled to take its first delivery of the A380 freighter in 2009, but last fall Airbus told the package delivery company that the earliest it could get the aircraft was 2010. Last week's announcement pushed the delivery date back again.   Earlier Thursday Airbus said it had stopped work on the A380 freighter, but that it remained committed to the aircraft.   -By Desiree J. Hanford, Dow Jones Newswires; 312-750-4135; desiree.hanford@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  March 02, 2007 07:33 ET (12:33 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: British Broadcasting Corp Signs Partnership With YouTube -3-
Story: The BBC in a statement said the partnership "reflects YouTube's commitment to work with content owners to make compelling video accessible online, and the BBC's commitment to increase reach through the partnership."   Some large media and entertainment companies have objected to YouTube's use of their material on an unauthorized basis. YouTube's Web site features video clips, both made by private individuals and from corporations.   Viacom Inc. (VIA), recently forced the company to take down more than 100,000 video clips from the YouTube site.   The plan is also likely to be controversial in the U.K. where the BBC has been criticized by rivals for extending its footprint too far into commercial territory.     (MORE TO FOLLOW) Dow Jones Newswires  March 02, 2007 07:03 ET (12:03 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: : Royal Bank Of Canada Reports Record First Quarter 2007 Results >RY
Story: The financial information in this press release is in Canadian dollars    and based on financial statements prepared in accordance with Canadian    generally accepted accounting principles (GAAP), unless otherwise noted.    Our Q1 2007 Report to Shareholders and Supplementary financial    information are available on our website at rbc.com/investorrelations.          <<      First quarter 2007 highlights compared with the first quarter of 2006(1):        -  Net income of $1,494 million, up 27.6%.      -  Diluted earnings per share (EPS) of $1.14, up 28.1%.      -  Return on common equity (ROE) of 27.3%, up 340 basis points.      -  Revenue of $5,698 million, up $738 million, or 15%.      -  Non-interest expense of $3,067 million, up $316 million, or 11%.      -  Announced a $.06, or 15%, increase to our quarterly dividend.      >>      TORONTO, March 2 /CNW/ - Royal Bank of Canada (RY on TSX & NYSE) reported record net income of $1,494 million for the first quarter ended January 31, 2007, up $323 million, or 27.6%, from a year ago. Diluted EPS were $1.14, up 28.1%. ROE was 27.3%, compared to 23.9% a year ago. This growth was largely attributable to strong earnings across all our business segments including an increase of 31% in RBC Canadian Personal and Business, 27% in RBC Capital Markets and 48% in RBC U.S. and International Personal and Business.    Commenting on the results, Gordon M. Nixon, President & CEO, said, "We have started 2007 with outstanding results that reflect continued investments in all our business segments. Execution of our strategic initiatives is helping us improve market share in Canada and expand our businesses globally."    Total revenue increased $738 million, or 15%, from a year ago primarily due to solid growth in our wealth management and banking businesses driven by expansion, targeted acquisitions and the successful execution of our strategic initiatives. Stronger equity and debt trading results due to significant transactions and increased revenue from certain equity trading strategies also contributed to the increase. These factors were partially offset by lower insurance-related revenue mainly due to the negative impact of the implementation of the new financial instruments accounting standards which was largely offset in insurance policyholder benefits, claims and acquisition expense.    Non-interest expense increased $316 million, or 11%, from a year ago primarily due to higher variable compensation on improved business performance. Higher costs in support of our growth, including increased staffing levels in our distribution network and additional branches, also contributed to the increase.    Total provision for credit losses increased $115 million from a year ago, primarily reflecting a $50 million reversal of the general allowance in the prior year and lower corporate recoveries this quarter. Higher provisions in our personal unsecured credit line, small business and credit card portfolios in the current period also contributed to the increase.    Insurance policyholder benefits, claims and acquisition expense decreased $136 million, or 21%, from the prior year. The decrease mainly reflected the positive impact of the implementation of the new financial instruments accounting standards, and the prior year hurricane-related charge. These factors were partially offset by growth in our European life reinsurance and domestic businesses.    Income tax expense increased $103 million, or 31%, over the prior year largely commensurate with higher earnings before income taxes. The effective income tax rate of 22.3% in the current quarter compares to 22.0% a year ago.    RBC Canadian Personal and Business net income increased $208 million, or 31%, from a year ago. This was largely due to strong growth across all business lines, reflecting the ongoing successful execution of our growth initiatives. The improvement in our results also reflected the prior year hurricane-related charge and a favourable adjustment related to the reallocation of foreign investment capital in the current quarter.    RBC U.S. and International Personal and Business net income increased $48 million, or 48%, from the prior year. In U.S. dollars, net income was up US$40 million, or 45%, largely driven by the successful execution of our growth initiatives including the acquisition of Flag Financial Corporation (Flag).    RBC Capital Markets net income increased $90 million, or 27%, from a year ago largely driven by broad-based growth across most businesses and product categories.    Compared to the fourth quarter of 2006, our consolidated net income increased $232 million, or 18%, and diluted EPS rose $.18, or 19%. This increase largely reflected higher trading results in RBC Capital Markets, strong earnings growth across all business lines in RBC Canadian Personal and Business and solid business growth in RBC U.S. and International Personal and Business due to the successful execution of our growth initiatives including the acquisition of Flag. These factors were partially offset by higher variable compensation primarily in RBC Capital Markets due to stronger business performance.    As at January 31, 2007, the Tier 1 capital ratio of 9.2% was down from 9.5% a year ago, and down from 9.6% at the end of the previous quarter as the increase in risk-adjusted assets related to our lending and trading activities exceeded our strong internal capital generation. The Total capital ratio of 11.2% was down 160 basis points (bps) from 12.8% a year ago, and down 70 bps from 11.9% last quarter.          <<      -------------------      (1) Effective November 1, 2006, results reported on a total consolidated          basis are comparable to results reported as from continuing          operations for the corresponding prior periods.      >>      PRESIDENT & CHIEF EXECUTIVE OFFICER'S MESSAGE    Our earnings this quarter of $1.49 billion were driven by revenue growth in most business lines as we continued to execute growth initiatives in Canada and abroad. This performance reflected the strength of our diverse group of businesses globally.    In Canada, we have expanded our sales force and opened branches to extend our distribution network and build capacity around client relationships. In the U.S., we have completed key acquisitions and are continuing to expand our distribution network to help us pursue our growth initiatives. Globally, we continued to introduce new products and solutions to meet our clients' needs. We also continued to invest in technologies to make doing business with us even easier.  These efforts have helped improve our market share in Canada and grow our businesses globally. We have deployed capital through asset growth in our businesses, targeted acquisitions, dividends and share buybacks, all of which are helping to generate strong returns for our shareholders.    Our 2007 annual objectives were established at the end of 2006 based on our economic and business outlooks. Our first quarter results are tracking well to these objectives:          <<      -------------------------------------------------------------------------                                                                      Q1 2007                                                  2007 Objectives   Performance      -------------------------------------------------------------------------      1. Diluted earnings per share growth              10%+           28.1%      2. Operating leverage(1)                   (greater than) 3%      6%      3. Return on common equity (ROE)                  20%+           27.3%      4. Tier 1 capital ratio(2)                         8%+            9.2%      5. Revenue is based on a taxable equivalent basis          and excludes consolidated variable interest entities (VIEs),          accounting adjustments related to the new financial instruments          accounting standards and Global Insurance revenue. Headline: IdenixPharm 4Q Loss Widens, Revenue Fell 15% >IDIX
Story: DOW JONES NEWSWIRES   Idenix Pharmaceuticals Inc.'s (IDIX) fourth-quarter loss widened to $23.6 million, or 42 cents a share, from $14.4 million, or 27 cents, a year earlier, as revenue fell 15% and costs increased.   The Cambridge, Mass., biopharmaceutical company said Friday revenue decreased to $15.3 million from $18.1 million.   Total expenses rose to $41.4 million from $34.3 million.   Idenix expects 2007 cash, cash equivalents and marketable securities to decrease to a range of $100 million to $110 million from $186.4 million a year earlier.   -Eamon Beltran, 201-938-5400; AskNewswires@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  March 02, 2007 07:43 ET (12:43 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: TIP SHEET: Eaton Vance Health Sciences Fund Bets On Biotech
Story: By Henry Sanderson     Of DOW JONES NEWSWIRES     (This article was originally published Thursday)     NEW YORK (Dow Jones)--The Eaton Vance Worldwide Health Sciences Fund had a tough year last year, as big pharmaceutical stocks did well at the expense of biotechnology companies in which the fund was mainly invested.   But now the fund believes it's positioned for future growth, betting on large biotech stocks despite the risk.   "We believe they are substantially undervalued - their valuations are inconsistent to their growth rates," said Samuel Isaly, who has managed the fund since its inception in 1989.   Biotech stocks slumped in 2006, after a strong rise in 2005, and as investor money flowed to big pharma.   The fund certainly felt the sea change. With total assets of $2.12 billion, the fund has not done particularly well of late.   The Eaton Vance Worldwide Health Sciences Fund has underperformed its specialty health category in the last four years, according to Morningstar Inc.   Last year, the fund's return was flat, at a time when the Standard & Poor's 500 Index recorded a total return of 15.8%. For the year through Wednesday, the fund is down 0.2% compared with the 0.5% decline in the S&P 500. For three years, the fund's annual return is 2.9%, trailing the S&P 500's 9.1% annualized return, Morningstar said.   Amgen Inc. (AMGN) is one of the fund's top picks. Isaly thinks the stock's recent fall - due to disappointing patient studies for its anemia drugs - is unmerited and that the stock is cheap.   Amgen shares have declined about 17% since hitting a 52-week high of $77 in late October, trading recently around $64. The stock now trades around 16 times Amgen's projected 2007 earnings, about half the price-to-earnings ratio of rival biotech Genentech Inc. (DNA), which is another of the fund's top holdings.   "We do expect growth, we like the pipeline," Isaly said.   He is confident about Amgen's experimental osteoporosis drug, denosumab, which is said to increase bone-mineral density. Osteoporosis is a threat for an estimated 44 million Americans and therefore promises to be a huge market if Amgen's drug is approved.   Isaly is also a fan of Fred Hassan, the chief executive of Schering-Plough Corp. (SGP), who has won a lot of respect in the industry and is credited with turning around the company in the last few years.   Isaly said while the earnings growth is off a low base, he sees a return to normal margins and then continued growth.   "It's also bite-sized for a combination with someone else," he adds.   But the fund has also broadened to owning medical-device companies of late, and has hired an analyst just to cover this sector.   Among the top picks in this field are Align Technology (ALGN), a medical-device company that makes removable aligners for teeth, and Lifecell Corp. (LIFC), which designs and makes tissue grafts and blood-cell preservation products.   "Those two companies are specialty companies...but we like them for their specialty nature and their rapid growth," Isaly said.   Align shares have risen about 22% year-to-date. Lifecell reported Thursday its fourth-quarter net income rose 63%, to 18 cents a share, from one year earlier.   The fund, given its name, has also benefited from moving abroad, especially into Japan. The fund has about 25% of its stocks invested overseas.   It holds Japanese drug makers Takeda Pharmaceutical Co. (4502.TO) and Astellas Pharma Inc. (4503.TO). Japanese drug makers have inexpensive valuations, Isaly said, and also benefit from growth in the U.S. market.   Isaly said he has learnt from the fund's losses in 2006. The turnover at the fund has increased, with the fund now quicker to sell stocks that have enjoyed a run-up. But it is primarily a long-term fund.   Isaly has worked in the business for decades, starting off in 1968 in what was then Chase Manhattan as a health-care analyst. He has a research-driven team of five, several of whom have PhDs.   "We think short-term investors have made a mistake to sell [biotech] shares down - the life of the products at these biotechs should be very long," Isaly said.   Morningstar gives the fund a three-star rating out of a possible five stars. The minimum investment for the fund is $1,000 and it has a front-load charge of 5.75%.   -By Henry Sanderson, Dow Jones Newswires; 201-938-4046; henry.sanderson@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  March 02, 2007 07:34 ET (12:34 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: =SMARTMONEY.COM: Constellation Brands Warns Of Tough Year
Story: One-Day Wonder       By Will Swarts     Of SMARTMONEY.COM     (This article was originally published Thursday)    Constellation Brands (STZ)  Share price as of Wednesday's close: $23.46  Share price now: $20.06  Percent change: -14.5%  Volume: 13.3 million shares, daily average 1.8 million       The News     Shares of the world's largest wine company got hammered Thursday after Constellation Brands (STZ) cut its earnings outlook for this year and next year, citing a loss of market share to private-label plonk sold in grocery stores in the United Kingdom.   The stock stumbled 14.5% after management at the Fairport, N.Y.-based company, which produces, imports and distributes wines, beer and spirits from around the world, dropped profit guidance for the just completed fiscal year, ended Feb. 28, to between $1.65 and $1.70 a share, lower than its October estimate of $1.72 to $1.76 a share. Constellation earned $1.59 a share the previous fiscal year. Wall Street analysts were expecting earnings of $1.67 for fiscal 2007, according to earnings tracker First Call.   Constellation's guidance for fiscal 2008 didn't really dazzle either, with its projected range of $1.30 to $1.40 a share well short of the Street's starrier consensus of $1.79. It also announced a $500 million share buyback plan, but didn't set a time frame for its completion.   Several factors contributed to the headache-inducing picture, the biggest of which is that an oversupply from recent bumper harvests in Australia, where the wine-making industry is set up for mass production, has created a grape glut. That's allowed U.K. grocers such as Tesco and Sainsbury's to create good-quality, low-cost wines under their own private labels, cutting into Constellation's shelf space and sales. The U.K. will also increase import taxes next year, hurting Constellation margins. Wine accounts for 45% of Constellation's global sales.   "The challenging environment could remain in place for quite a while," Chief Executive Richard Sands said during a Thursday conference call. "Private label is sucking the normal growth we would have out of our business."   The next hiccup comes from the U.S., where major distributors have been consolidating, leaving only a few players standing. They've subsequently cut their inventory levels, which in turn forces Constellation to adjust and will lead to lower sales. That process will take place mostly over the first half of this fiscal year.   "More inventory was good for our brands, but the brands can be well served at lower [inventory] levels," Sands said. "All of our distributors are really moving to a different model, and I really think this is kind of an industrywide change."   Constellation's portfolio includes Corona Extra, Pacifico, St. Pauli Girl, Black Velvet, Fleischmann's, Mr. Boston, Robert Mondavi, Estancia, Simi, Ravenswood, Blackstone, Banrock Station, Hardys, Nobilo, Alice White, Vendange, Almaden, Arbor Mist, Stowells and Blackthorn.       The Analysis     While the next couple of years could well drive investors to drink, Constellation's got plenty of strengths in its cellar, and the pain will eventually wear off, both analysts and management say.   A devastating drought in Australia will cut this year's grape harvest by 25% to 30%, eventually reducing the surplus that's allowed U.K. grocers to sell so much of their own stingily priced screw-top chardonnay and shiraz.   In the U.S. and Canada, Constellation still expects midsingle-digit sales growth, despite the inventory cut.   "This action does not reflect a change in market trends, as the U.S. wine market remains very healthy and we see the same trends in the Canadian marketplace," Sands said.   Wall Street analysts usually look at stocks from a 12-month horizon, and the anticipated low in the grape cycle has them on the wagon as far as Constellation's prospects. Stifel Nicolaus analyst Mark Swartzberg wrote Thursday that he didn't recommend buying the stock on weakness "in spite of company indications that it expects a strong earnings recovery in fiscal 2009." Deutsche Bank analyst Marc Greenberg cut his 12-month price target to $20 a share from $28 a share, but kept his Hold rating on the stock.   Matthew Reilly, a food and beverage analyst with Morningstar, says the long-term picture is much better. Constellation is a tough company to understand, he cautions, partly because it continues to grow through frequent acquisitions, making its numbers a bit more fluid.   "It's ugly in the U.K. - there's no two ways about that," he says. "Management kind of came out this morning and said it's uglier. Right now, Constellation's in a very tough spot [with U.K. grocers] - they essentially have no leverage. They can't push price increases onto consumers, because retailers can go and start their own brands."   That will take more than 12 months to resolve itself, he cautions.   But he gave Sands, the CEO, credit for using fiscal 2007 results as a baseline for growth in 2009 and beyond. The company would have an easy time looking good on a year-over-year basis in 2009, because it would be using a very bad year as the basis of its comparison. By sticking with a better vintage, it's keeping its eye on real growth.   "That was encouraging to me, their using long-term EPS guidance as the base," Reilly says. "What they're saying is that we can grow from where we are now. I think that they are among the best acquirers in the beverage/alcohol space. They are the largest wine company in the world and do have some significant scale advantages over their peers."       The Bottom Line     Though Thursday took plenty of fizz out of a stock that's already down 12% over the last 52 weeks, this may be the time to uncork your opportunistic buying habits if you can cellar a short-term outlook.   "I think it's time to buy the stock, but if you're looking for a 12-month pop, this is not your stock," Reilly says. "I think a lot of the bad news is out. Certainly, the U.K. situation could get worse before it gets better. When you're talking about an oversupply of an agricultural product, like grapes, there's no telling how long it will take to go out."   But if the share buybacks go as planned, and the recently acquired Svedka brand of Swedish vodka provides a platform for high-end spirit sales, then this stock could ripen nicely.   "We recognize that fiscal 2008 provides some tough challenges to our business environment," Sands said, but high-single-digit to low-teens growth won't be too far off.   For more information and analysis of companies and mutual funds, visit SmartMoney.com at http://www.smartmoney.com/     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  March 02, 2007 07:34 ET (12:34 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: Dutch Grp Calls For Investigation Into ABN Holder TCI
Story: AMSTERDAM (Dow Jones)--A Dutch association which aims to improve corporate financial reporting has asked the Dutch regulator AFM to probe a hedge fund that calls for a breakup of ABN AMRO Holding (ABN) for possible insider trading and share price manipulation.   The Children's Investment Fund, or TCI, last week called for a strategic change at ABN AMRO, including a possible breakup of the Dutch banking group.   "SOBI suspects this market speculator (TCI) to have built a stake of unknown size in ABN AMRO and then enriched itself at the cost of small shareholders through market moving comments," the Stichting Onderzoek Bedrijfsinformatie said in a statement.   AFM said it received SOBI's letter and added "that the situation gets our full attention," without elaborating further.   A spokesman for TCI declined to comment.   -By Nicolas Parasie, Dow Jones Newswires; nicolas.parasie@dowjones.com; 31 20 6260770     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  March 02, 2007 06:37 ET (11:37 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: : San Diego International Airport Launches New Collaborative Version of PASSUR Community Relations Software
Story: New Version of AirportMonitor Allows Airport to Communicate in Real Time       GREENWICH, Conn., March 2 /PRNewswire-FirstCall/ -- Megadata Corporation (OTC Bulletin Board: MDTA) announced today that San Diego International Airport (SDIA) has become the first customer to launch the new collaborative version of PASSUR(R) AirportMonitor(TM), the airport industry's leading web- based airspace education tool for airport communities.     "We wanted to reach out to our noise-impacted community in an innovative, proactive way," said Dan Frazee, Deputy Director, Airport Noise Mitigation. "The enhanced version of AirportMonitor allows us to communicate the 'whys' and 'what's' of noise events immediately, online, and within a compelling visual display of the airspace. It takes communication, dialogue and community interaction to a new level."     "Our best product innovations come from our customers, and this is no exception," said Jim Barry, President and CEO of Megadata, which owns PASSUR. "This new ability for airports to communicate in real time with their local neighbors on our visual airspace platform is part of the Collaborative Decision Making trend we believe is the future of aviation - bringing together all industry constituents onto a commonly accessed web platform fed by accurate, reliable, live information to support quicker, better decisions."     AirportMonitor is the pioneering community airspace awareness tool, which provides an interactive display of air traffic and flight information in and around the terminal airspace, designed for airport websites. It enables residents to view traffic in "near-live" and replay mode, with a host of user- friendly online tools designed to promote airspace education, answer questions about specific flight behavior, and promote openness and trust between residents and the airport.          The new version of AirportMonitor, a patented product, includes:        -- Instant airport messaging - based on the existing collaborative         decision making technology developed for PASSUR Portal(TM) and         OPSnet(TM), this allows the airport to instantly communicate about         airspace conditions which may be affecting residents' noise quality.         Management of these messages is easily done through PASSUR online         password access messaging tools, requiring no Airport IT involvement.        -- "My Home Locator" - providing AirportMonitor users the ability to         pinpoint their home on the AirportMonitor background map by entering         their address, allowing for a more effective assessment of airspace         and flight activity in relation to the user's residence.        About Megadata     Megadata owns and operates PASSUR, a national network of multiple, live flight information sources feeding a single, integrated database known for independent, complete, timely, and accurate information and solutions for the aviation industry. It includes the unique network of PASSUR radar installations in the US, Canada, Europe, and Asia. The company's principal business is the delivery of data, application software, and web-delivered collaborative decision tools to the aviation industry and organizations that serve, or are served by, the aviation industry. Megadata distributes its products through a direct sales force, and through premier aviation decision- support technology firms.     Visit Megadata's web site at http://www.passur.com for updated products, solutions and PASSUR news.     The forward-looking statements in this news release relating to management's expectations and beliefs are based on preliminary information and management assumptions. Such forward-looking statements are subject to a wide range of risks and uncertainties that could cause results to differ in material respects, including those related to customer needs, budgetary constraints, competitive pressures, the success of airline trials, the profitable use of the Company's owned PASSURs located at major airports, the Company's maintenance of above average quality of its product and services, as well as potential regulatory changes. Further information regarding factors that could affect the Company's results is contained in the Company's SEC filings, including the October 31, 2006 Form 10-K.          Contact:      Ron Dunsky      (203) 622-4086      (917) 587- 9672      rondunsky@passur.com    SOURCE  Megadata Corporation       /CONTACT: Ron Dunsky of PASSUR for Megadata, +1-203-622-4086 or +1-917- 587-9672, or rondunsky@passur.com      /Web site: http://www.passur.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  March 02, 2007 08:00 ET (13:00 GMT)

Headline: : Walgreen Co. February Sales Increase 13.4 Percent
Story: DEERFIELD, Ill.--(BUSINESS WIRE)--March 02, 2007--   Walgreen Co. (NYSE: WAG)(NASDAQ: WAG) had February sales of $4,302,310,000, an increase of 13.4 percent from $3,794,742,000 for the same month in 2006. Sales in comparable stores (those open at least a year) rose 8.6 percent.     February pharmacy sales increased 14.3 percent, while comparable pharmacy sales increased 10.0 percent. Total prescriptions filled at comparable stores increased 5.7 percent. Pharmacy sales accounted for 64.4 percent of total sales for the month.     Comparable store front-end sales increased 6.1 percent during February.     There were no calendar day shifts in February that impacted comparable pharmacy sales.     Fiscal year 2007 sales for the six months were $26,641,267,000, up 15.5 percent from $23,063,476,000. Comparable store sales for the fiscal year to date increased 9.3 percent.     Walgreens opened 30 stores during February, including three relocations, acquired two stores and closed two. At Feb. 28, the company operated 5,638 drugstores in 48 states and Puerto Rico, versus 5,156 a year ago.     Please note: Monthly sales numbers are preliminary and unaudited. Comparable stores are defined as those locations open for at least 12 consecutive months without closure for seven or more consecutive days and without a major remodel or a natural disaster in the past 12 months. Relocated and acquired stores are not included as comparable stores for the first 12 months after the relocation or acquisition.        CONTACT: Walgreen Co.               Media Contact: Carol Hively, (847) 914-2923               Investor Contact: Rick Hans, CFA, (847) 914-2385               Internet: http://www.walgreens.com        SOURCE: Walgreen Co.  Copyright Business Wire 2007     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  March 02, 2007 08:00 ET (13:00 GMT)
