Headline: Ashtead Group Appoints Christopher Cole Non-Exec Chairman
Story: Edited Press Release     LONDON (Dow Jones)--Ashtead Group announced Friday that Christopher Cole who has been serving as interim non-executive Chairman of the Group since Oct. 27, 2006 has been appointed as the Group's permanent non-executive Chairman.   The company said that Cole, Chief Executive of WSP Group plc has been a director of the Ashtead Group since January 2002.   Hugh Etheridge has been appointed as senior independent non-executive director.   Etheridge has been a director of the Ashtead Group since January 2004.   Michael Burrow has been appointed as a non-executive director of the Group.   Burrow was formerly Managing Director of the Investment Banking Group of Lehman Brothers Europe Limited.     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  March 02, 2007 06:23 ET (11:23 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: : Commerce Planet Posts Record Revenue and Net Income for Full Year 2006; Profits in 2006 Surge to $8.7 Million
Story: GOLETA, Calif., March 1 /PRNewswire-FirstCall/ -- Commerce Planet, Inc. (OTC Bulletin Board: CPNE) an online media company and its wholly owned subsidiaries filed their annual 10KSB today and reported $8.7 million in profit for fiscal 2006.  The 2006 profit represents a complete turn around from fiscal 2005's net loss of ($6.3) million.  Commerce Planet reported consolidated revenue of $27.5 million and combined revenues, including inter-segment transactions, of $34.8 million for 2006.  Consolidated revenues for 2005 were $7.3 million representing year-over-year growth of 275%. Earnings for the year ending December 31, 2006 were $0.20 per weighted average share versus ($0.17) per weighted average share for fiscal 2005.     Michael Hill, CEO, stated, "we are pleased to release our fourth consecutive quarter and first complete year of profitability.  We attribute our significant revenue growth and high level of profitability to the 2006 strategic initiatives that were successfully executed upon in support of last year's Commerce Planet re-brand.  The Company organically developed or acquired three new subsidiary businesses, Legacy Media, Inc. (www.LegacyMedia.com), Interaccurate, Inc. (www.Interaccurate.com) and OS Imaging, Inc. (www.OSImaging.com).  It is believed, the services of these subsidiaries leveraged with the power of the Consumer Loyalty Group, Inc. (www.ConsumerLoyalty.com) branded products and services are responsible for the dramatic turn around in the Company's performance."     Consumer Loyalty Group has expanded its product offering and diversified its revenue stream from its original core product, www.OnlineSupplier.com to a suite that now encompasses eight highly profitable products which include amongst others, www.InvestingInSuccess.com, www.BuyDiscount.com and www.SearchDiscount.com. Since mid-2006, these products have been deployed through the Commerce Planet infrastructure which was designed to consolidate sales and support services, leading to increased net profit margins.     The planned focus for 2007 is to expand the subsidiaries' customer base of B2B clientele.  Based upon the success of Consumer Loyalty Group, unrelated third party businesses have expressed strong interest in utilizing the Commerce Planet business model to promote and support their own third party branded products and services.  Interaccurate, Inc. owned www.MyOnlineChat.com has already executed agreements with several new customers to begin 2007.     Hill also stated, "we anticipate that 2007 will be another strong year for our Company and we intend on capitalizing upon our upward momentum.  We have made several capital investments designed to support this continued growth trend.  Our order volume has dramatically increased over the last few months and we believe our re-occurring billable model will produce enhanced profit margins."        About Commerce Planet, Inc. (www.commerceplanet.com)     Commerce Planet, Inc. (OTC Bulletin Board: CPNE) is a publicly traded, internet-based media company. The Company offers online media products, lead generation services and direct marketing tools to its client partners. Commerce Planet offers an internet turnkey media solution through its network of wholly owned subsidiaries, which include Consumer Loyalty Group, Inc., Legacy Media Inc., OS Imaging, Inc. and Interaccurate, Inc.     Each subsidiary of Commerce Planet specializes in a specific niche of the online media industry.  Their combined services are designed to address the needs of client partners, including membership loyalty programs, direct response consumer marketing, affiliate list management, email deployment, live chat software-based services, direct phone sales and customer service, and printing services.     To find out more about Commerce Planet, Inc. (OTC Bulletin Board: CPNE), visit our website at www.commerceplanet.com.  The Company's public financial information and filings can be viewed at www.sec.gov.        Forward Looking Statements     Except for the historical information contained herein, the matters set forth in this press release, including statements as to management's intentions, hopes, beliefs, expectations, representations, projections, plans or predictions of the future, are forward-looking statements within the meaning of Section 27A of the Securities Act of 1933, Section 21E of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, and the "safe harbor" provisions of the Private Securities Litigation Reform Act of 1995.  Such statements include that the Company believes it is quickly becoming a top internet media company and expects to continue to increase its market share in this industry.  This release contains forward-looking statements, including, without limitation, statements concerning our business and possible or assumed future results of operations.  Our actual results could differ materially from those anticipated in the forward-looking statements for many reasons including: our ability to continue as a going concern, adverse economic changes affecting markets we serve; competition in our markets and industry segments; our timing and the profitability of entering new markets; greater than expected costs, customer acceptance of our products and services or difficulties related to our integration of the businesses we may acquire; and other risks and uncertainties as may be detailed from time to time in our public announcements and SEC filings.  Although we believe the expectations reflected in the forward-looking statements are reasonable, they relate only to events as of the date on which the statements are made, and our future results, levels of activity, performance or achievements may not meet these expectations.  We do not intend to update any of the forward-looking statements after the date of this document to conform these statements to actual results or to changes in our expectations, except as required by law.    SOURCE  Commerce Planet, Inc.       /CONTACT: Michael Hill, Chairman/CEO of Commerce Planet, Inc., +1-805-964-9126 ext. 3134, mhill@commerceplanet.com      /Web site: http://www.commerceplanet.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  March 02, 2007 07:00 ET (12:00 GMT)

Of these, three were on its Alternext small-to-medium-sized business index, which now has 83 companies representing a total market capitalization of EUR4 billion.   Euronext's derivatives exchange, Euronext.liffe, traded 67 million futures and options contracts in February, up 15% from the same month last year, the exchange operator said.   Company Web site: http://www.euronext.com   -By Digby Larner, Dow Jones Newswires; +33 1 4017 1748; digby.larner@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  March 02, 2007 02:46 ET (07:46 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: UPDATE: Sumitomo, Nippon Paper, Rengo Seal Alliance Deal
Story: (Updates with tie-up details, background.)       By Kazuhiro Shimamura     Of DOW JONES NEWSWIRES     TOKYO (Dow Jones)--Sumitomo Corp. (8053.TO), Nippon Paper Group Inc. (3893.TO) and Rengo Co. (3941.TO) said Friday they have agreed on a business tie-up and cross-shareholding to strengthen their paperboard and corrugated cardboard business.   The agreement by Sumitomo, a trading company, and the two paper makers follows their memorandum of understanding signed in November last year.   The three companies said in a joint statement Rengo will buy a 3% stake in Nippon Paper by March 31, 2008, while Nippon Paper will purchase a 5% stake in Rengo during the same period.   Sumitomo will transfer half of its 3% stake in Rengo to Nippon Paper. It will receive a 0.6% stake in Nippon Paper in return.   Paper manufacturers are struggling to increase their bargaining power in Japan and lift sale prices of their paper products in the face of fierce competition from lower-priced paper from elsewhere in Asia.   Under the alliance, the three companies will cooperate in raw materials procurement, overseas business expansion, and the packaging product business.   They will also coordinate their scrapping and building of paperboard facilities, as well as study initiatives in distribution, research and technology-sharing.     -By Kazuhiro Shimamura, Dow Jones Newswires; 813-5255-2929; kazuhiro.shimamura@dowjones.com   -Edited by Rob Robison     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  March 02, 2007 03:10 ET (08:10 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: Egypt's Orascom Makes Bid For Brasil Telecom - Report
Story: SAO PAULO (Dow Jones)--Orascom Telecom, a branch of a large Egyption conglomerate, this week made a bid for shares held by controllers in Brasil Telecom Participacoes (BRP), Brazil's third largest telecom, said the local Folha de S. Paulo newspaper Friday.   According to the report, Orascom made offers to each of the four major shareholding groups in Brasil Telecom, Citigroup (C), a group of local pension funds, Telecom Italia SpA (TI) and Brazil's Banco Opportunity.   Brasil Telecom is a fixed-line operator in the north, center-west and south of Brazil. It also offers wireless services.   According to the report, the Orascom offer caught Citigroup and the pension funds, the currrent controllers of Brasil Telecom by surprise. That's because last week they had offered $450 million for Telecom Italia's shares, according to executive linked to Telecom Italia.   The Folha de S. Paulo goes on to say that Orascom may have made a bid for Citigroup and the funds' share in Tele Norte Leste Participacoes (TNE), or Telemar, Brazil's biggest telecom company.   Analysts have recently talked of the possibility of Brasil Telecom and Telemar merging operations at some level.   Orascom is the largest telecommunications operator in the Middle East.      -By Alastair Stewart, Dow Jones Newswires; 55-11-3145 1479; alastair.stewart@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  March 02, 2007 07:24 ET (12:24 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: : CDoor Corp. Completes Acquisition of Wanxin Bio-Technology Limited and Changes Name to Sinobiomed Inc.
Story: SHANGHAI, CHINA -- (MARKET WIRE) -- 03/02/07 --    CDoor Corp. ("CDoor" or the "Company") (OTCBB: CDCX) (which is now named "Sinobiomed Inc.") is pleased to announce that on January 12, 2007, the Company completed a Share Purchase Agreement, dated December 21, 2006, entered into between the Company, Wanxin Bio-Technology Limited ("Wanxin") and all the shareholders of Wanxin (the "Share Purchase Agreement") whereby the Company acquired 100% of the issued and outstanding shares in the capital of Wanxin, through the issuance of 1,750,000 shares of our common stock in aggregate to the shareholders of Wanxin.     Wanxin is the sole shareholder Manhing Enterprises Limited, a company organized under the laws of Hong Kong, and Manhing Enterprises Limited is the registered owner of 82% of the capital of Shanghai Wanxing Bio-pharmaceuticals Co., Ltd. In addition, Shanghai Wanxing Bio-pharmaceuticals Co., Ltd. is the registered owner of 50.33% of the capital of Shanghai Wanxing Bio-science Cosmetic Co., Ltd.     Shanghai Wanxing Bio-pharmaceuticals Co., Ltd. ("Shanghai Wanxing") specializes in the development of genetically engineered recombinant protein drugs and vaccines, and currently has 10 products approved or in development, which respond to a wide range of diseases, including malaria and hepatitis. The development of Shanghai Wanxing's malaria vaccine candidate is supported by the World Health Organization (WHO) and the Program for appropriate Technology in Health's (PATH) Malaria Vaccine Initiative (MVI), which to date has received more than $250 million in funding from the Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation. Malaria threatens some two billion people and kills and estimated one million annually worldwide; there is currently no vaccine. Shanghai Wanxing's candidate vaccine received a US patent in September 2006.     The Company's annual meeting of stockholders was held on March 1, 2007, where the shareholders of the Company among other actions approved the name change from CDoor Corp. to Sinobiomed Inc. Effective March 2, 2007, the Company will begin trading on the OTCBB under the name SinoBiomed Inc. and new symbol "SOBM".     In addition, to the name change, the Company has effected a forward stock split of its issued and outstanding shares on a basis of 40 new shares for each one (1) old share, which is effective March 2, 2007.     Also on March 1, 2007, the shareholders of the Company elected the following individuals as directors: Mr. Ka Yu, Mr. Ban-Jun Yang, Mr. Robert Ip, Mr. Chris Metcalf and Dr. Kim Kiat Ong. The new board of directors then appointed Mr. Ban-Jun Yang as the President and CEO, Mr. Ka Yu as the Secretary and Treasurer and Mr. Asher Zwebner as the CFO.     The acquisition of Wanxin Bio-Technology Limited will fit into the overall strategy of the Company as it shifts strategic focus towards the rapidly expanding Chinese biopharmaceutical industry. The new management of the Company as well as the management of Shanghai Wanxing is well qualified to lead the Company towards further expansion in the rapidly expanding Chinese and global biopharmaceutical industries. Some of the key management of Shanghai Wanxing includes:     - Mr. Ban-Jun Yang, newly appointed President of the Company, is the President and CEO of Shanghai Wanxing. He has led Shanghai Wanxing since 1996, bringing together a world-class research team and establishing an integrated R&D and production facility that meets global standards.     - Dr. Tom Chen, Chief Medical Officer of Shanghai Wanxing, also serves as a consultant on PATH's process development and manufacturing programs for Shanghai Wanxing's malaria vaccine. He has also served as the Director of process Development for Plasma Derivatives for the American Red Cross.     - Dr. Zhifang Cao, Director and Deputy General Manager of Shanghai Wanxing, integrates an extensive clinical background with a market-driven approach to identifying and developing bio-pharmaceuticals with strong therapeutic as well as profit potential. He has extensive international experience and is leading Shanghai Wanxing's clinical trials of the malaria vaccine.     - Dr. Weiqng Pan, Advisor of Shanghai Wanxing, is an internationally recognized researcher and the inventor of the patented plasmodium fusion antigen that Shanghai Wanxing is developing and testing as a blood-stage malaria vaccine.        ABOUT SHANGHAI WANXING BIO-PHARAMCEUTICALS CO., LTD.     Shanghai Wanxing is a leading Chinese developer of genetically engineered recombinant protein drugs and vaccines. Based in Shanghai, Shanghai Wanxing currently has 10 products approved or in development: two on the market, one awaiting approval, four in clinical trials and three in research and development. The Company's products respond to a wide range of diseases and conditions, including malaria, hepatitis, surgical bleeding, cancer, rheumatoid arthritis, diabetic ulcers and burns, blood cell regeneration.     Shanghai Wanxing has proven expertise in recombinant protein drug development. This category of drugs - developed using biotechnology -- are valued for their safety, lower cost of production and efficacy compared to chemical drugs. These biopharmaceuticals are becoming one of the fastest growing segments in the global pharmaceutical industry.     China is projected to become one of the world's major biotech players in the next 15 years. The country's biopharmaceutical industry has witnessed rapid growth since the late 1980s and is continuing to expand with more than 30 percent annual revenue growth, according to Advances in Biopharmaceutical Technology in China, September 2006, a report from BioPlan Associates (www.bioplanassociates.com) and the Society for Industrial Microbiology.     Shanghai Wanxing also has proven expertise in recombinant protein manufacturing technology and a patented low-cost, high-yield production process to enhance bioactivity and guarantee the highest levels or purity. It also has one of China's largest capacities for the manufacture of recombinant bio-products. Shanghai Wanxing also has strong strategic alliances with leading Chinese research hospitals and institutes for collaborative development of patented and patentable techniques and treatments. This domestic strength is complemented by established relationships with internationally recognized health researchers and organizations.     For further information please refer to the Company's filings with the SEC on EDGAR available at www.sec.gov.     FORWARD LOOKING STATEMENTS This news release may include "forward-looking statements" regarding CDoor Corp., and its subsidiaries, business and project plans. Such forward looking statements are within the meaning of Section 27A of the Securities Act of 1933, as amended, and section 21E of the United States Securities and Exchange Act of 1934, as amended, and are intended to be covered by the safe harbor created by such sections. Where CDoor Corp. expresses or implies an expectation or belief as to future events or results, such expectation or belief is believed to have a reasonable basis. However, forward-looking statements are subject to risks, uncertainties and other factors, which could cause actual results to differ materially from future results expressed, projected or implied by such forward-looking statements. CDoor Corp. does not undertake any obligation to update any forward looking statement, except as required under applicable law.        Contacts:  SinoBiomed Investor Relations  Toll Free: 1-866-588-0829  Email: info@sinobiomed.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  March 02, 2007 03:15 ET (08:15 GMT)

Headline: UPDATE: Smit Rotterdam Tug Crew Strike Suspended
Story: (Updates an item published at 1018 GMT with details of delays to shipping in Rotterdam.)   AMSTERDAM (Dow Jones)--A strike by crews of Port of Rotterdam tug operator Smit International NV (38380.AE) has been suspended, labor union FNV Bondgenoten said Friday.   The strike over pay by Smit's tugboat crews started Wednesday. The union said the strike has been postponed until "early next week" to give other businesses at the port the opportunity to clear the backlog caused by the strike.   The union said that if Smit doesn't meet its demands next week, the crews will resume the strike.   Smit wasn't immediately available for comment.   A Port of Rotterdam official told Dow Jones that 16 ships were waiting to leave the port at the time the strike was suspended, with 20 waiting to enter. He said departing ships would be cleared first before allowing incoming vessels to berth.   On an average day, 85 ships enter and leave the port of Rotterdam, the largest in Europe.   Smit has a market share of around 70% in the harbor. The other two tug companies are Kotug, with a 25% market share, and Fairplay.     -By Stefan Simons and Nick Heath, Dow Jones Newswires; +31 20 626 0770; stefan.simons@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  March 02, 2007 06:08 ET (11:08 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: : AmericanWest Bancorporation to Present at the West Coast Financial Services Conference Hosted by Sandler O'Neill & Partners
Story: SPOKANE, Wash.--(BUSINESS WIRE)--March 02, 2007--   AmericanWest Bancorporation (NASDAQ: AWBC) announced today that President and CEO Robert M. Daugherty is going to participate in the Washington Community Bank panel discussion during the West Coast Financial Services Conference, hosted by Sandler O'Neill & Partners. The panel discussion and Company presentation is scheduled for Tuesday, March 6, 2007, and will begin at 9:45 am PST, and may be accessed live over the internet or by telephone using the following instructions:           Webcast: www.sandleroneill.com           Telephone: 866-634-2275 (no passcode required)     An archived webcast of the presentation will be available through AmericanWest Bancorporation's website beginning March 7th for 30 days.     AmericanWest Bancorporation is a bank holding company whose principal subsidiary is AmericanWest Bank, a community bank with 46 financial centers located in Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho, as well as loan production offices in Ellensburg, Washington, and South Jordan, Utah. For further information on the Company or to access Internet banking, please visit our web site at www.awbank.net.        CONTACT: AmericanWest Bancorporation               Robert M. Daugherty, President and CEO               or               Patrick J. Rusnak, Chief Operating Officer               509-232-1536        SOURCE: AmericanWest Bancorporation  Copyright Business Wire 2007     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  March 02, 2007 05:00 ET (10:00 GMT)

Headline: Boeing On Cusp Of Restarting C-17 Line Shutdown Early Steps
Story: By Rebecca Christie     Of DOW JONES NEWSWIRES     (This article was originally published Thursday)     WASHINGTON (Dow Jones)--Boeing Co. (BA) is on the cusp of restarting early steps to shut down its C-17 cargo jet production line, since the Pentagon did not meet a March 1 deadline for committing to new orders, according to analysts and others following the program.   Last month, Boeing said it needed a new commitment or else it would start laying off suppliers. Now the company has scheduled a Friday afternoon call with reporters to discuss the production line's future. Earlier Friday, it is set to meet with employees.   This points toward a repeat of the supplier cutbacks Boeing made last August. Boeing stopped work on some of its long-lead items, but work resumed once Congress added 10 planes into the Air Force budget.   If Boeing makes a similar move Friday, it will ratchet up tension between the company and the government. Air Force leaders would like the C-17 production line to stay open, although they do not yet have a defined plan for buying more planes.   Current orders put Boeing on track to close the line in mid-2009. But each plane requires about 34 months of lead time to make its way through the supply chain.   So far, the Air Force has asked Congress for just two extra planes, in an "unfunded priority" list submitted recently. But in the long run, some service officials would like to buy many more C-17s so they can retire the Air Force's aging C-5 jumbo cargo jets.   "The big question the Air Force is now putting to Boeing is whether it is willing to spend its own money in order to keep the C-17 line and supplier base intact with the understanding that the service will probably ask for many more planes in the future, starting in 2009," said Lexington Institute defense analyst Loren Thompson.   Boeing said Thursday that the company would answer questions about the production line during Friday's conference call. The call was billed as an "update on Boeing's C-17 Globemaster III program" in an advisory to reporters.   Goodrich Corp. (GR) and privately held Vought Aircraft Industries Inc. are two suppliers that would be first affected by any decision to shut down the supply chain. Last year, Vought said it was able to mitigate the effects of Boeing's work stoppage by shifting personnel to other C-17 parts that were still in the pipeline.   Boeing has been marketing the plane around the world. But non-U.S. customers like Canada and the U.K. typically buy only a few planes at a time, not enough to keep the line open.   -By Rebecca Christie, Dow Jones Newswires; 202-862-9243; rebecca.christie@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  March 02, 2007 07:36 ET (12:36 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: Accredited Home Lenders Files To Delay 10-K >LEND
Story: DOW JONES NEWSWIRES   Accredited Home Lenders Holding Co. (LEND) said Friday that it couldn't file its annual report on time because of the resources and effort that it devoted to completing a significant acquisition in the fourth fiscal quarter of 2006.   According to a filing with the Securities and Exchange Commission, the company expects that it will file the 10-K by March 16.   As reported, Accredited Home Lenders completed its stock-and-cash purchase of Aames Investment Corp. in October of 2006.   Shares of the San Diego-based mortgage company closed Thursday at $22.53.     -Ingrid Pedrick Lehrfeld, Dow Jones Newswires; 202-862-1361     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  March 02, 2007 07:26 ET (12:26 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: Taiwan Chunghwa Telecom:Dealing With Cap Surplus Top Priority-2
Story: Analysts have long urged Chunghwa Telecom, Taiwan's sole integrated telecommunications company and its largest telecom firm by revenue, to return the excess capital to shareholders.   Ho Chen told Dow Jones Newswires in November the company was considering the payment of a special dividend, but such a move would require a change in law as Taiwan's listed firms aren't allowed to do this.   Chunghwa Telecom has now ruled out this option and "our paid-in capital will remain around NT$95 billion," Ho Chen said Friday. The firm's paid-in capital is NT$96.68 billion.   "But we still plan to adjust our capital in the best way for shareholders," he said.   Ho Chen said a capital reduction isn't on the agenda because of the large investment needed to build the firm's "next generation network," as well as government opposition.   Under the next generation network plan, Chunghwa Telecom plans to spend more than NT$50 billion during the next five years to upgrade its fixed-line copper-wire network to fiber-optic cables, which will allow faster connection times and new services, such as high-definition television.   The government is concerned about the negative perception a capital reduction by a U.S.-listed Taiwan firm could create, Ho Chen said.   He said shareholders would need to approve any capital-adjustment plan at the annual general meeting in June, the agenda for which must be finalized by mid-April.   Separately, Ho Chen said Chunghwa Telecom's mobile and fixed-line data services and its enterprise business group would remain its main revenue-growth drivers this year.   "We hope financial institutions will be our mainstream corporate clients," Ho Chen said.   In January, Chunghwa Telecom and Cathay Financial Holding Co. (2882.TW), Taiwan's largest financial holding firm by assets, formed an alliance to cross-sell each other's products to staff and clients.   Chunghwa Telecom is scheduled to issue its audited 2006 results and 2007 outlook March 27.     -By Alex Pevzner, Dow Jones Newswires; 8862-2502-2557; alex.pevzner@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  March 02, 2007 02:41 ET (07:41 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: 2nd UPDATE: Rank FY Pft -15%, Satified With 07 Trading
Story: (This updates an item that ran at 0738 GMT with additional result details and CEO comments.)     By Lilly Vitorovich   Of DOW JONES NEWSWIRES     LONDON (Dow Jones)--U.K. gambling company Rank Group PLC (RNK.LN) Friday reported a 15% drop in annual underlying group operating profit, hit by smoking bans in Scotland and Spain as well as higher rent.   Turning to the current trading year, Rank said it is "satisfied with the overall trading performance of the group in the eight week period since the start of the year."   Chief Executive Ian Burke said during 2006 the company either agreed or completed asset sales totaling more than GBP1.1 billion, including the sales of Deluxe Film, Hard Rock and US Holidays operations.   As a result of the group's restructure, management have "transformed Rank into a focused gaming business," Burke said.   "We see long-term growth prospects in the U.K. gaming market and we believe that, with our integrated model of bingo, casino and betting with both retail and on-line distribution, we are well placed to benefit from the predicted increases in consumer spending on mainstream gaming.   "In the short-term we recognize that our businesses face a number of challenges, most notably the smoking ban which will be effective across the whole of Britain from July this year. Our strategy is to take vigorous action to meet these challenges while retaining our long-term focus on the growth opportunities for Rank," Burke said in a statement.   Underlying group operating profit before items from continuing operations - the key figure analysts track when assessing the group's trading performance - fell to GBP77.4 million for the year ended Dec. 31, compared with the analyst consensus of GBP78.5 million. Forecasts ranged broadly from GBP71.2 million to GBP93.2 million.   That compares with underlying group operating profit before items from continuing operations of GBP90.5 million for 2005.   Rank's gaming operations are made-up of Mecca Bingo hall chain, Grosvenor Casinos unit as well as the internet and telephone betting division Blue Square in the U.K.. The group also has 11 bingo clubs in Spain and two casinos in Belgium, according to its corporate website.   On Feb. 14, Rank said it plans to close nine Mecca Bingo clubs in England and Wales, in line with its strategy of improving the quality of its clubs portfolio ahead of the introduction of the smoking bans in England and Wales later this year.   At the end of last year, Rank announced the proposed sale of Hard Rock for $965 million to the Native American Semiannual tribe of Florida. At the time, Rank said the sale is expected to be completed on March 5.   Rank is hoping to bolster its gambling operations by bidding for a number of 17 new U.K. casino licenses, which include the country's first supercasino, following the passing of the Gambling Act 2005, CEO Burke said.   The bidding process is likely to require a significant level of investment, Rank cautioned.   Scotland's ban on smoking in enclosed public places, which was introduced in March 2006, contributed to a 15% fall in like-for-like revenue from the Scottish bingo clubs from the time of ban's introduction, Rank said.   Rank said the roll out of a partial ban in Spain, which only permits smoking in up to 30% of gaming areas, in September caused some disruption to its bingo clubs business Top Rank Espana.   Smoking bans will be introduced in Wales and England in April and July, respectively.   In 2006, total revenue from continuing operations rose 3.7% to GBP549.6 million from GBP529.8 million a year earlier.   Rank shares were down 4.50 pence, or 2.1%, at 213 pence in a higher U.K. market. Based on Thursday's closing share price of 218 pence, the stock has fallen around 9.1% over the past 12 months on concerns about the effect of the smoking bans on Rank's operations.   The company declared a final dividend of 4 pence, down sharply from 10.3 pence a year ago, taking the full year dividend to 6.0 pence. That compares to a full year dividend of 15 pence in 2005.     Company Web site: http://www.rank.com     -By Lilly Vitorovich, Dow Jones Newswires; 44-0-207 842 9290; lilly.vitorovich@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  March 02, 2007 03:55 ET (08:55 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: Quilmes '06 Results Convince Hldrs To Seek Higher AmBev Bid
Story: (This article was originally published Thursday)       By Serena Saitto   Of DOW JONES NEWSWIRES     BUENOS AIRES (Dow Jones)--Argentine brewer Quilmes Industrial SA (LQU) reported Thursday better than projected 2006 annual results, further convincing a group of its minority investors to seek a higher price for their shares than that offered by Brazilian brewer AmBev (ABV).   AmBev, part of Belgian brewer group InBev (INB.BT), already owns 91.4% of Quilmes share capital. In November, it launched a tender offer to buy up the remaining shares at a price of $67.07 per American Depository Receipt.   Quilmes' 2006 earnings before interest, taxes, depreciation and amortization, or EBITDA, grew 23% to $473 million, on a 22% annual sales growth to $1.2 billion. AmBev said earlier Thursday that Quilmes contributed to the 69% growth in its 2006 net profit, which reached $556 million.   Against this backdrop, Quilmes minority shareholders reiterated Thursday that they are very happy to own the stock.    "We would tender only if AmBev offered a fair price, which we believe is significantly higher," said Amit Bhatiani, a portfolio manager at Duma Capital Partners, a New York-based fund which holds 1.1 million Class B shares in Luxembourg-based Quilmes.   Indeed, Quilmes 2006 EBITDA came well above the $407 million forecast made by Citigroup, AmBev's financial adviser in the tender offer.   Bhatiani's comments echo those made by other minority shareholders after AmBev extended Tuesday the bid period until March 16 to give shareholders - as they requested - time to review the company's 2006 year-end earnings.   Two other U.S. investment firms, Punch Card Capital and Arnhold and S. Bleichroeder Advisers LLC - which own 1.75 million and 1.3 million of Quilmes Class B shares, respectively - reiterated Thursday they don't intend to tender their shares. Based on the numbers they provided, the three shareholders have enough firepower to prevent the tender offer from succeeding.   During a conference call held Thursday to discuss the earnings results, an AmBev executive said the firm will wait until the current offer expires before taking any decisions.   "The current offer is in progress, and it was just extended for 15 days so that shareholders could further analyze the offer," said Luiz Fernando Edmond, AmBev's director for Latin America. "We are going to wait until the offer ends to decide what to do next."   The original tender period was meant to expire on Feb. 28, the day before Quilmes released its results. Through Feb. 26, only 1.9 million Class A and 1 million Class B shares had been tendered. AmBev said it will only complete the offer if more than 3.9 million Class B shares, equivalent to about 2 million of the firm's American Depository Receipts, are tendered.   This is also the threshold which Ambev needs, under Luxembourg Takeover Law, to squeeze out Quilmes minorities with an obligatory tender offer.   Fueled by Thursday's results, the minority shareholders now insist that AmBev increase the bid price, which they define as unfair. They said it was rubber-stamped by the Ambev-dominated Quilmes board without the review of an independent financial committee.   Despite the turmoil in global markets which sent most stocks lower Thursday, Quilmes' share price closed 1.6% higher at $71.65 - well above Ambev's offer price. The shares are up 8% over the last three months.   Furthermore, Punch Card Capital's portfolio manager Norbert Lou found in the company's results further evidence of what the shareholders call Quilmes' poor corporate governance.   "The board must have known these results for at least a few weeks, and instead of entering into negotiations with AmBev to get a better bid price, they recommended minority shareholders to tender, and tried to withhold the results release until the offer closed," said Lou.   Duma Capital's Bhatiani noted that if AmBev's parent company, InBev, wants to merge with U.S. giant Anheuser-Busch Cos. Inc. (BUD) - as indicated by unconfirmed reports - it would be better to solve this issue first.   "A merger with Anheuser-Busch would likely make the InBev franchise (including AmBev and Quilmes) more valuable, so it makes sense for AmBev to take care of this squeeze-out first," said Bathiani.     -By Serena Saitto, Dow Jones Newswires; 5411-4311-3125; serena.saitto@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  March 02, 2007 07:31 ET (12:31 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: : Smith Micro to Present at the 4th Annual Montgomery Technology Conference
Story: CEO to Discuss Market Positioning and 2007 Growth Strategies       ALISO VIEJO, Calif., March 2 /PRNewswire-FirstCall/ -- Smith Micro Software, Inc. (Nasdaq: SMSI), a developer and marketer of a wide range of software and services for the wireless market, today announced that William W. Smith, Jr., President and CEO, will present at the 4th Annual Montgomery Technology Conference on Tuesday, March 6, 2007 at 2:30 p.m. PT.  The conference is being held March 6-7, 2007 at the Fairmont Miramar in Santa Monica, CA.  The conference will be attended by securities analysts, fund managers and institutional investors.     Smith Micro will host a live webcast of the conference presentation that can be accessed at the following web address, http://www.wsw.com/webcast/mtc/smsi/ or from the Investor Relations section of the Smith Micro Web site at www.smithmicro.com.  The link can also be used to access a replay of the presentation, beginning approximately one hour after the presentation ends, and will remain available for 90 days.  More information about the Montgomery Technology Conference is available at: http://www.monty.com        About Smith Micro Software:     Smith Micro Software, Inc., headquartered in Aliso Viejo, CA, is a developer and marketer of wireless communications and utility software products for multiple OS platforms.  The company designs easy-to-use software for personal computing and business solutions around the world.  With a focus on wireless and broadband technologies and the Internet, the company's products and services enable wireless communications, security and device management, file and image compression, digital image and music management. Smith Micro's complete line of products is available through retail stores, Value-Added Resellers (VARs), Smith Micro's consumer, enterprise, wireless sales groups and the company's websites.  Smith Micro's common stock trades on The NASDAQ Global Market(R) under the symbol SMSI.     Safe Harbor Statement: This release may contain forward-looking statements that involve risks and uncertainties, including without limitation forward-looking statements relating to the company's financial prospects and projections, the company's ability to increase its business and the anticipated timing and financial performance of new products and potential acquisitions.  Among the important factors that could cause actual results to differ materially from those in the forward-looking statements are new and changing technologies, customer acceptance of those technologies, fluctuations or cancellations in orders from customers, new and continuing adverse economic conditions, and the company's ability to compete effectively with other software companies.  These and other factors discussed in the company's filings with the Securities and Exchange Commission, including its filings on Forms 10-K and 10-Q, could cause actual results to differ materially from those presented in any forward-looking statements.  Smith Micro assumes no obligation to update any forward-looking statements to reflect events or circumstances occurring after the date of this press release.     Smith Micro and the Smith Micro logo are trademarks or registered trademarks of Smith Micro Software, Inc.  All other trademarks and product names are the property of their respective companies.    SOURCE  Smith Micro Software, Inc.       /CONTACT: Bruce T. Headline: 2nd UPDATE:Belgacom FY06 Net Pft +1.5%, Rocky 07 For Mobile
Story: (This updates an item published at 0714 GMT with analyst information.)     By Anne Jolis   Of DOW JONES NEWSWIRES     BRUSSELS (Dow Jones)--Telecommunications company Belgacom SA (Belg.BT) Friday posted a stronger-than-forecast 1.5% rise in full-year net profit, but warned of a rocky outlook for 2007 driven by fierce competition and regulatory pressures.   Belgacom said sees a sharp earnings downturn in its mobile communications unit Proximus for the current year, news which sent it shares lower in early trading.   At 0817 GMT, Belgacom shares were down 1.9%, or EUR0.60,  to EUR31.90 in a broadly unchanged Belgian market.   Net profit came in at EUR973 million, up from EUR959 million the previous year, on strong ADSL high-speed Internet market share. That easily beat the average expectation of four analysts polled by Dow Jones Newswires for a 2.3% drop.   Total sales for the year were up 7.1% to EUR6.1 billion, exceeding analysts' forecasts for a 6.9% rise.   Earnings before interest, tax, depreciation and amortization or Ebitda rose 2.4% to EUR2.1 billion last year. However, the company said that excluding one-offs from 2005 and adjusted for new entities in 2006, group Ebitda decreased 4% to EUR2.1 billion.   "In a highly competitive market, Belgacom has more than held its ground in 2006," the company said in a statement, crediting Belgacom's strong market position for delivering high-speed internet.   Still, the company predicted a rocky 2007, particularly for its mobile communications division Proximus. It said Proximus' Ebitda margin for 2007 could drop to 45%, citing "intense competition and regulatory pressure".   Dexia Bank analyst Rob Goyens said the "disappointing outlook will take center stage and will lead to further downward revisions of estimates."   Goyens said he is keeping his reduce recommendation and EUR32.7 target price on the stock for now, but will likely lower the target price later Friday.   Focusing now on converging its various services to help capture more market share, Belgacom said it plans to reduce its workforce by roughly 1,500 people by 2011, on top of the collective deal the company reached in 2005.   Belgacom said its board of directors will in April propose an ordinary dividend of EUR552 million, which comes to EUR1.6 per share, on top of the interim dividend paid in December.   Belgacom shares rose sharply in the last quarter of 2006, reaching a peak of nearly EUR36 in January, driven by takeover speculation and relatively low valuation. But the stock, along with most other European incumbents, has taken a nosedive in recent weeks due to weak earnings expectations, and fear of the European Union's regulator pinch.     Company Web Sites: http://www.belgacom.com     -By Anne Jolis Dow Jones Newswires; +32 2 741 1488; anne.jolis@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  March 02, 2007 03:19 ET (08:19 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: : U.S. Army-Northrop Grumman Team Opens Soldiers' Access to Intelligence Data Through Distributed Common Ground System-Army (DCGS-A)
Story: U.S. Army-Northrop Grumman Team Opens Soldiers' Access to Intelligence Data Through Distributed Common Ground System-Army (DCGS-A)   BALTIMORE, March 2, 2007 (PRIME NEWSWIRE) -- A team led by Northrop Grumman Corporation (NYSE:NOC) has developed and demonstrated technology for users of the U.S. Army's battlefield networks that allows access to actionable intelligence from virtually anywhere in the field.   Northrop Grumman and teammates General Dynamics, Lockheed Martin, and Science Applications International Corp. were chartered by the U.S. Army to integrate multiple, existing intelligence, surveillance and reconnaissance (ISR) systems into a single multi-intelligence system called the Distributed Common Ground System - Army (DCGS-A). This team is officially named the DCGS-A Industry Team, with Northrop Grumman acting as the system integrator.   The team successfully conducted several DCGS-A, Version 4, Proof of Concept (PoC) demonstrations at Ft. Belvoir, Va.; Ft. Huachuca, Ariz.; and Northrop Grumman laboratory facilities in Baltimore from August through December 2006. These efforts resulted in a new model for moving battlefield data and intelligence in support of tactically deployed combat commanders. The system uses queried/access methodology, and is designed to operate within a distributed-operations, enterprise environment.   Participating systems included the Army's Joint STARS Common Ground System, the Joint STARS Work Station, the Human Domain Work Station, the Digital Terrain Support System, the Integrated Meteorological System, the V3 Joint Intelligence Operations Capability - Iraq (JIOC-I) work suites and selected components of the Navy's DCGS Multi-Intelligence Segment integrated with the DCGS Integration Backbone (DIB).   Data interchange within the PoC was achieved using a combination of a commercially available Enterprise Service Bus and the U.S. Department of Defense DIB. The demonstration adhered to DoD's guidance to remain consistent with DIB standards, be interoperable with existing components and be facilitated by the use of DIB architecture.   The Northrop Grumman-led DCGS-A Industry Team has continued to expand the Army's net-cetric enterprise capability with DCGS-A, Version 4. Previous DCGS versions included the Army's Version 2, Joint Intelligence Operations Capability-Iraq (JIOC-I) and the DCGS-A Version 3, battle command interoperability.   "Our team is committed to designing and delivering the best capabilities for producing actionable intelligence rapidly available to the warfighter," said Ken Wilson, vice president of C4ISRT Networked Systems for Northrop Grumman's Electronic Systems sector. "Our approach makes the best of the Army's investment in ISR technologies. By working with our government and industry partners, we will continue to integrate 'best of breed' applications and services from multiple sources in an open service-oriented architecture environment."   Northrop Grumman Corporation is a $30 billion global defense and technology company whose 120,000 employees provide innovative systems, products, and solutions in information and services, electronics, aerospace and shipbuilding to government and commercial customers worldwide.  -0-  CONTACT:  Paul Cabellon            Northrop Grumman Electronic Systems            (410) 765-7192            paul.cabellon@ngc.com   (END) Dow Jones Newswires  March 02, 2007 06:04 ET (11:04 GMT)

Headline: : Per Peterson, M.D., Ph.D., Joins Board of Directors of Invitrogen Corporation
Story: CARLSBAD, Calif.--(BUSINESS WIRE)--March 02, 2007--   Invitrogen Corporation (Nasdaq:IVGN) today announced that Per Peterson, M.D., Ph.D. has been appointed to its board of directors, effective March 1, 2007. Dr. Peterson recently retired as Chairman, Research & Development, at Johnson & Johnson. As Chairman, he had responsibility for the Corporate Office of Science and Technology, the Enterprise-wide R&D Council, and Johnson & Johnson's cell therapy research activities. Dr. Peterson was also a member of the Executive Committee of Johnson & Johnson.     "We are very pleased to be adding someone of Dr. Peterson's reputation and experience to our board," said Greg Lucier, Invitrogen's Chairman and Chief Executive Officer. "As a leader in the life sciences, we are focused on creating technologies that accelerate biological understanding. In his role as director, Dr. Peterson will provide invaluable insight, advice and guidance to ensure Invitrogen remains on the cutting edge of innovation that makes a difference to researchers."     Dr. Peterson joined Johnson & Johnson in 1994 as Vice President, Drug Discovery, of the R.W. Johnson Pharmaceutical Research Institute. He was named Group Vice President of the Pharmaceutical Research Institute in April 1998 and its President in November 1998. In 2000, Dr. Peterson was named Chairman, Research & Development, Pharmaceuticals Group. Dr. Peterson became a Member of the Executive Committee in 2001.     Prior to joining Johnson & Johnson, Dr. Peterson spent eight years at Scripps Research Institute in La Jolla, CA, where he headed the Division of Molecular Immunogenetics before being appointed Chairman of the Department of Immunology in 1987. He had earlier served as Director of the Wallenberg Laboratory, as well as professor of cell biology at the University of Uppsala, Sweden.     Born in Kalmar, Sweden, Dr. Peterson received his B.M. in Medicine and his Ph.D. in Medicinal Biochemistry from the University of Uppsala, Sweden.       About Invitrogen     Invitrogen Corporation (Nasdaq:IVGN) provides products and services that support academic and government research institutions and pharmaceutical and biotech companies worldwide in their efforts to improve the human condition. The company provides essential life science technologies for disease research, drug discovery, and commercial bioproduction. Invitrogen's own research and development efforts are focused on breakthrough innovation in all major areas of biological discovery including functional genomics, proteomics, bioinformatics and cell biology -- placing Invitrogen's products in nearly every major laboratory in the world. Founded in 1987, Invitrogen is headquartered in Carlsbad, California, and conducts business in more than 70 countries around the world. The company is celebrating 20 years of accelerating scientific discovery. Invitrogen globally employs approximately 5,000 scientists and other professionals and had revenues of more than $1.26 billion in 2006. For more information, visit www.invitrogen.com.       Safe Harbor Statement     Certain statements contained in this press release are considered "forward-looking statements" within the meaning of the Private Securities Litigation Reform Act of 1995, and it is Invitrogen's intent that such statements be protected by the safe harbor created thereby. Forward-looking statements include, but are not limited to: 1) Dr. Petersons' guidance will help Invitrogen grow the company. Potential risks and uncertainties include, but are not limited to, the risks: a) Dr. Petersons' service on the Board of Directors may not impact Invitrogen's ability to accelerate academic research or innovation, as well as other risks and uncertainties detailed from time to time in Invitrogen's Securities and Exchange Commission filings. Headline: Hard Rock International 2006 Oper Profit Rose 19%
Story: DOW JONES NEWSWIRES     Hard Rock International, the restaurant operator being sold by Rank Group (RNK.LN) to the Seminole Tribe of Florida, said 2006 operating profit rose 19% to $74.8 million, with revenue up 11% to $502 million.   It saw continued growth and improvement in all four business divisions comprising company-owned cafes, franchise cafes, hotels and casinos.   Same-cafe sales rose 6.5% on improved food, beverage and merchandise sales.   The sale to the Seminole tribe is due to close on March 5.   -Steve Goldstein; 415-439-6400; AskNewswires@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  March 02, 2007 06:13 ET (11:13 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: China OKs Shinko Securities US$50 Mln QFII Quota -2-
Story: Shinko Securities will be allowed to use the money to buy shares and bonds traded in China's markets under the Qualified Foreign Institutional Investors program.   The QFII program, which was launched mid-2003, allows approved foreign institutional investors to trade yuan-denominated A-shares listed on exchanges in Shanghai and Shenzhen.   The China Securities Regulatory Commission has approved 52 QFIIs. The unaudited interim consolidated financial statements have been prepared by management in accordance with Canadian Generally Accepted Accounting Principles ("GAAP"), using the same accounting policies as those set out in note 1 to the consolidated financial statements for the year ended December 31, 2005. Headline: Ethanol, Vopak Depot In Spotlight As UK Fuel Woes Widen
Story: (This article was originally published Thursday)   By Rebecca Geach and Adam Smallman   Of DOW JONES NEWSWIRES     LONDON (Dow Jones)--The source of contaminated gasoline that has affected hundreds of U.K. vehicles over the last 48 hours remains unclear, as supermarkets in effect said they weren't to blame for the damage done and ethanol entered the spotlight as a possible factor.   A spokeswoman for the U.K.'s Trading Standards Institute said they hoped for test results Friday and they were probing the use of ethanol.   The focus has fallen on Greenergy PLC, a U.K. biofuels supplier and established fuel trader Vopak.   Vopak's depot in Essex, east of London, the area thought to be the source of contaminated fuel.   Vopak's Netherlands-based spokesman Lars Walder told Dow Jones Newswires that checks had been made to make sure normal handling and storage procedures had been followed and there had been no deviation from its normal processes.   Walder said its Essex terminal stored fuel for Greenergy.   Greenergy said in a statement on its Web site: "So far we have conducted extensive tests on the fuel" supplied to Tesco PLC (TSCO.LN) and Wm Morrison Supermarkets PLC (MRW.LN).   "We have found it is fully compliant" with relevant U.K. standards. "We take quality very seriously and we are doing everything we possibly can to find out what the issue is and whether it is related to us," it said.   If ethanol is identified as a playing a role in the problems, it will be a blow to the image of the nascent biofuels industry.   Currently, biofuel producers are suffering from a double-whammy of high input prices - oilseeds, corn, wheat - and lower crude oil prices.   Thursday, U.K.-based bioethanol developer Ensus Group told Dow Jones Newswires that it has pulled its planned initial public offering on the U.K.'s Alternative Investment Market, citing lack of investor interest.   Questions are also being raised about the strain biofuels are putting on the global food chain and the environmental benefits they offer.     Supermarkets Deny Responsibility     Some of the U.K.'s leading supermarkets reiterated that they had no evidence that they supplied contaminated gasoline to customers.   A statement from Tesco Thursday said: "As soon as we were alerted to a potential problem we carried out extensive tests on current and past batches of unleaded fuel, including from some of the affected vehicles, and so far have not discovered any abnormalities or contamination whatsoever."   It added: "Whilst we cannot currently trace any problem back to Tesco fuel we will of course continue to urgently work with our supplier to identify what might be behind it."   Its statement said the problems appear to be linked to retail outlets in the southeast served by a refinery in Essex, near London.   A spokesman for Tesco added: "It is unfair to single out Greenergy as the supplier of the contaminated fuel. We have many suppliers."   He added a storage facility, which he didn't identify, supplied fuel to Tesco, Morrison's, Jet-branded fuel outlets, Total SA (TOT), Wal-Mart Stores Inc. (WMT)-owned Asda, Texaco and Sommerfields PLC.   U.S.-based agriculture giant Cargill Inc. holds a 25% stake in Greenergy subsidiary Greenergy Biofuels Ltd., supplying it with rapeseed oil for biodiesel. Greenergy's Web site says also says Barclays Capital has an equity investment.   Greenergy's primary fuels storage depot is at West Thurrock, Essex.   A spokeswoman for Asda said it had received up to 20 complaints from customers who claim they bought contaminated fuel from their retail outlets. She added that Greenergy wasn't a supplier of gasoline for Asda.   Customers of J Sainsbury PLC (JSAIY) are also complaining of contaminated fuel.   In a statement a spokesman said: "We have investigated this issue with our suppliers and are confident that Sainsbury's fuel isn't contaminated.   "Our distribution channels for the affected areas are different from those of our competitors."   The complaints are concentrated in the south east of England but according to the BBC Web site incidents of contaminated gasoline are now being reported in Aberdeen, Manchester, Newcastle and Preston.   Morrisons said Thursday it had carried out tests on their gasoline but so far found no contamination, adding its unleaded fuel met the required standards.   The BBC said it had received over 3,500 e-mails from motorists who said their vehicles may have been affected, most from London and the east and southeast of England.   In the U.K. there is a limit of 5% biofuels within gasoline.   -By Rebecca Geach and Adam Smallman, Dow Jones Newswires; +44 (0)20 7842 9262; adam.smallman@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  March 02, 2007 05:07 ET (10:07 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: : JumpTV Provides Leading Ethnic Television to Joost(TM)
Story: TORONTO -- (MARKET WIRE) -- 03/02/07 --    JumpTV Inc. (AIM: JTV) (TSX: JTV) (www.jumptv.com), the world's leading broadcaster of ethnic television over the Internet, has partnered with Joost(TM) (www.joost.com), the world's first broadcast-quality, free-to-air Internet television service, to make a significant portion of JumpTV's library of video-on-demand television content available on a series of exclusive JumpTV-branded ethnic television vertical "channels" on the Joost platform.     JumpTV currently broadcasts live over the Internet thousands of popular television programs, news, music and sporting events from 270 channels fromover 70 countries around the world on a subscription and advertising supported basis.     The initial JumpTV offering on Joost will feature programming regularly gathered from JumpTV's digitally rights compliant international television roster. The first JumpTV "channels" on Joost will feature popular Spanish-language series from Colombia, Chile and Peru, in addition to Arabic-language comedy, drama and news programs from some of the leading broadcasters in the Middle East.     JumpTV will be adding new programming on a daily or weekly basis, and intends to launch several more channels on Joost in other languages, including but not limited to Romanian, Turkish, Russian and Bengali.     Commenting on the partnership, Kaleil Isaza Tuzman, president and chief executive officer of JumpTV International stated, "We see Joost as a uniqueand important distribution/programming partner. Like us, the Joost team innately understands the power of viral, high-affinity long-tail content --for example, JumpTV's ethnic TV programming. Given the track record of the Joost founders, we believe that the Joost platform could be as transformational for online television as their previous ventures have been."     Yvette Alberdingkthijm, executive vice president of content strategy and acquisition of Joost said, "Content owners like JumpTV, with a diverse offering of channels that feed the global appetite for streamed online content, are a perfect match for Joost. Partnering with JumpTV will allow our viewers access to the best in global television programming in an Internet rights-compliant fashion."     Mike "JB" John-Baptiste, head of global distribution for JumpTV, said, "Joost, like JumpTV has been securing programming from key licensors of television content, so we were pleased to see that they recognized our singular commitment and leadership in ethnic television."     JB continued, "JumpTV is committed to providing our TV broadcaster content partners the broadest audience on the Internet as possible -- whether through ISPs, mobile carriers or Internet portals."     The partnership between Joost and JumpTV involves sharing of advertising revenues on the JumpTV-branded channels.        About JumpTV     JumpTV (AIM: JTV) (TSX: JTV) is the world's leading subscription-based broadcaster of ethnic television over the Internet. With over 270 channels from 70+ countries, JumpTV delivers its subscribers full-screen news, sports and entertainment content on a real-time basis from all corners of the globe. JumpTV has subscribers from over 100 countries who view channels on the JumpTV online network via high-speed Internet connections on their home computers, laptops, Internet-enabled televisions and mobile phones.        About Joost(TM)     Joost(TM) provides a new way of watching TV that combines the best of full-screen television entertainment with online interactive and community benefits to bring an unprecedented selection of video content to viewers anytime, anywhere. Joost is based on a state-of-the-art, secure, peer-to-peer streaming technology. To learn more about Joost or to become a beta-tester, visit www.joost.com.        Forward looking statement     Certain statements herein may constitute forward-looking statements, including those identified by the expressions "may", "will", "should", "could", "anticipate", "believe", "plan", "estimate", "potential", "expect", "intent" and similar expressions to the extent they relate to the Company or its managements. These statements reflect the Company's current expectations and are based on information currently available to management. These forward-looking statements are subject to a number of risks, uncertainties, assumptions and other factors that could cause actual results or events to differ materially from current expectations, includingthe matters discussed under "Risk Factors" contained in the Company's prospectus (admission document) dated August 1, 2006 and the matters discussed under "Risk Factors" contained in the Company's final short form prospectus dated February 19, 2007. These forward-looking statements are made as of the date hereof, and the Company assumes no obligation to update or revise them to reflect new events or circumstances. Headline: Newspaper Owner Buffett: Industry's Economics 'Crumbling'
Story: By Richard Gibson     Of DOW JONES NEWSWIRES     (This article was originally published Thursday)     Investor Warren Buffett, whose Berkshire Hathaway Inc. (BRKA, BRKB) counts the Buffalo (N.Y.) News among its properties, vowed Thursday to "stick with the News" even though he believes the newspaper industry's "underlying economics are crumbling."   "...Almost all newspaper owners realize that they are constantly losing ground in the battle for eyeballs," Buffett wrote in his annual letter to Berkshire shareholders.   "Simply put, if cable and satellite broadcasting, as well as the Internet, had come along first, newspapers as we know them probably would never have existed," he said.   Nonetheless, Buffett predicted that "noneconomic individual buyers of newspapers" are likely to emerge, "just as we have seen such buyers acquire major sports franchises.   "Aspiring press lords should be careful, however," he went on. "There's no rule that says a newspaper's revenues can't fall below its expenses and that losses can't mushroom."   Buffett called "a free and energetic press ... a key ingredient for maintaining a great democracy." And he said he hoped that "some combination of print and online will ward off economic doomsday for newspapers. ... But the days of lush profits from our newspaper are over."   -By Richard Gibson, Dow Jones Newswires; 515-282-6830; dick.gibson@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  March 02, 2007 07:35 ET (12:35 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: French Regions Should Take 5%-10% EADS Stake - Newspaper
Story: PARIS (Dow Jones)--The administrative head of France's Midi-Pyrenees region said French regions should take a 5% to 10% holding in European Aeronautic Defence & Space Co. NV (5730.FR), or EADS, to balance the country's interests in the defense company in the event of a similar move by German regions.   Martin Malvy said in Le Figaro, "We have the impression that the Germans have been stronger in the (Airbus restructuring) debate than the French."   He said a holding would be symbolic and that French regions could muster EUR150 million to invest in EADS.   Newspaper Web site: http://www.lefigaro.fr     -By Paris Bureau, Dow Jones Newswires; 33-1-4017 1740     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  March 02, 2007 01:38 ET (06:38 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: E.ON: No CNMV, SEC Permission To Buy Endesa Shares -3-
Story: Earlier Friday the CNMV said the German utility required its permission to buy Endesa shares in the open market, adding that such permission, if granted, would be announced publicly.   A CNMV spokeswoman made the statement but she declined to comment any further on the issue, in response to an earlier report in Spanish daily Cinco Dias.   The report cited market sources as saying E.ON had requested such permission and the CNMV has already accepted the request.   Madrid-based Endesa, Spain's largest utility by market value, is the object of a EUR41 billion tender offer launched by German firm E.ON.   If successful, the deal would result in the largest ever cross-border utility takeover in the continent's history. The tie-up would create a global energy giant with more than 100,000 employees, 50 million customers in Europe, the U.S. and Latin America.   However, E.ON's bid was faced with unexpected opposition when Italian firm Enel SpA (EN) earlier this week said it had acquired a 9.99% stake in Endesa. Since then, Enel has also acquired derivatives that may take its Endesa stake to 22%, which would significantly lower E.ON's chances of a successful takeover of Endesa.   E.ON's bid is also opposed by Spanish construction to renewable energy conglomerate Acciona SA (ANA.MC), which is currently Endesa's largest shareholder with a 21% stake.   E.ON's bid is conditional in part on getting control of at least 50.01% of Endesa and lifting of a bylaw that caps voting rights at 10% of Endesa's share capital.   Company Web site: http://www.eon.com   -By Jan Hromadko, Dow Jones Newswires; +49 69 29 725 503; jan.hromadko@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  March 02, 2007 07:19 ET (12:19 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: Sumitomo, Nippon Paper, Rengo: Agree On Mutual Shareholding
Story: TOKYO (Dow Jones)--Sumitomo Corp. (8053.TO), Nippon Paper Group Inc. (3893.TO) and Rengo Co. (3941.TO) said Friday they have agreed on a business tie-up and cross-shareholding to strengthen their paperboard and corrugated cardboard business.   The three companies said in a joint statement Rengo will buy a 3% stake in Nippon Paper by March 31, 2008, while Nippon Paper will purchase a 5% stake in Rengo during the same period.   Sumitomo Corp. will transfer half of its 3% stake in Rengo to Nippon Paper. It will receive a 0.6% stake in Nippon Paper in return.     -By Kazuhiro Shimamura, Dow Jones Newswires; 813-5255-2929; kazuhiro.shimamura@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  March 02, 2007 01:50 ET (06:50 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: 2nd UPDATE: Sanyo Laptop Battery Recall Raises More Concerns
Story: (Updates with news of KDDI battery recall.)     TOKYO (Dow Jones)--Sanyo Electric Co.'s (6764.TO) latest battery recall is small in scale, but raises concerns of a future financial hit for the company as it deals with an investigation into its accounting practices and attempts to revive its struggling business operations.   Late Thursday, Lenovo Group Ltd. (0992.HK), the Chinese computer maker that bought IBM's PC business, said it would recall 205,000 lithium-ion laptop batteries made by Sanyo because they could overheat after being struck at a certain angle.   Analysts say this won't have a big financial effect on Sanyo, as laptop batteries are a minor business for the company and the recall is relatively limited. The stock market seemed to agree - the company's shares closed down 2.6% at Y184 Friday, not far off the 2.1% fall in the Topix index of electric appliance companies.   But the issue's drop highlights the fact that Sanyo's core battery operations, one of its few profitable businesses, can be a risky area. And it is more bad news for Goldman Sachs Group Inc. (GS) and the other investors that last year invested Y300 billion to bail out the company.   On Friday, Japanese mobile carrier KDDI Corp. (9433.TO) said it would offer software upgrades and battery recalls for about 635,000 handsets as the Sanyo batteries in them could swell and lose their charge. A KDDI spokeswoman said the problems occurred in two phone models and were caused by a software glitch related to recharging capacity.   The struggling Osaka-based electronics maker is still completing a recall of about 1.3 million lithium-ion battery packs for mobile phones made by Mitsubishi Electric Corp. in use with domestic carrier NTT DoCoMo Inc. The companies are negotiating the costs of that recall, which may include restitution to Mitsubishi Electric for lost phone sales.   The latest recall also evokes memories of the massive ongoing recall of 9.6 million lithium-ion battery packs made by Sony Corp. for laptops sold globally by makers such as Lenovo, Apple Inc., and Dell Inc. Sony, which initially said the recall was limited and wouldn't have a big effect on its finances, will take a Y51 billion hit for its replacement program, which works out to about Y5,000 per battery.   Sanyo has said the laptop batteries being recalled are limited to certain models that overheat when struck in a specific way. It also makes laptop batteries for other firms in addition to Lenovo, though it doesn't publicize which companies.   If no further problems arise and Sanyo's costs are similar to Sony's, that would equal about Y1 billion. For this fiscal year, the company projects a group net loss of Y50 billion as it continues to suffer from competition and falling prices in its main product lines.   Sanyo is under pressure to quickly turn around its financial standing from Goldman and partner investors Daiwa Securities Group Inc. and Sumitomo Mitsui Financial Group. The investors received preferred shares for their bailout last year, which can in March be converted to enough common shares to give them managerial control of the company.   Sanyo is also under investigation by authorities for its accounting practices and said earlier this week it may revise its earnings for the four fiscal years through March 2004. Local media have reported Japanese regulators won't file criminal complaints against the company.       -By Jay Alabaster, Dow Jones Newswires; 813-5255-2929; jay.alabaster@dowjones.com   -Edited by Tomoko Hosaka     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  March 02, 2007 03:23 ET (08:23 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: UPDATE: Rank FY Underlying Grp Oper Pft -15%, 07 Trading OK
Story: By Lilly Vitorovich   Of DOW JONES NEWSWIRES     LONDON (Dow Jones)--U.K. gambling company Rank Group PLC (RNK.LN) Friday reported a 15% drop in annual underlying group operating profit, hit by smoking bans in Scotland and Spain as well as higher rent.   Turning to the current trading year, Rank said it is "satisfied with the overall trading performance of the group in the eight week period since the start of the year."   Chief Executive Ian Burke said during 2006 the company either agreed or completed asset sales totaling more than GBP1.1 billion, including the sales of Deluxe Film, Hard Rock and US Holidays operations.   As a result of the group's restructure, management have "transformed Rank into a focused gaming business," Burke said.   "We see long-term growth prospects in the U.K. gaming market and we believe that, with our integrated model of bingo, casino and betting with both retail and on-line distribution, we are well placed to benefit from the predicted increases in consumer spending on mainstream gaming.   "In the short-term we recognize that our businesses face a number of challenges, most notably the smoking ban which will be effective across the whole of Britain from July this year. Our strategy is to take vigorous action to meet these challenges while retaining our long-term focus on the growth opportunities for Rank," Burke said in a statement.   Underlying group operating profit before items from continuing operations - the key figure analysts track when assessing the group's trading performance - fell to GBP77.4 million for the year ended Dec. 31, compared with the analyst consensus of GBP78.5 million. Forecasts ranged broadly from GBP71.2 million to GBP93.2 million.   That compares with underlying group operating profit before items from continuing operations of GBP90.5 million for 2005.   Rank's gaming operations are made-up of Mecca Bingo hall chain, Grosvenor Casinos unit as well as the internet and telephone betting division Blue Square in the U.K.. The group also has 11 bingo clubs in Spain and two casinos in Belgium, according to its corporate website.   On Feb. 14, Rank said it plans to close nine Mecca Bingo clubs in England and Wales, in line with its strategy of improving the quality of its clubs portfolio ahead of the introduction of the smoking bans in England and Wales on July 1.   At the end of last year, Rank announced the proposed sale of Hard Rock for $965 million to the Native American Semiannual tribe of Florida. At the time, Rank said the sale is expected to be completed on March 5.   The company declared a final dividend of 4 pence, down sharply from 10.3 pence a year ago.   Rank shares closed at 218 pence Thursday, valuing the company at GBP1.18 billion. The stock has fallen around 9.1% over the past 12 months. Spread bettor Cantor predicts the stock will open down Friday at 212 pence to 213 pence per share.     Company Web site: http://www.rank.com     -By Lilly Vitorovich, Dow Jones Newswires; 44-0-207 842 9290; lilly.vitorovich@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  March 02, 2007 02:38 ET (07:38 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.
