Headline: Germany's OHB Tech Would Consider Purchase Of Airbus Plant -2
Story: Airbus said Wednesday it may sell two of its German sites and is looking for a partner for its Nordenham plant.   However, German press reports following the announcement said it was unclear how many plants Airbus would consider selling. The company operates seven plants in Germany.   OHB could be interested in the Nordenham plant, at which body and airfoil parts for Airbus planes are made. At Varel, Airbus produces components for its planes.   Wednesday, Germany's Diehl Stiftung & Co. Kg told Dow Jones Newswires it would asses an offer to buy Airbus operations at Laupheim, if an offer was being made.   Diehl is a supplier of Airbus and operates a joint venture with Thales SA (12132.FR) for the aerospace industry.     (MORE TO FOLLOW) Dow Jones Newswires  March 02, 2007 07:56 ET (12:56 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: Ericsson Chosen As Solution Provider For Greek Digital City-2-
Story: Edited Press Release     Ericsson said it is the prime integrator for this turnkey FTTx backbone telecommunications infrastructure project, which will bring broadband services to the  population. Ericsson is also the sole supplier of switching, WiFi systems and a metropolitan area fiber optic network, as well as related telecom services, such as consulting,  deployment, systems integration and customer support, until 2008.   The fiber optic Metropolitan Area Network (MAN), extending about 15 kilometers throughout the city, will link  a range of buildings including the town hall, hospitals, schools and universities, cultural and sporting centers, and  trade chamber, as well as the police force, fire service, tax authority, meteorological institute and semi-industrial park of the city. The MAN will be linked to both the National Network of Public  Administration (Syzefxis) and the internet, providing high-speed, high-quality broadband services.     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  March 02, 2007 05:12 ET (10:12 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: ING Appoints New Head Of Europe Leveraged Finance,Sponsor Grp
Story: LONDON (Dow Jones)--ING Wholesale Banking has expanded its leveraged finance and sponsor coverage group with the appointment of Thomas Lagemann to head the group's coverage of Germany, Switzerland and Austria, the Dutch bank said Friday.   Lagemann, who is a managing director, will lead the expansion effort from Frankfurt. He takes up his new post with immediate effect and reports to Pierre Chabrelie, Global Head of Leveraged Finance and Sponsor Coverage.   Lagemann joins from ING's Telecom & Media Finance team.   ING's Leveraged Finance and Sponsor Coverage Group has dedicated teams based in the U.K., the Netherlands, Spain, France, Belgium, Italy, the Czech Republic, the U.S., Hong Kong, Singapore and Japan.   -By Kate Haywood, Dow Jones Newswires, +44 (0) 20 7842 9315, kate.haywood@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  March 02, 2007 07:39 ET (12:39 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: : Premier Buick-Pontiac-GMC Dealership Opens in Georgia
Story: Carl Black Buick-Pontiac-GMC Unveils New Design       KENNESAW, Ga., March 2 /PRNewswire/ -- The first all-new Buick-Pontiac-GMC showroom in Georgia will open its doors here Friday.     Carl Black Buick-Pontiac-GMC at 1110 Roberts Blvd., opens with a completely new, modern exterior and interior design.     I'm proud to participate in this great occasion," said John Larson, general manager of GM's Buick-Pontiac-GMC divisions in Detroit. "Carl Black is part of a growing number of dealerships that have combined the three brands under one roof. Dealer Mike Bowsher is also one of the first to invest in an all-new facility image design."        Channel Strategy     In 2002, GM announced a strategy to group the Buick, Pontiac and GMC brands into one preferred distribution channel. Currently, about 1,600 dealers are aligned, and together they sell about 65 percent of the volume for the three brands.     "We believe this provides a competitive advantage for our dealers," Larson said. "The Buick- Pontiac-GMC channel allows GM to optimize each brand by developing distinct yet complementary vehicles that reduce product overlap, broaden the appeal of each model and reach new customers."          Each brand in the channel has it own defining characteristics:        * Pontiac: Athletic, bold designs with great performance        * Buick: Premium vehicles that offer classic, timeless designs, and        exquisite levels of craftsmanship and high quality        * GMC: Professional Grade trucks, SUVs and crossovers engineered to        superior capabilities and innovative features.        New Facility Design     The Buick-Pontiac-GMC team worked with dealer input, GM Design Staff and a nationally recognized design firm - Pavlik Design Team of Ft. Lauderdale, Fla. - to come up with the design. The new showroom exudes a clean, modern feel, with distinct areas for the three brands.     The dealership's exterior features a black, white and gray color scheme, constructed of brushed metal panels with bright metal inserts, and black metal accents.     The interior design includes a modern balance of light cherry wood and a ceramic tile floor. The interior also takes several of the visual design elements from the exterior and incorporates them into the interior, such as the arch over the receptionist's desk.     The overall result is an efficient facility design program that provides Buick-Pontiac-GMC dealers with consistent brand identification, as well as a modern and pleasing environment for their customers.     General Motors Corp. (NYSE: GM), the world's largest automaker, has been the global industry sales leader for 76 years. Founded in 1908, GM today employs about 284,000 people around the world. With global headquarters in Detroit, GM manufactures its cars and trucks in 33 countries. In 2006, nearly 9.1 million GM cars and trucks were sold globally under the following brands: Buick, Cadillac, Chevrolet, GMC, GM Daewoo, Holden, HUMMER, Opel, Pontiac, Saab, Saturn and Vauxhall. GM's OnStar subsidiary is the industry leader in vehicle safety, security and information services. More information on GM can be found at www.gm.com.    SOURCE  General Motors Corporation       /CONTACT: Debbie Frakes of Buick-Pontiac-GMC, +1-313-667-2579, cell +1-248-310-8587, or debbie.frakes@gm.com      /Web site: http://media.gm.com      /Web site: http://www.gm.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  March 02, 2007 00:01 ET (05:01 GMT)

Headline: : OI European Group B.V. Announces Proposed Private Offering of 300 Million Euro of Senior Notes
Story: PERRYSBURG, Ohio, March 2 /PRNewswire-FirstCall/ -- OI European Group B.V., an indirect wholly owned subsidiary of Owens-Illinois, Inc. (NYSE: OI), announced that it intends to offer, subject to market and other conditions, 300 million euros aggregate principal amount of senior notes due 2017 in a private offering.     OI European Group B.V. intends to use the net proceeds of the offering to repay borrowings under its existing secured credit agreement.  In May 2007, a subsidiary borrower of Owens-Illinois, Inc., intends to borrow under the secured credit agreement in order to repay all outstanding $300 million of Owens-Illinois, Inc.'s, 8.10% Senior Notes due May 15, 2007.     The notes have not been and will not be registered under the Securities Act of 1933, as amended (the "Act"), and are being offered and sold in the United States only to qualified institutional buyers in reliance on Rule 144A under the Act and to certain non-U.S. persons in transactions outside the United States in reliance on Regulation S under the Act. Prospective purchasers that are qualified institutional buyers are hereby notified that the seller of the notes may be relying on the exemption from the provisions of Section 5 of the Act provided by Rule 144A.     This press release shall not constitute an offer to sell or the solicitation of an offer to buy these securities, nor shall there be any sale of these securities in any state in which such offer, solicitation, or sale would be unlawful prior to registration or qualification under the securities laws of any such state.        Forward Looking Statements     This news release contains 'forward-looking' statements within the meaning of Section 21E of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 and Section 27A of the Act.  Forward-looking statements reflect current expectations and projections about future events at the time, and thus involve uncertainty and risk.  It is possible that future financial performance may differ from expectations due to a variety of risks and other factors such as those described in Owens- Illinois, Inc.'s, Form 10-K for the year ended December 31, 2006, filed with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission on March 1, 2007. It is not possible to foresee or identify all such factors.  Any forward-looking statements in this news release are based on certain assumptions and analyses made in light of its experience and perception of historical trends, current conditions, expected future developments, and other factors it believes are appropriate in the circumstances.  Forward-looking statements are not a guarantee of future performance and actual results or developments may differ materially from expectations.  While OI continually reviews trends and uncertainties affecting its results of operations and financial condition, OI does not intend to update any particular forward-looking statements contained in this news release.    SOURCE  Owens-Illinois, Inc.       /CONTACT: Kelley Yoder, of Owens-Illinois, Inc., Corporate Communications, +1-567-336-1388      /Web site: http://www.O-I.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  March 02, 2007 02:30 ET (07:30 GMT)

Headline: : Resolve Business Outsourcing -4-
Story: Direct costs decreased by $5,208 for the period of operation in 2006 over the prorated pro forma direct costs for 2005. Direct cost related to providing the BPO solution to the travel customers in 2005 was $7,675 ($6,076 prorated for 9 1/2 months). Therefore, the change in direct costs is substantially related to the disposition of the travel customers.    As noted above under Revenue, contracts have various contract lengths and maturities. In response to the competitive revenue pressure and the desire to maximize earnings during the term of a contract, the Business is constantly seeking ways to reduce costs or to benefit from economies of scale for a specific solution. Direct costs are higher and gross profits tend to be lower during the start up of a new solution. Conversely gross profits tend to be maximized during the later stages of a contract. Initial direct costs are lower on subsequent applications of a new solution.    Operating Expenses    Operating expenses include selling, general and administrative costs. Operating expenses decreased by $1,124 for the period of operation in 2006 over the prorated pro forma operating expenses for 2005. The travel business accounted for an immaterial portion of the decline. Costs related to being a reporting issuer were substantially greater than the prorated pro forma expense provided for in the Prospectus. Corporate governance materials had to be created, processes had to be established to meet regulatory requirements and, as a result there was a greater reliance during the initial period on outside advisors and legal counsel to assist in establishing the framework. However, the increased costs related to being a reporting issuer were more than offset by reductions in other operating expenses throughout the Business.    Depreciation and Amortization    Depreciation and amortization increased $2,586 for the period of operation in 2006 over the prorated pro forma 2005 period. The change is a result of increased annual amortization of the intangible assets over the preliminary estimate made at the time the pro forma financial statements were prepared. Subsequent to the acquisitions on March 17, 2006, the Partnership engaged a valuation firm to assist in valuing the underlying net assets acquired and the estimated useful lives on the acquired intangibles.    Interest Expense    Interest expense for the 2006 period of operation is consistent with the prorated pro forma interest expense for 2005.    Net Earnings from Discontinued Operations    On May 1, 2006, the Business sold certain assets and customer contracts related to travel industry fulfillment. The gross proceeds were $3,000. The Partnership recorded a pre-tax and pre non-controlling interest gain on disposal of $2,129. The net gain on disposal of $961 was reduced by a net loss from discontinued operations to the date of disposal of $254.    Net Earnings    Net earnings increased $3,543 for the 2006 period over the prorated pro forma 2005 period. The 2005 prorated pro forma net earnings included the travel business disposed of in 2006 and a gain realized on settlement of a long-term contract of $5,744. The 2006 net earnings included a gain on disposition of the travel business. In addition, the basis of amortization of intangibles differs from the preliminary approach used in the pro forma. This resulted in increased amortization and lower earnings.    Distributable Cash    Effective as of August 2006, the Canadian Securities Administrators ("CSA") recommends that distributable cash be calculated by reference to cash flows from operating activities as reflected in the statement of cash flows after deducting maintenance capital expenditures for the same period. As a result, the distributable cash as presented in the Prospectus is not directly comparable to the method recommended by the CSA. No pro forma statement of cash flows was prepared for inclusion in the Prospectus and therefore a revised calculation under the new basis cannot be made. The differences in the two approaches are certain working capital changes that were excluded under the previous approach to calculating distributable cash.    Although the two methods of calculating distributable cash are not directly comparable, they have been presented for information purposes. The Fund's distributable cash based on the new definition is $1,148 less than the prorated pro forma distributable cash as reflected in the Prospectus. If distributable cash was calculated for the period from March 17, 2006 to December 31, 2006 on the same basis as was used in the Prospectus, it would have been $29,783 or $2,269 higher than the new recommended approach for 2006 and $1,121 higher than the prorated pro forma amount for 2005. Therefore the Fund was able to meet its distributable cash objective for 2006 as set out in the Prospectus.    FOURTH QUARTER    As a result of the Fund completing its initial public offering and the acquisitions on March 17, 2006, no quarterly financial information is available for the fourth quarter of 2005. The comments below compare the fourth quarter of 2006 to the prior two quarters of 2006.    Results of Operations    Fourth quarter revenue of $65,315 was $3,117 less than the third quarter and $3,832 less than the second quarter. The decline in revenue is a result of expected text book distribution and vehicle registration declines due to seasonality that were partially offset by holiday season program increases in other areas of the business. Direct costs in the fourth quarter were reduced over the prior two quarters with the reduction in revenue. A significant component of direct costs is people costs and these could not be scaled back at the same rate as the reduction in revenue for the quarter. Operating expenses increased $1,975 over the third quarter and $401 over the second quarter. The primary components of the increase are compensation costs related to new senior level employees, commissions related to new customer contracts, termination costs related to former employees, timing of health claims at the US operations and other costs related to the first year as a public entity. Depreciation, amortization and interest expense for the fourth quarter are similar to the prior two quarters. Due to the weakening of the Canadian dollar relative to the United States dollar at December 31, 2006, the Fund recorded unrealized losses on its outstanding foreign exchange contracts in the amount of $1,890 during the quarter. The negative impact of foreign exchange on the fourth quarter earnings before income taxes compared to the third quarter was $1,627 and compared to the second quarter was $4,374. As a result of the seasonality in revenue, an increase in operating costs during the quarter and the unrealized loss on the foreign exchange contracts, a net loss for the three month period occurred.    Distributable Cash    Cash provided by operating activities during the fourth quarter was impacted by changes in working capital during the quarter and the lower earnings. Net cash generated by operating activities during the fourth quarter was $4,779, down from $17,048 in the third quarter and $7,143 in the second quarter. Changes in working capital represented the largest component of the cash provided by operating activities in the third quarter. During the fourth quarter, maintenance capital expenditures of $2,631 were acquired compared to approximately $1,000 in each of the prior two quarters. The increased maintenance capital expenditures represent a catch up from prior quarters. Headline: JD Wetherspoon 1H Pretax Pft GBP32.9M Vs GBP27.4M
Story: Edited Press Release     LONDON (Dow Jones)--JD Wetherspoon Friday reported a pretax profit of GBP32.9 million in the six months to January 28, compared with a pretax profit of GBP27.4 million.   Chairman Tim Martin said: "Following strong like-for-like sales until Christmas, sales growth slowed in January and February. The Company is targeting like-for-like growth in the second half year of about 2-4%. In view of the increase in wages and utility costs, combined with slower sales growth, the Company is cautious about the outcome in the second half."   "The Company is also investing in existing pubs at a higher level than in the corresponding period, particularly relating to preparations for the smoking ban. This includes considerable upgrades to our kitchens and the installation of new beer cellar technology referred to above which will enable us to achieve consistently lower temperatures than our competitors for ciders, lagers and wine."   "The Company continues to make strong efforts to improve every area of its business and, combined with targeting continuing improvements in sales and trading performance, and our strong cash flow, we remain confident of future prospects."     (MORE TO FOLLOW) Dow Jones Newswires  March 02, 2007 02:05 ET (07:05 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: 2nd UPDATE: Adecco Mid-Term Targets Intact, Eyes Buys
Story: (This story updates an item that ran at 0735 GMT, recasting, adding CEO and analyst comment, and background.)     By Goran Mijuk   Of DOW JONES NEWSWIRES     ZURICH (Dow Jones)--Adecco SA (ADO) Friday said its medium-term financial targets are intact and it will continue to look for acquisitions after the world's largest staffing firm posted solid 2006 results which also helped improve its balance sheet.   Adecco said full-year net profit rose 35% to EUR611 million from EUR453 million a year-earlier thanks to a lift from last year's acquisition of DIS Deutscher Industrie Service AG (DIS.XE) and due to restructuring efforts in France and the U.S.   The figure beat forecasts as the result was also inflated by a EUR65 million tax benefit. Excluding the non-cash gain, net profit met analyst views but disappointed investors which had hoped for a more bullish outlook.    At 1105 GMT, shares of Adecco were down 3.1%, or CHF2.55, to CHF78.55 in an overall firmer market.   In the fourth quarter, net profit jumped 23% to EUR212 million from EUR171 million, also beating bottom line views, while revenue increased 8% to EUR5.28 billion from EUR4.89 billion.   "We are well on track to reach our long-term goals of 7% to 9% annual revenue growth, as well as an operating margin of over 5% and a return on capital employed of above 25% by 2009," said Chief Executive Dieter Scheiff.   In 2006, sales rose 12% to EUR20.42 billion from EUR18.30 billion in 2005, while the operation margin improved to 4% from an earlier 3.4%. Return on capital employed reached 20.3% in 2006, up from 18.5% in 2005.   Scheiff also flagged more bolt-on acquisitions in markets such as Europe and Asia and said Adecco has around EUR1.5 billion at a hand as last year's performance also strengthened the balance sheet.   In 2006, Adecco's cash position surged 87% to EUR875 million from EUR468 million while shareholders' equity rose 16% to EUR2.46 billion from EUR2.12 billion.   Adecco, which was formed in 1996 through the merger of Switzerland's Adia and France's Ecco, has been on an aggressive buying spree in recent years.   Before acquiring Germany's DIS in 2006, Adecco bought U.S.-based Staffwise Legal, Spain-based Humangroup and France's Altedia in 2005, which followed earlier buys such as Sydelis in France and PeopleOne in India. These acquisitions cost Adecco more than EUR1 billion.    Meanwhile, Scheiff said the company would continue to focus on organic growth as well and attempt to boost its professional staffing business, amid which the company attempts to increasingly place specialized employees rather than blue-collar workers.   For that reason, the company last year aligned its six new divisions along employment groups such as engineering or information technology, mainly aimed at improving the company's margins.   The revamp already bore fruit in key markets such as the U.S. and France, where Adecco in the past struggled with weak growth rates and declining profitability.   Adecco was able to boost full-year sales in France by 8% to EUR6.8 billion and improve its gross margin by 10 basis points. In the U.S., sales rose 1% to EUR3.7 billion while the gross margin improved by 110 basis points. Adecco only details gross margins changes by geography.   Analysts generally welcomed Adecco's figures and also applauded the dividend increase to CHF1.2 per share from a previous CHF1 a share.   "This is a good set of results and is a confirmation that the company is on track to achieve its targets", said Scott Weldon, analyst at Bank Vontobel, who rates the stock at market outperform. They attributed the share price drop to the fact that Adecco wasn't able to positively surprise investors.     Company Web Site: http://www.adecco.com     -By Goran Mijuk, Dow Jones Newswires; +41 43 443 80 47; goran.mijuk@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  March 02, 2007 07:03 ET (12:03 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: FDA Panel Rejects Medtronic Heart-Failure Device >MDT
Story: By Jennifer Corbett Dooren     Of DOW JONES NEWSWIRES     (This article was originally published Thursday)     WASHINGTON (Dow Jones)--A U.S. Food and Drug Administration panel Thursday rejected a first-of-a-kind device by Medtronic Inc. (MDT) designed to monitor the condition of heart-failure patients, saying there wasn't enough evidence that the device really helped patients.   The panel of outside medical experts voted 9 to 2 in recommending that the FDA not approve the device.   The device, known as a hemodynamic monitor, is designed to measure the heart's pressure, rate and body temperature to determine if fluid is building up. The idea is to allow doctors to monitor and detect worsening heart failure more quickly and to prevent hospitalizations. Doctors typically manage fluid buildup from heart failure with a variety of drugs.   However, the clinical study of 274 patients who had the so-called Chronicle Implantable Hemodynamic Monitor implanted showed it didn't meet a goal of a statistically significant reduction in hospitalizations and other events.   "I so want this to work," said John Teerlink, a panel member and director of the heart-failure clinic at the Veterans Affairs Medical Center in San Francisco. But, he said, "I don't believe it represents a reasonable assurance of safety and effectiveness at this time."   Teerlink and many other panel members said while they are intrigued about the data that could be generated by the device, the possible benefits of earlier intervention by doctors didn't outweigh the risk of surgery to implant the device. The panel did agree with the FDA, however, that the device itself is safe.   The FDA usually follows its panel's advice, but is not required to do so.   "This is our first shot," David Steinhaus, Medtronic's vice president and medical director told the panel. "This is just like the early stage of defibrillators where we didn't know who would benefit." After the meeting, he said the company would work with the FDA to "define the appropriate path for approval."   Indeed, many panel members encouraged the company to continue studying the device, and some said the FDA should consider approving it for use in a narrow group of patients.   "I'm concerned about letting this device go down," said Eugene Blackstone, a panel member and heart surgeon at the Cleveland Clinic, explaining that having data generated from the device could be useful for doctors in making treatment decisions.   While the study failed to reach its main goal it did show a trend toward a reduction in hospitalizations and other events among patients with the monitor compared to a control group of patients in which doctors weren't looking at data generated from the monitor.   Also, when patients were divided into moderately ill and severely ill groups as measured by a heart-failure class, it showed a statistically significant reduction in so-called event rates of 36% for those in heart failure Class III. However, there was an increase in event rates for the sickest patients, or those with Class IV heart failure.   Medtronic has incorporated the hemodynamic monitor into one of the company's heart defibrillators and has started conducting a clinical study of the device.   Shares of Medtronic closed at $50.15, down 21 cents, or 0.4%, on volume of 12.1 million, compared with average daily volume of 5.2 million. In recent late trading, shares were down to $49.70.   -By Jennifer Corbett Dooren, Dow Jones Newswires; 202-862-9294; jennifer.corbett@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  March 02, 2007 07:33 ET (12:33 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: : Syntax-Brillian Launches Home Theater-Focused Olevia(TM) HDTV in Taiwan
Story: Debut of Olevia(TM) in Taiwan Marks First Step of Further      Expansion in the Asia-Pacific Region for Popular HDTV Brand  TAIPEI, Taiwan--(BUSINESS WIRE)--March 02, 2007--   Syntax-Brillian Corporation (Nasdaq:BRLC), one of North America's fastest growing digital entertainment companies, announced today the launch of its popular, award-winning Olevia(TM) brand of LCD HDTVs in Taiwan at a VIP event in Taipei, Taiwan.     The televisions, which feature new high-end designs and innovative technology, are exclusive to the Taiwanese market and will be available only through Kolin-Denon pro-AV and custom home theater installation channels in Taiwan.     Beginning in March 2007, consumers in Taiwan will be able to enjoy Olevia(TM) LCD HDTVs in sizes ranging from 32" to 65".     Each HDTV features full 1080p high-definition resolution and striking piano black or pearl white lacquer finish, a feature exclusive to Olevia(TM) Taiwan HDTVs in the Olevia(TM) line. Additionally, each Olevia(TM) Taiwan HDTV incorporates 120 hertz LCD panels supplied by LPL and Sharp featuring the latest innovative display technology for Olevia(TM) Taiwan HDTVs.     Part of the elite home theater-focused Olevia(TM) 7 Series, the Olevia 747i is one of the world's first HDTVs to feature the SiliconOptix Realta Hollywood Quality Video (HQV(TM)) video processor powered by Teranex technology.     "We're incredibly proud to debut Olevia(TM) in Taiwan, an important market where Syntax-Brillian has so many crucial strategic relationships," said Vincent Sollitto, CEO of Syntax-Brillian. "Consumers in Taiwan are very savvy about consumer electronics and recognize superior quality and performance. We're confident that, as millions of consumers have throughout the world, consumers in Taiwan will recognize those traits and choose Olevia(TM)."     Olevia(TM)'s debut in Taiwan marks an important step in the continued expansion of the fast-growing brand throughout the Asia-Pacific region, where it already enjoys great popularity in Hong Kong and China. Because of their high quality and special features, as well as efficiencies in logistics including nearby manufacturing and ease of shipping, Olevia(TM) Taiwan HDTVs are expected to yield higher profit margins for Syntax-Brillian than Olevia(TM) TVs sold in the U.S. market.     The Olevia(TM) Taiwan office will oversee all operations for Olevia(TM) in the Asia-Pacific region including the Olevia(TM) brand's current presence in Singapore, Australia, New Zealand, and Philippines, as well as other locations to be developed in the future.     Olevia(TM) continues to enjoy increased brand awareness generated, in part, by its high-profile marketing relationship with ESPN and ABC Sports in the United States and expanding retail partnerships throughout Asia and South America.       About Syntax-Brillian Corporation     Syntax-Brillian Corporation (www.syntaxbrillian.com) is one of the world's leading manufacturers and marketers of LCD and LCoS(TM) HDTVs, digital cameras, and microdisplay entertainment products.     The company's lead products include its Olevia(TM) brand (www.Olevia.com) high definition widescreen LCD and LCoS(TM) televisions -- one of the fastest growing global TV brands -- and Vivitar(R) brand (www.vivitar.com) digital still and video cameras. Syntax-Brillian has built an Asian supply chain coupled with an international manufacturing and distribution network to support worldwide retail sales channels and position the company as a market leader in consumer digital entertainment products.     Olevia(TM), Brillian(TM), LCoS(TM) and Vivitar(R) are trademarks or registered trademarks of Syntax-Brillian Corporation. All other trademarks are the property of their respective owners.       About Denon Electronics     Denon is a world leader in the manufacture of the highest quality home theater, audio and software products. Denon is recognized internationally for innovative and groundbreaking products and has a long history of technical innovations, including the development and first commercialization of PCM digital audio. Denon Electronics is owned by D&M Holdings Inc.       Forward-Looking statements:     Certain statements contained in this press release may be deemed to be forward-looking statements under federal securities laws, and Syntax-Brillian intends that such forward-looking statements be subject to the safe-harbor created thereby. Such forward-looking statements include but are not limited to the anticipated introduction of Olevia(TM) televisions to consumers in Taiwan and their availability through Denon Pro-AV, Taiwanese consumers' choice of Olevia(TM) televisions over competing brands, and profit margins on televisions manufactured in Taiwan. Syntax-Brillian cautions that these statements are qualified by important factors that could cause actual results to differ materially from those reflected by the forward-looking statements contained herein. Such factors include changes in markets for the Company's products; changes in the market for customers' products; the failure of the Company's products to deliver commercially acceptable performance; the ability of the Company's management, individually or collectively, to guide the Company in a successful manner; and other risks as detailed in Syntax-Brillian's Annual Report on Form 10-K. Headline: Eros International: Agrees Sony Broadcast Deal
Story: Edited Press Release     LONDON (Dow Jones)--Eros International said Friday that it has signed an exclusive deal for a package of its films to be broadcast on Sony Entertainment Television, one of India's leading entertainment channels.    The deal comprises a slate of released films including recent films like Salaam- E-Ishq and Lage Raho Munna Bhai as well as some upcoming releases like Namastey London. Sony will enjoy exclusive global satellite broadcasting rights to the original version of these titles for a period of five years.    The deal is in line with the Company's expectations and forms an integral part of Eros's content syndication strategy. Eros has an extensive film library of over 1300 titles and has over the last three decades built a successful business model involving 25-30 new releases every year distributed across all formats as well as exploitation of the catalogue through syndication and license deals to television networks and platforms around the globe.    The $4.5bn Indian media and entertainment industry in India is growing at 18% CAGR1 and almost 60% of this industry is driven by the television sector led by Star, Sony and Zee networks. Since a large component of the programming within the leading Indian channels is Bollywood-based, premium film content has become extremely valuable over the years.   Sunil Lulla, Director and President India of Eros International Plc comments: "We have a strong relationship with all the leading Indian television networks and are delighted that Eros' content will now be showcased on Sony Entertainment Television. It is one of the leading channels in India with a global footprint. We also regularly partner with Sony to market and promote our films through its extensive television network."    Kunal Das Gupta, Global CEO of Sony Entertainment Television commented, "Eros is a major player within the Indian film sector and Bollywood films are a critical part of our programming mix. We are delighted to have secured this deal with Eros with whom we have enjoyed a great working relationship for several years."     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  March 02, 2007 02:35 ET (07:35 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: : Keystone Helicopter Delivers First Sikorsky S-76 with Silencer(TM) Interior
Story: COATESVILLE, Pa., March 2 /PRNewswire-FirstCall/ -- Keystone Helicopter Corporation delivered its first Sikorsky S-76C+(TM) equipped with the Silencer(TM) VIP Interior. Keystone is a subsidiary of Sikorsky Aircraft Corp., a United Technologies Corp. (NYSE: UTX), business unit.        (Logo: http://www.newscom.com/cgi-bin/prnh/20030516/KEYSTONELOGO )     The Silencer interior was developed to ease the process of scheduled maintenance on the interior of the aircraft by allowing access points for inspections in lieu of removing the whole interior. In addition, this interior weighs approximately 100lbs less than the standard interior and has cabin sound levels of approximately 81dbs, less than the fleet average.        About Keystone Helicopter     Keystone Helicopter is a full-service maintenance and completion center anchored by the Heliplex, a new, state-of-the-art technical services depot in Coatesville, PA. Keystone is a factory-authorized service center for Bell, Eurocopter, MD Helicopter, Rolls Royce, Turbomeca, Pratt & Whitney, and Sikorsky products. Keystone was acquired by Sikorsky Aircraft in 2005. Sikorsky Aircraft Corporation, based in Stratford, Conn., is a world leader in helicopter design, manufacturing and service. Sikorsky Aircraft is a subsidiary of United Technologies Corp. (NYSE: UTX), based in Hartford, Conn. UTC provides a broad range of high-technology products and support services to the aerospace and building systems industries.    SOURCE  Keystone Helicopter Corporation       /CONTACT: Leigh Matthews, +1-610-883-4500, or lmatthews@keystonehelicopter.com, or Rick Hinkle, +1-610-883-4475, rhinkle@keystonehelicopter.com, both of Keystone Helicopter Corporation      /Web site: http://www.keystonehelicopter.com/     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  March 02, 2007 08:00 ET (13:00 GMT)

Headline: Australia's Macquarie Announces RMBS Price Guidance
Story: SYDNEY (Dow Jones)--Australia's Macquarie Securitisation Friday set pricing guidance for the senior tranche of its A$800 million residential mortgage backed securities deal announced earlier this week.   A spokesman for lead managers Societe Generale said the A$766 million (AAA/Aaa) senior tranche would be marketed at 18 to 19 basis points over one month BBSW.   Pricing is set down for March 12 but Societe Generale said there is some scope for that date to be brought forward.   Strong demand is anticipated amid record RMBS activity in recent weeks   The Commonwealth Bank of Australia, the country's second largest commercial bank, priced a record A$7 billion (US$5.5 billion) RMBS issue in mid-February.   A senior A$1.2 billion triple-A rated tranche of CBA's benchmark deal, increased from an initial A$1 billion offering, priced at 13 basis points over the 1-month bank bill swap rate.     -By Sydney Bureau; Dow Jones Newswires; 612-8235-2950; djnews.sydney@dowjones.com   (END) Dow Jones Newswires  March 02, 2007 02:04 ET (07:04 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: TALES OF THE TAPE: Chemed Unclogs Medicare Cap Concerns
Story: By Dinah Wisenberg Brin     Of DOW JONES NEWSWIRES     (This article was originally published Thursday)     Chemed Corp. (CHE), which operates hospices and the Roto-Rooter plumbing service, has rehabilitated its ailing stock price by easing concerns about its problems with Medicare reimbursement limits.   After an October low, Chemed shares have risen 55%, largely on better-than-expected fourth-quarter results reported last week.   Chemed's recent stock price of $46 remains far below the 52-week high of $61.91, however, a sign that Wall Street is waiting for more proof that the company is controlling Medicare billing caps, which have posed problems for other hospice operators, as well.   Chemed, based in Cincinnati, offers care to terminally ill patients through Vitas Healthcare, the nation's largest hospice-care provider, with programs in 15 states and Washington, D.C. When patients stay for longer periods and their care exceeds Medicare caps, hospices can take a hit to the bottom line as they provide services without full reimbursement.   Chemed President and Chief Executive Kevin McNamara acknowledges that the company needs to continually demonstrate that Medicare billing limitations can be managed and admits it isn't going to be easy.   "Medicare cap will remain a component of our overall cost structure that will be difficult to predict quarter to quarter," McNamara said on the company's earnings conference call last week.   Chemed's struggles with Medicare reimbursement limits surfaced last July and cut the company's stock price in half by early October. The market reaction last year was based not on raw numbers but on the fear that Chemed's Medicare cap problems would become much worse before getting better, Chief Financial Officer David Williams said in an interview.   In response, Chemed exited the money-losing Phoenix market and focused on drawing new admissions from long-term acute-care facilities, which generally refer sicker patients who have shorter stays in hospices. The result was a fourth-quarter report and 2007 forecast that showed investors that the Medicare billing cap "is a very manageable expense," Williams said.   Now, Wall Street wants to know if Chemed can continue that strategy in 2007.   "We were pleased with Chemed results, but we believe an efficient market has already corrected for the earnings surprise, leading us to maintain our hold rating," Stifel Nicolaus analyst Eric T. Gommel said. Stifel expects to seek or receive investment-banking compensation from Chemed in the next three months.       Stock In Line With Peers     Chemed shares trade at about 19 times 2007 earnings estimates, according to Factset, similar to nursing-home operator Manor Care Inc. (HCR), which also provides hospice services, but slightly below the multiple of Vitas' largest for-profit pure hospice competitor, Odyssey HealthCare Inc. (ODSY), which trades at 20 times earnings estimates.   Chemed shares plunged last year when the company repeatedly lowered its 2006 earnings expectations, citing hospice billings that exceeded Medicare reimbursement limits in some markets.   In September, Chemed said Vitas Healthcare would exit the Phoenix market, where the billings had been especially high because the mix of terminally ill patients was weighted heavily to those with longer stays. Chemed said the majority of its hospice programs have a relatively short length of stay for patients, which should minimize the effect of cap problems.   Meanwhile, besides managing Medicare reimbursement caps, Vitas has focused on generating new admissions and managing labor, Stifel's Gommel said.   "The company showed success on all three fronts, driving the better (fourth-quarter) results. Hospice results also benefited from a recovery in hospital occupancy in Vitas' core Florida markets," Gommel said in a note.   Vitas' revenue increased nearly 12% in the fourth quarter to $186 million and was eroded by a relatively modest $700,000 from billing limits. The caps reduced the company's net income - which totaled $17.6 million in the quarter - by only $400,000.   Chemed predicts Medicare billings will exceed limits by $10 million this year, which actually is higher than the 2006 figure but probably lower than what analysts estimated, Williams said. Vitas' continuing operations exceeded billing caps by $4 million last year. If the company hadn't left Arizona, the excess would have been close to $10 million, Williams said.   Two Vitas hospice programs are at the cap now, and the company is closely monitoring three others. CIBC World Markets analyst Michael Wiederhorn said Chemed's moves have set it up nicely.   "Vitas remains well-positioned to deal with the cap, and could eventually benefit from the worsening situation in the industry should it lead to a shakeout," Wiederhorn said. CIBC indicated no recent investment-banking relationship with Chemed.   Moody's Investors Service affirmed Chemed's debt ratings this week with a stable outlook, citing a moderate leverage position, stable free cash flow and leading market positions, while acknowledging the company's acquisitive nature and reliance on Medicare reimbursement for Vitas' revenue.   Moody's noted the stability of Roto-Rooter and the likelihood of growing demand for hospice care, and said the risk from Medicare caps is mitigated by the government's support for hospice benefits.   Sales at Roto-Rooter - about one-third of Chemed's business - increased 8.2% in the fourth quarter, as that business also exceeded expectations. Chemed executives continue to dismiss the idea of a Roto-Rooter spinoff anytime soon, saying the nation's largest plumbing and drain-cleaning service is a valuable part of the company that can help Vitas to expand and Chemed to refinance its debt.    "We're watching it," McNamara told analysts, "but we haven't moved any closer to thinking that's a good idea."    (Dinah Wisenberg Brin covers the health-care industry for Dow Jones Newswires.)   -By Dinah Wisenberg Brin, Dow Jones Newswires; 215-656-8285; dinah.brin@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  March 02, 2007 07:31 ET (12:31 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: : Calloway Real Estate Investment Trust: Fourth Quarter And Year End Results>CWT.DB.T
Story: TORONTO, March 1 /CNW/ - Calloway Real Estate Investment Trust (TSX:CWT.UN) is pleased to report its results for the quarter and year ended December 31, 2006.          <<      Highlights of the Quarter        -   Portfolio occupancy maintained at 99% level.      -   Committed to $57.1 million in mezzanine financing of which advanced          $8.0 million was funded.      -   Completed the acquisition of 100% freehold and leasehold interests in          14 retail properties in the seventh major transaction with          SmartCentres, comprising 1.3 million square feet of leaseable area          and 1.5 million square feet of future development, for          $383.4 million.      -   Internalized property management for $14.4 million.      -   Issued $250 million of unsecured senior debentures at 5.37% due          October 12, 2016.      -   Issued 7,680,000 trust units for $29.30 per unit for gross proceeds          of $225 million and net proceeds of $216 million.      -   Expanded existing centres by an additional 136,545 square feet of          leaseable area at a cost of $31.4 million.      >>      As at December 31, 2006, Calloway's portfolio consists of 18.4 million square feet of built gross leaseable area and an ownership interest in 122 properties. The portfolio has a book value of $3.0 billion.    Simon Nyilassy, President and CEO, said, "2006 was another outstanding year for us as our operating portfolio grew by 3.8 million square feet, representing a 26% increase over 2005. The growth is primarily a result of our strong relationship with SmartCentres, Canada's leading developer of large format, unenclosed shopping centres. We expect this relationship will continue to contribute to Calloway's success and growth in future years.    We have assembled an outstanding portfolio of newly constructed, well-anchored shopping centres that provides the bedrock for our future. We will continue to grow our portfolio and to capitalize on the strength of our internal development pipeline, which increased by over 39% during the year for 2006, to 5.3 million square feet, equivalent of 21 new full-size shopping centres. Upon completion of this pipeline, Calloway's portfolio would increase from 18.4 million square feet to 23.7 million square feet."    During December 2006, Calloway completed the acquisition of 100% freehold and leasehold interests in 3 retail properties, partial interests in 5 retail properties and interests in 6 development lands, comprising 1.3 million square feet of built leaseable area and 1.5 million square feet of future development potential, for $383.4 million. The purchase price was satisfied by the assumption of existing debt of $173.4 million, the issuance of 789,444 Class B Series 2 LP Units and 34,130 Class D Series 2 LP Units for $24.1 million and the balance in cash.    Effective December 31, 2006, Calloway internalized property management for the majority of its portfolio, at a cost of $14.4 million payable to SmartCentres, the previous manager.    Calloway completed the issuance of $250 million of ten-year unsecured senior debentures at 5.37%, due on October 12, 2016. During the quarter, Calloway also completed the issuance of 7,680,000 trust units for $29.30 per unit for gross proceeds of $225 million. The net proceeds to Calloway, after deducting the underwriters' fee, were $216 million. The proceeds of these offerings were used by Calloway to pay down outstanding credit facilities, to finance subsequent acquisitions and development activities and for general trust purposes.    During the quarter, with respect to currently owned centres, the Trust expanded its portfolio by 136,545 square feet of leaseable area at an investment of $31.4 million, of which 76,200 square feet at a cost of $14.5 million was internally developed by Calloway and 60,345 square feet at a cost of $16.9 million was developed under existing agreements with SmartCentres. The Trust issued 271,088 REIT units and 69,044 Class "B" units to Mr. Mitchell Goldhar for $5.3 million, in addition to cash, to finance these acquisitions.    In addition, the Trust committed a total of $57.1 million mezzanine financing to SmartCentres and advanced $8.0 million. The mortgage has an eight year term at a 7.25% interest rate and includes an option entitling the Trust to acquire a 50% interest in the property upon substantial completion, at an agreed upon formula.    Acquisitions and expansion and development activities during the quarter contributed to a 9.6% increase in revenues of $82.3 million over the previous quarter of $75.1 million, and a 23.2% increase in revenues over the same period in 2005 of $66.7 million. A non recurring expenditure of $14.4 million relating to the acquisition and internalization of the property management business that has been expensed contributed to a net loss of $7.1 million. Net income from continuing operations before this one-time expense was $7.3 million, a decrease of $0.1 million over the third quarter because of additional interest expenses from the issuance of the unsecured debentures.    Adjusted funds from operations ("AFFO"), which is a non-GAAP measure commonly used by REITs as an estimate of cash flow, totaled $32.9 million for the fourth quarter, an increase of 5.8% over third quarter 2006 and an increase of 29.3% over fourth quarter 2005. On a diluted basis, AFFO per unit of $0.39 for the quarter increased 0.8% over third quarter 2006 and 0.4% over fourth quarter 2005, remaining relatively flat due to the short term dilution from both the debt and equity issuances. AFFO for 2006 increased to $1.56 per unit from $1.44 per unit in 2005, an increase of 8.3%. The Trust distributed $1.47 per unit in 2006 compared to $1.37 per unit in 2005. This equates to a payout ratio of 94.2% in 2006 compared to 95.0% in the prior year.    Occupancy rates continued their upward trend, with end of period rate of 99.3% compared with 99.0% at third quarter and 99.2% at December 31, 2005.    During the year, Calloway's real estate assets grew from $2.4 billion in 2005 to $3.3 billion, an increase of 35.7% and equity increased from $1.1 billion to $1.5 billion, a growth of 41.1%. Rental revenues increased 52.9% from $196.7 million to 300.7 million. Net income for 2006 (which was also adversely affected by the one-time expense of $14.4 million relating to the internalization of property management) was $20.8 million, a decrease from $26.8 million in 2005. Before the one-time expense, net income was $35.2 million, representing a 31.5% growth.    Calloway will hold a conference call on Monday, March 5, 2007 at 1:00 pm eastern time. Participating on the call will be members of Calloway's senior management.    This press release contains "forward-looking statements" subject to various significant risks and uncertainties which may cause actual results, performances and achievements of Calloway to be materially different from any future results, performances or achievements, expressed or implied by such forward-looking statements. Such risk factors include, but are not limited to, risks associated with real property ownership, availability of cash flow, restrictions on redemption, general uninsured losses, future property acquisition, environmental matters, tax related matters, debt financing, Unitholder liability, potential conflicts of interest, potential dilution, and reliance on key personnel. Calloway cannot assure investors that actual results will be consistent with these forward-looking statements and Calloway assumes no obligation to update or revise them to reflect new events or circumstances.             /CONTACT: Simon Nyilassy, President and Chief Executive Officer, Calloway Real Estate Investment Trust, 700 Applewood Crescent, Suite 200, Vaughan, ON, L4K 5X3, Tel: (905) 326-6400     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  March 02, 2007 06:39 ET (11:39 GMT)

Headline: 2nd UPDATE: Linde 2006 Net Pft Triples Due To One-Time Effects
Story: (this updates an item published at 0954 GMT with analysts comments and more background on exceptional items)   By Gangolf Schrimpf   Of DOW JONES NEWSWIRES     FRANKFURT (Dow Jones)--German industrial gases company Linde AG (LIN.XE) Friday reported a threefold rise in 2006 net profit due to acquisitions and divestments.   The Munich based company said net profit for the full year including one-time effects came in at EUR1.84 billion from EUR514 million a year ago.   Analysts polled by Dow Jones ahead of Linde's results, scheduled to be published on March 12, forecast a net profit of EUR639 million when excluding one-off effects.   The company also said full year sales climbed 30.8% to EUR12.44 billion, lifted by first-time consolidation of U.K. rival BOC group which Linde acquired in 2006 for around EUR15 billion. Analysts had projected full-year sales of EUR12.3 billion.   Linde's guidance for full year 2006 was to grow sales and earnings before interest and taxation, or Ebit, on comparable levels.   Linde Friday didn't disclose its Ebit figure for the full year, but said earnings before interest, taxation, depreciation and amortization, or Ebitda, for the full year more than doubled to EUR3.83 billion from EUR1.71 billion.   The German group also said it plans to pay a 2006 dividend of EUR1.50, up from EUR1.40 dividend paid for 2005.   DZ Bank analyst Norbert Barth, who will stick to his buy rating, said the results given so far are slighlty better than his expectations.   Another analyst, who asked to remain nameless, said the Linde sales figures were better than he had anticipated.    At 1015 GMT Linde shares were up EUR1.2 or 1.5% higher at EUR76.04 in a slightly lower German market.   The most important one-time effect on Linde's figures was the sale of its material forklifts unit Kion to private equity firm Kohlberg Kravis Roberts & Co. and Goldman Sachs Capital Partners for around EUR4 billion in November 2006.   Media reports put Linde's book gain for that transaction at between EUR1.2 billion and EUR2 billion. Linde has not publicly disclosed this figure.   To satisfy anti-trust demands in connection with its BOC takeover, Linde last December agreed to sell its 45 percent holding in the joint venture Japan Air Gases, Tokyo, to French competitor Air Liquide.   Before taxes, after deduction of debt and pensions, Linde said it received approximately EUR590 million.   In late November, Linde sold its U.S. bulk business to industrial gases rival Airgas Inc. (ARG) at a price of $495 million.   Company Web site: http://www.linde.com     - By Gangolf Schrimpf, Dow Jones Newswires, + 49 69 29 725 500, gangolf.schrimpf@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  March 02, 2007 05:23 ET (10:23 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: EBS Sets New $268B Daily Forex Volume Record March 1
Story: LONDON (Dow Jones)--EBS, the foreign exchange trading platform owned by interdealer broker ICAP PLC (IAP.LN), said Friday it reached a record $268 billion daily trading volume Thursday, up from $266 billion Feb. 27.   The volume record was achieved on 135,818 deals, EBS said. It said the busiest minute on the platform was at 1500 GMT (1000 EST) when 1,361 spot foreign exchange deals were transacted by 220 counterparties amounting to a value of $2.5 billion.   -By Adam Bradbery, Dow Jones Newswires; 44 20 7842 9305; adam.bradbery@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  March 02, 2007 03:47 ET (08:47 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: US Air Force: Weather Satellites Still Top Space Concern
Story: By Rebecca Christie     Of DOW JONES NEWSWIRES     (This article was originally published Thursday)     WASHINGTON (Dow Jones)--Pentagon, NASA and Commerce Department leaders are set to meet Friday to discuss a major Northrop Grumman Corp. (NOC) weather satellite program that Air Force officials say is one of their biggest ongoing concerns.   Many Defense Department space systems have struggled with major cost overruns and delays in recent years. After a series of restructurings, the Air Force is comfortable with the new path laid out for missile warning, communications and navigation satellites, Air Force Under Secretary Ronald Sega said recently.   But the jury is still out on the weather system, known as NPOESS, or the National Polar-Orbiting Operational Environmental Satellite System. The Defense Department's most recent report on weapons costs lists a price tag of nearly $14 billion, but the Air Force said Thursday that the program's updated cost estimate is around $11.5 billion.   Sega said the Air Force has "worked its way through" most of the other programs, except for NPOESS.   "I would reserve judgments on where exactly we are. I'm watching it hard," Sega said of the weather satellites, in an interview on the sidelines of a mid-February Aviation Week defense conference.   NPOESS is in the midst of a major restructuring prompted by its cost growth, which was big enough to trigger congressional review. First launch is not now expected until 2012, although a test project could launch by fiscal year 2009.   Lawmakers have railed against the prospect of further delays. Existing U.S. weather satellites are near the end of their projected lifespan. This means that if anything goes wrong, the U.S. could be without essential weather data for years until NPOESS is ready.   Program managers held a big meeting last week to study a particularly difficult Raytheon Co. (RTN) sensor, which will provide about 60% of the climate data collected by the new system. At that meeting, managers closed out most of the major design issues identified with the sensor, program officials said.   The one remaining major issue on that sensor involves "crosstalk" that interferes with optical sensor equipment. It's still an area of concern, although efforts are underway to resolve it.   Sega said the sensor prognosis should be clearer by the end of March.   Senior officials will keep close tabs on the program in the meantime, however, such as Friday's scheduled meeting of the NPOESS executive committee. NPOESS is a joint effort of the Pentagon, the National Aeronautics and Space Administration, and the Commerce Department's National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration.   -By Rebecca Christie, Dow Jones Newswires; 202-862-9243; rebecca.christie@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  March 02, 2007 07:34 ET (12:34 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: WSJ(3/2) EPA Seeks Sharp Cut In Diesel Pollution
Story: (From THE WALL STREET JOURNAL)     By John J. Fialka and Kathryn Kranhold   WASHINGTON -- Continuing a seven-year crackdown on diesel-engine pollution, the Environmental Protection Agency is proposing to all but eliminate the soot and smog-related emissions of locomotive engines and similar diesel engines used in ships.   EPA Administrator Stephen Johnson is expected to announce the proposal today in Newark, N.J., an industrial area plagued by the kind of pollution problems the new rules are intended to minimize.   "EPA is on track to make that black puff of diesel smoke go the way of the steam engine," said Mr. Johnson, who estimated the health benefits will be 20 times the estimated $2 billion to $4 billion cost of implementing the reductions.   But General Electric Co., the nation's largest locomotive maker -- and currently involved in an advertising campaign touting the ecological benefits of its new locomotives and some of its other products -- has told EPA officials in private meetings that the new rule is "unlikely to be achieved" even with some scientific breakthroughs.   Patrick Jarvis, a spokesman for GE's transportation business, declined to comment on the EPA's plan, saying GE didn't know what was in it. He said GE would review the ruling and offer its comment to the EPA. "We'll be focused on a balanced approach that achieves aggressive" emissions reduction and fuel-reduction savings, Mr. Jarvis said.   The rule would require that nitrogen-oxide emissions from the most modern locomotives, such as General Electric's Evolution model, be reduced more than 75%.   Another locomotive maker along with diesel-engine makers and catalyst manufacturers have told the EPA they believe they can meet the new specifications, which will require the installation of special catalytic converters, similar to those used on big diesel-powered trucks, to remove nitrogen oxides that cause smog.   The proposal, which Mr. Johnson said he hopes will take effect by the end of this year, will require most existing locomotives to meet new engine emissions standards when they are overhauled, beginning next year. A second phase of the rule, starting in 2009, will apply new standards to newly manufactured engines.   Starting in 2014, the rule will require owners of diesel-powered ships that cause pollution in U.S. ports to install the smog-reducing catalytic converters.   The proposal is the last step in a campaign by EPA to sharply reduce diesel-related pollution.     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  March 02, 2007 00:00 ET (05:00 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: : Kodak Board Appoints Hess and O'Grady as Vice Presidents
Story: ROCHESTER, N.Y.--(BUSINESS WIRE)--March 02, 2007--   Eastman Kodak Company (NYSE:EK) announced today that its Board of Directors has elected Judi Hess and John O'Grady as Vice Presidents of the company, effective immediately.     John O'Grady, 43, became Director, U.S. and Canada Sales and Vice President, Digital and Film Imaging Systems in 2004. Previously, O'Grady served as General Manager of the company's digital imaging business in the Americas Region. He joined Kodak in 1997 following a 12-year career at Verbatim, and has held key business development and regional management positions in Kodak's digital imaging businesses. O'Grady was graduated from the University of Limerick in Ireland with a Bachelor of Science degree in Electronics in June 1990. He resides in Atlanta, Ga.     Judi Hess, 48, became General Manager, Workflow and Prepress Equipment, and Vice President, Graphic Communications Group in 2005 following Kodak's acquisition of Creo. Prior to the Kodak acquisition, Hess served as President of Creo from 2002 to 2005 and as Corporate Vice President of Printing Workflow Solutions from 2000 to 2002. She originally joined Creo in 1995 as program manager for Workflow Products.     From 1981 to 1995, Hess worked with MacDonald Dettwiler and Associates (MDA), a high-technology commercial and defense contractor in Canada. She holds an Honors Bachelor of Mathematics degree from the University of Waterloo in Canada and lives in Vancouver, B.C., Canada.     For photos of the above individuals, please contact: Jackie Bray, Eastman Kodak Company, at 585-724-2681 or jackie.bray@kodak.com.        CONTACT: Eastman Kodak Company               Media:               David Kassnoff, 585-724-2137               david.kassnoff@kodak.com               or               David Lanzillo, 585-781-5481               david.lanzillo@kodak.com        SOURCE: Eastman Kodak Company  Copyright Business Wire 2007     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  March 02, 2007 08:00 ET (13:00 GMT)

Headline: INTERVIEW: Pakistan Needs To Fast Track LNG Projects - Exec
Story: By James Herron   Of DOW JONES NEWSWIRES   LONDON (Dow Jones)--Pakistan must fast track liquefied natural gas import projects to meet rising domestic gas and power demand, said Iqbal Z. Ahmed, Chief Executive of Pakistani industrial conglomerate Associated Group.   Associated Group, 80% owned by Ahmed's family, is already a large supplier of liquid petroleum gas in Pakistan and looks likely to be the first to deliver a new LNG terminal. It is close to finalizing an agreement with U.S.-based LNG trading and shipping company Excelerate Energy for the construction of a terminal at Port Qasim, near Karachi.   "There is lots of demand for natural gas and new sources are very difficult to come by. Pipelines from Iran, Qatar or Turkmenistan are five to seven years away. The government needs solutions tomorrow morning," said Ahmed in an interview with Dow Jones Newswires Thursday.   According to information on the web site of Sui Southern Gas Co. Ltd (SSGC.KA), one of Pakistan's largest gas transmission and distribution companies, gas demand is expected to rise by 130% from 27.1 million barrels of oil equivalent in 2005 to 62.5 mboe by 2020. Pakistan's indigenous gas production covered this demand in 2005, but by 2020 is projected to be 20.7 mboe, just a third of expected demand by that date.   The $100 million terminal, which aims to import 3.2 million tons of LNG per year, will not break ground until March. But Ahmed and Excelerate Chief Executive Kathleen Eisbrenner are confident it will be operational no later than April 2008.   Excelerate achieved a similar timeframe for its LNG import terminal in Teesside in the northeast of England. The Teesside terminal, which was commissioned last week, went from site selection to operation in a little over a year.   "We want to duplicate what Excelerate has done at Teesside," Ahmed said. "Our objective is to try and get the project here on the fast track because there are problems with gas availability and power generation in Pakistan."   Pakistan has another LNG project in the works, led by Sui Southern Gas Co. Ltd (SSGC.KA), the country's gas transmission and distribution company.   SSGC has invited bids from companies including units of Royal Dutch Shell PLC (RDSA), BP PLC (BP) and AES Corp. (AES) to help it build and run the $400 million Mashal LNG terminal, also near Karachi. The contract for Mashal should be awarded in the second half of this year and is planned to start operations in 2011.   The Associated Group terminal can be built faster and at lower cost because the systems required to convert the liquid gas stored at minus 126 degrees Celsius to high pressure gas at a temperature of around 40C are carried on board Excelerate's ship. There is no need for costly LNG storage tanks and regassification equipment to be built onshore.   Excelerate said its regassification ships are more expensive than standard LNG tankers, costing around $35 million more to build.   The Port Qasim terminal's jetty will be located in swampland close to the main shipping channel into the port. The jetty will be designed to permanently accommodate one of Excelerate's three regassification tankers, possibly the Excelsior. Standard LNG tankers will moor alongside and discharge their cargo into the Excelerate vessel, which will deliver gas into Pakistan's national network at a peak rate of 400 million cubic feet per day.   The project will also have a facility to extract liquid petroleum gas - a more valuable product with more than twice the energy content - from the LNG and sell it in Pakistan.   Excelerate will take 25% of the equity in the project, Ahmed said, and Associated Group, along with other unnamed partners, will take the rest.   U.S. company Mustang Engineering will oversee construction of the project.   Although Associated Group aims to supply Pakistan's power generation sector, Ahmed said the cost of LNG cannot compete with existing supplies of pipeline gas. It will however be 20% to 30% cheaper than residual fuel oil for power generation. "We want to target a niche market," Ahmed said.   Associated Group does not have long-term contracts in place for supply of LNG cargoes, Ahmed said. "Once we have the facility in place, gradually we will enter into long-term contracts," he said.   Ahmed said they will find the cargoes they need on the spot market, which he expects to grow from 5% to 15% of all LNG traded globally within the next few years. He said Excelerate, which has bought 26 spot cargoes in the last 20 months, will help Associated Group fill its capacity.   This may not be a simple task. Many industry observers expect the spot market for LNG cargoes in the Asia-Pacific region to be particularly tight in the next few years, as demand outstrips the available capacity for liquefying gas. Some terminals without long-term contracts to guarantee their supply are expected to struggle to fill their specified capacity.   Neither does Associated Group have contracts for the purchase of its gas from utilities within Pakistan. "We are deliberately going slow and want to tie up loose ends before signing contracts," Ahmed said. The company has letters of intent from SSGC and Sui Northern Gas Pipelines Ltd., together with other interested parties, he said.   Company Web site: http://www.agroup.com.pk   -By James Herron, Dow Jones Newswires; +44 (0)20 7842 9317; james.herron@dowjones.com (Oliver Klaus in Dubai contributed to this story).     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  March 02, 2007 06:16 ET (11:16 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: : The XM Customer Promise: XM Reaffirms Customer Commitment During Merger Approval Process
Story: WASHINGTON, March 2 /PRNewswire/ -- XM Satellite Radio, which recently joined Sirius in announcing plans to merge to form the nation's premier audio entertainment service, today put a stake in the ground to remain focused on existing consumers and prospective subscribers by announcing the XM Customer Promise. This Promise was issued to XM's more than 7.6 million existing subscribers and to consumers who are considering purchasing the industry- leading XM service.     The Customer Promise, signed by Chairman, Gary Parsons, CEO, Hugh Panero, President and COO, Nate Davis, reiterates that existing XM radios will continue to feature XM's stellar programming before and after the merger.     The merged company will be able to provide consumers with even better programming and more choices. The merger is expected to be completed in late 2007.     In an open letter to XM customers published in today's USA Today, the company said: "As long as you are an XM subscriber, your XM radio will continue to receive XM's great programming. Following the merger, XM expects that the existing radios will be able to receive a mix of programming from both services."     The company's letter also said: "XM's programming, including Major League Baseball, Oprah & Friends, Bob Dylan, Opie & Anthony and commercial-free music channels will not be interrupted by the merger. In the future, we will be able to offer the best of both companies' programming."     XM said that customers with questions are encouraged to visit the new portion of the XM website dedicated to consumer input and updates on XM's business throughout the merger process at www.xmradio.com/promise. While on the site, consumers are encouraged to sign up for The Signal, XM's weekly customer e-mail that provides updates on XM's programming, promotions and, now, also on the merger.     Existing consumers can also contact XM Listener Care at 1-800-XM-RADIO (1-800-967-2346).        About XM     XM (Nasdaq: XMSR) is America's number one satellite radio company with more than 7.6 million subscribers. Broadcasting live daily from studios in Washington, DC, New York City, Chicago, the Country Music Hall of Fame in Nashville, Toronto and Montreal, XM's 2007 lineup includes more than 170 digital channels of choice from coast to coast: commercial-free music, premier sports, news, talk radio, comedy, children's and entertainment programming; and the most advanced traffic and weather information.     XM, the leader in satellite-delivered entertainment and data services for the automobile market through partnerships with General Motors, Honda, Hyundai, Nissan, Porsche, Subaru, Suzuki and Toyota is available in 140 different vehicle models for 2007. XM's industry-leading products are available at consumer electronics retailers nationwide. For more information about XM hardware, programming and partnerships, please visit http://www.xmradio.com/.     This press release contains "forward-looking statements" within the meaning of the Private Securities Litigation Reform Act of 1995. Such statements include, but are not limited to, statements about the benefits of the business combination transaction involving Sirius Satellite Radio Inc. and XM Satellite Radio Holdings Inc., including potential synergies and cost savings and the timing thereof, future financial and operating results, the combined company's plans, objectives, expectations and intentions with respect to future operations, products and services; and other statements identified by words such as "anticipate," "believe," "plan," "estimate," "expect," "intend," "will," "should," "may," or words of similar meaning. Such forward- looking statements are based upon the current beliefs and expectations of Sirius's and XM's management and are inherently subject to significant business, economic and competitive uncertainties and contingencies, many of which are difficult to predict and generally beyond the control of Sirius and XM. Actual results may differ materially from the results anticipated in these forward-looking statements.     The following factors, among others, could cause actual results to differ materially from the anticipated results or other expectations expressed in the forward-looking statement: general business and economic conditions; the performance of financial markets and interest rates; the ability to obtain governmental approvals of the transaction on a timely basis; the failure of Sirius and XM shareholders to approve the transaction; the failure to realize synergies and cost-savings from the transaction or delay in realization thereof; the businesses of Sirius and XM may not be combined successfully, or such combination may take longer, be more difficult, time-consuming or costly to accomplish than expected; and operating costs and business disruption following the merger, including adverse effects on employee retention and on our business relationships with third parties, including manufacturers of radios, retailers, automakers and programming providers. Additional factors that could cause Sirius's and XM's results to differ materially from those described in the forward-looking statements can be found in Sirius's and XM's Annual Reports on Form 10-K for the year ended December 31, 2005, and Quarterly Reports on Form 10-Q for the quarters ended March 31, 2006, June 30, 2006 and September 30, 2006 which are filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission (the "SEC") and available at the SEC's Internet site (http://www.sec.gov/). The information set forth herein speaks only as of the date hereof, and Sirius and XM disclaim any intention or obligation to update any forward-looking statements as a result of developments occurring after the date of this press release.        Important Additional Information Will be Filed with the SEC     This communication is being made in respect of the proposed business combination involving Sirius and XM. In connection with the proposed transaction, Sirius plans to file with the SEC a Registration Statement on Form S-4 containing a Joint Proxy Statement/Prospectus and each of Sirius and XM plan to file with the SEC other documents regarding the proposed transaction. The definitive Joint Proxy Statement/Prospectus will be mailed to stockholders of Sirius and XM. INVESTORS AND SECURITY HOLDERS OF SIRIUS AND XM ARE URGED TO READ THE JOINT PROXY STATEMENT/PROSPECTUS AND OTHER DOCUMENTS FILED WITH THE SEC CAREFULLY IN THEIR ENTIRETY WHEN THEY BECOME AVAILABLE BECAUSE THEY WILL CONTAIN IMPORTANT INFORMATION ABOUT THE PROPOSED TRANSACTION.     Investors and security holders will be able to obtain free copies of the Registration Statement and the Joint Proxy Statement/Prospectus (when available) and other documents filed with the SEC by Sirius and XM through the web site maintained by the SEC at http://www.sec.gov/. Free copies of the Registration Statement and the Joint Proxy Statement/Prospectus (when available) and other documents filed with the SEC can also be obtained by directing a request to Sirius Satellite Radio Inc., 1221 Avenue of the Americas, New York, NY 10020, Attention: Investor Relations or by directing a request to XM Satellite Radio Holdings Inc., 1500 Eckington Place, NE Washington, DC 20002, Attention: Investor Relations.     Sirius, XM and their respective directors and executive officers and other persons may be deemed to be participants in the solicitation of proxies in respect of the proposed transaction. Information regarding Sirius's directors and executive officers is available in its Annual Report on Form 10-K for the year ended December 31, 2005, which was filed with the SEC on March 13, 2006, and its proxy statement for its 2006 annual meeting of stockholders, which was filed with the SEC on April 21, 2006, and information regarding XM's directors and executive officers is available in XM's Annual Report on Form 10-K, for the year ended December 31, 2005, which was filed with the SEC on March 3, 2006 and its proxy statement for its 2006 annual meeting of shareholders, which was filed with the SEC on April 25, 2006. Other information regarding the participants in the proxy solicitation and a description of their direct and indirect interests, by security holdings or otherwise, will be contained in the Joint Proxy Statement/Prospectus and other relevant materials to be filed with the SEC when they become available.    SOURCE  XM Satellite Radio       /CONTACT: Chance Patterson, +1-202-380-4318, Nathaniel Brown, +1-212-708-6170, both for XM Satellite Radio      /Web site: http://www.xmradio.com      /Web site: http://www.xmradio.com/promise     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  March 02, 2007 07:01 ET (12:01 GMT)
