Headline: : CN Freight Derailment Continues To Disrupt VIA Service Between Toronto And Oshawa
Story: TORONTO, March 2 /CNW/ - Due to a CN freight train derailment at Pickering, Ontario, yesterday, VIA Rail Canada is transporting passengers already holding tickets by motor coach between Toronto and Oshawa, in both directions, until the line is reopened to rail traffic (expected to reopen this afternoon). This affects all trains operating on the Montreal-Toronto and Ottawa-Toronto routes.    As a result of this disruption, VIA has also had to temporarily suspend new ticket sales on all trains for travel over the portion of track that is currently closed (Toronto-Oshawa-Toronto). Other public transportation alternatives between Toronto and Oshawa are available for passengers wishing to buy VIA tickets to or from Oshawa only (e.g. Oshawa to Ottawa, Montreal to Oshawa).    All other VIA routes in the VIA Windsor-Québec City corridor are operating with only minor delays despite major storm that has now hit Québec.    VIA wishes to apologize for any inconvenience and for the expected delays this disruption may cause to its passengers. Customers wishing further information may call 1 888-VIA RAIL (842-7245).    VIA will issue an update as new information becomes available.         /CONTACT: Catherine Kaloutsky, VIA Corporate Communications, (647) 228-1127, Seychelle Harding, VIA Corporate Communications, (514) 871-6119     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  March 02, 2007 07:55 ET (12:55 GMT)

Headline: Nokia Wins 3G Network Pact With RCS & RDS In Romania -2-
Story: Edited Press Release   "Fast time to market and cost-efficiency are of key importance to RCS & RDS in launching 3G services in Romania," said Alexandru Oprea, President of RCS & RDS. "Nokia's high-quality network and services provide us the support that we need in acquiring customers and offering them the best 3G mobile services in Romania."   Nokia's WCDMA 3G radio and core network supply to RCS & RDS includes the Nokia Flexi WCDMA Base Station, the Nokia MSC Server mobile softswitch and the Nokia Flexi Intelligent Service Node (ISN). The network will be supported by the Nokia NetAct(TM) network and service management system. Nokia will also provide RCS & RDS with network planning, implementation, project management, maintenance, 3rd party support, hardware repair, and training services. Deliveries have started.     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  March 02, 2007 05:09 ET (10:09 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: As Spotlight On Ethanol Shines, Logistical Challenges At Fore
Story: (This article was originally published Thursday)         By Beth Heinsohn     Of DOW JONES NEWSWIRES     NEW YORK (Dow Jones)--Ethanol's profile as an alternative to gasoline has gained luster in the wake of President George W. Bush's call for dramatically boosting its use in the next decade, but it's also raised an important question: how to transport it most efficiently.   While ethanol has been used as a fuel in the U.S. since the early 1900s, the concentration of its production in the corn-growing Midwest and the relatively small volumes involved have made railcars the most natural choice of long-haul transport since the Energy Act of 2005 and the introduction of the Renewable Fuels Standard, a federal mandate for the use of biofuels.   That contrasts with gasoline and diesel fuel, which have long been shipped through pipelines in far larger quantities.   Ethanol demand, largely a function of the Renewable Fuels Standard, will play a big role in determining the course of the fuel's transportation. Between Bush's call to increase the standard to 35 billion gallons of non-petroleum fuel by 2017 and proposed legislation that envisions a standard of as much as 60 billion gallons annually by 2030, ethanol is set to become more entrenched in the U.S. fuel complex. The prospect has fuel marketers and biofuel producers looking at the logistical challenges that have kept ethanol out of pipelines until now and thinking ahead.   The pipeline companies who serve fuel marketers have concerns about the operational and economic feasibility of shipping ethanol through pipelines. High on the list is "stress-corrosion cracking," that has been observed in pipelines and storage tanks that contain ethanol. Fully understanding how the damage occurs and how to get around it requires substantial research, said Mike Mears, vice president at Magellan Midstream Partners. Magellan's pipeline system stretches from the Texas Gulf Coast to Minnesota near the biggest concentration of biorefineries in the country.   At a minimum, the industry is two to three years away from having answers on the technical issues, Mears said. He noted that the Pipeline Research Council International is conducting three research initiatives on ethanol transportation.        Economics Of Ethanol Pipelines Questioned     There are opportunities to move ethanol-blended gasoline in existing pipelines but they're limited. "It makes sense only if a whole market has to use that blend," Mears said, referring to cleaner-burning gasoline required for use in the smoggiest urban areas of the country. However, no pipelines have so far wanted to risk integrity problems by running ethanol blends. Mears is also the current chairman of the Association of Oil Pipelines (AOPL).   There are also concerns about the economic viability of ethanol-only pipelines. It takes a lot of product to make dedicated pipelines work, said Shirley Neff, AOPL spokeswoman.   "Most ethanol plants are small - comparable to an oil well rather than an oil field," Neff said. An expensive gathering process and distribution of plants over a wide area makes the aggregation of shipping volumes difficult and high-cost, she said. "And of course, siting new pipelines is not an easy thing to do," Neff added.   In Mears' opinion, long-haul ethanol pipelines aren't economical under the current Renewable Fuel Standard. "If it were to increase, the economics could change," but an expansion of the standard is by no means certain, Mears said.   According to the Renewable Fuels Standard, 4.7 billion gallons of renewable fuels must be used in 2007 and increase to 7.5 billion by 2012. Current U.S. gasoline consumption is about 382.2 million gallons a day, or 139.5 billion gallons annually.   There are other geographical reasons why pipelines aren't the most economical solution. The U.S. "pipeline system originates in the Gulf Coast and goes north from there," said Matt Hartwig, spokesman for the Renewable Fuels Association, referring to rail, truck and barge transport. "Ethanol producers would have to ship product down to the Gulf in order to put it into pipelines,"         Rail Virtual Pipeline     In addition, the existing fuel pipeline system is filled near to capacity. That leaves rail transport. U.S. rail companies provide the long-haul piece of the "virtual pipeline" for ethanol and have increased transport efficiency by running unit trains composed of as many as 90 rail cars that hold 30,000 gallons each.   Ethanol shipments constitute less than 1% of all the freight hauled by rail in the U.S., but the volume of ethanol shipments is fast increasing. The total increased 2.7 times to 3.18 billion gallons between 2000 and 2006 and is expected to rise by about one third to 4.2 billion gallons by the end of 2007, according to data from the Association of American Railroads.   Rail companies such as CSX Corp. (CSX) expect to be able to handle a large increase in the Renewable Fuel Standard and relish the prospect of increasing what is now a very small part of their business.   If a new standard totaled 35 billion gallons and all of that were ethanol moving by rail, the increase in total carloadswould be less than 5%, according to Kyle Hancock, CSX vice president of industrial and agricultural products.   The ethanol transportation market is a small one for CSX but growing at double-digit rates, it's an emerging market with solid growth possibilities, Hancock said.   While the Southeast region from the Carolinas to Florida doesn't yet have the terminals to handle unit trains, it's a market "poised to develop," he said.   Railroads could also increase their participation in the ethanol market at the other end by moving corn to ethanol production facilities, he added.     -By Beth Heinsohn; Dow Jones Newswires; 201-938-4435; beth.heinsohn@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  March 02, 2007 07:32 ET (12:32 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: Poland's Netia Hldgs 4Q Loss Widens To PLN373M; Revs Shrink
Story: WARSAW (Dow Jones)--Poland's largest alternative telephone operator, Netia Holdings SA (NET.WA), said Friday its consolidated losses widened in the fourth quarter on a shrinking core revenues and rising costs of wireless start-up venture.   Netia fourth quarter losses widenedto 373 million zlotys ($126.2 million) from a loss of PLN11.6 million in the year-earlier period.   For 2006, Netia posted a loss of PLN378.9 million compared to a net profit of PLN59 million in 2005.   The company's fourth quarter total revenues fell 11.7%, to PLN209.7 million, from PLN237.4 million.   Netia said its share of losses due to start-up costs of P4 recorded for the fourth quarter was PLN15.7 million, and PLN30.7 million in the full year.   P4, Poland's newest mobile plans to launch third-generation services under the universal mobile telecommunications system, or UMTS, in March 2007.   Thursday, Netia shares closed flat, at PLN4.50 on the Warsaw Stock Exchange.   The stock underpefromed over last year due to delayed launch of mobile services by P4.   Company Website: http://investor.netia.pl     -By Malgorzata Halaba, Dow Jones Newswires; +4822 622-2766; malgorzata.halaba@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  March 02, 2007 01:28 ET (06:28 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: : Resolve Business Outsourcing Income Fund Reports Fourth Quarter and Year-End Results
Story: TORONTO, ONTARIO--(CCNMatthews - March 1, 2007) -    Attention Business and Financial Editors:    Resolve Business Outsourcing Income Fund (the "Fund") (TSX:RBO.UN) today announced financial results for its fourth quarter and the results for the nine and one-half months ended December 31, 2006. All amounts are in Canadian dollars.    Year-end highlights:    - Revenues - $214.8 million    - Net earnings from continuing operations - $3.9 million    - Net earnings - $4.6 million or $0.20 per unit - basic ($0.19 per unit - fully diluted)    - Distributable cash - $27.5 million or $0.84 per unit    Fourth quarter revenues were $65.3 million. The loss from continuing operations and the net loss for the quarter was $2.2 million. Distributable cash for the fourth quarter was $2.2 million or $0.06 per unit. Revenue for the quarter, as expected, was lower due to seasonality. In addition, the Fund recorded an unrealized loss of $1.9 million during the quarter that negatively impacted earnings.    The year-end results are for the period March 17, 2006 to December 31, 2006. Comparison of those results to certain of the pro forma financial results included in the Prospectus of the Fund dated March 9, 2006 is included in the information attached to this press release.    "We are pleased with the accomplishments made during our first year as a public company", said Lawrence Zimmering, president and chief executive officer. "We achieved our financial targets for 2006, landed several significant contracts, and made important progress in the integration of CSRS into Resolve. In addition, we established a strong foundation for growth beginning in 2007, put in place both a strong and active Board of Directors and an aligned focused senior management team."    About Resolve    Resolve is a progressive business process outsourcing (BPO) firm, providing services to over 1,000 blue-chip businesses and governments across North America. Resolve delivers essential business functions to its clients on an outsourced basis, enabling them to spend more time focused on building customer relationships, growing sales revenue, and improving operational efficiency. Resolve's diverse BPO solution portfolio includes Finance and Administrative solutions (F&A), Customer Relationship Management solutions (CRM), and Supply Chain Management solutions (SCM). Along with various government ministries and agencies, Resolve's clients include some of the most recognizable brand names from the financial services, retail, consumer goods and manufacturing sectors. Resolve Business Outsourcing Income Fund is listed on the Toronto Stock Exchange, symbol RBO.UN. For more information, visit www.resolve.com.    Conference Call    A conference call hosted by Lawrence Zimmering, president and CEO, and Jamie Hyde, executive vice president and CFO, will be held at 10:00 a.m. (EST) on March 2, 2007, to review these results and answer any questions.    To participate in the conference call, please dial 416-695-6622 or 1-800-769-8320. A live audio webcast will also be available at www.vcall.com/IC/CEPage.asp?ID=113999.    For anyone unable to access the scheduled call, a taped rebroadcast will be available until March 16, 2007, by dialing 416-695-5275 or 1-888-509-0081. The access code for the rebroadcast is 640253.    CAUTIONARY STATEMENT ON FORWARD-LOOKING INFORMATION  This news release contains certain "forward-looking information" under applicable securities laws. Such forward-looking information may involve known and unknown risks, uncertainties and other factors that may cause the actual results, performance or achievements of Resolve, or industry results, to be materially different from any future results, performance, achievements, or opportunities expressed or implied by such forward-looking information. Headline: : Aquair Signs Letter of Intent With Australian Dept. of Defence to Provide Aquair(TM) Pure Water Generation Equipment
Story: RANCHO SANTA MARGARITA, Calif., March 2 /PRNewswire-FirstCall/ -- Following a successful demonstration of its Aquair(TM) atmospheric water generation technology, Aquair, Inc., a wholly owned subsidiary of RG Global Lifestyles, Inc. (OTC Bulletin Board: RGBL), announced today that it has signed a Letter of Intent with the Australian Dept. of Defence to provide the Australian military with an Aquair unit for a formal three-month pilot program and potential deployment.  Aquair anticipates that the contract for the pilot program will produce revenue of approximately US$2 million.     During the three-day demonstration in Surfers Paradise Australia, Aquair, utilized its mobile Aquair unit to produce from the humid air and a brackish pond approximately 260 gallons per day of pure, drinkable water, a 30% increase over average production capacity of 200 gallons per day.  Normally, Aquair units extract water solely from the air.  However, during this trial, the Aquair unit was fitted with additional equipment so that it also could process brackish pond water into a potable water supply.     Australia's meager average annual rainfall of 465 mm (18.3 in.), high salinity levels and large geographic areas covered by solid rock without underlying water-holding sedimentary basins all contribute to readily available drinking water being in short supply in much of Australia.     "Our mobile Aquair 'Air to Water' units will help provide a continuous supply of pure, safe water for the military wherever they go," said Louis Knickerbocker, Chairman & CEO of RG Global Lifestyles, the worldwide distributor of the atmospheric water generation units.  "Where water supplies are contaminated or not readily available, Aquair reduces the need to rely on transported, bottled water -- freeing up resources for transporting other essential supplies to military personnel."        About Aquair and RG Global Lifestyles, Inc.:     Aquair, Inc. solely develops and distributes quality water products. Providing a safe alternative to the world's deteriorating water supply that increasingly has microbial contamination, Aquair uses the latest in atmospheric technology with advanced filtration systems to provide microbial purification for the production of pure, safe water anywhere in the world. Further information is available at www.aquair.com or by calling (877) 6-AQUAIR.     RG Global Lifestyles, Inc. develops and distributes quality industrial and residential water products using the latest in water production and treatment technologies to provide pure safe water around the world.  RG Global's products address many water quality issues, including remedying the increasingly prevalent microbial water supply contamination and contamination resulting from oil and gas production.  For more information, visit www.rgglife.com        Safe Harbor Statement     The statements contained herein that are not historical are forward- looking statements that are subject to risks and uncertainties that could cause actual results to differ materially from those expressed in the forward- looking statements, including, but not limited to, risks associated water generation products, risks associated with dependence on third parties, and other risks identified from time to time in the Company's reports and registration statements filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission. All forward-looking statements attributable to the Company, or persons acting for the Company, are expressly qualified in their entirety by these cautionary statements.     Contact:  Julie Shepherd, Accentuate PR, +1 815 479 1833, Julie@accentuatepr.com    SOURCE  RG Global Lifestyles, Inc.       /CONTACT: Julie Shepherd of Accentuate PR, +1-815-479-1833, Julie@accentuatepr.com, for RG Global Lifestyles, Inc.      /Web site: http://www.aquair.com      /Web site: http://www.rgglife.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  March 02, 2007 08:01 ET (13:01 GMT)

Headline: Royal Bank Of Canada Boosts Qtr Div On Record 1Q Results >RY
Story: DOW JONES NEWSWIRES   Strong earnings across all business segments boosted Royal Bank of Canada's (RY) first-quarter earnings to a record level, leading the Canadian chartered bank to increased its quarterly dividend to 46 Canadian cents a share from 40 Canadian cents.   The Toronto-based bank also announced plans to redeem all C$500 million (US$426 million) of its outstanding 6.75% subordinated debentures due June 4, 2012 for 100% of the principal amount plus accrued interest. The redemption will occur on June 4.   Royal Bank of Canada earned C$1.49 billion or C$1.14 a share in its latest quarter, up from C$1.17 billion or 89 Canadian cents a year earlier.   The Thomson First Call mean estimate was for a first-quarter profit of 99 Canadian cents a share.   Return on equity was 27.3% versus 23.9%.   The bank's loan loss provisions jumped to C$162 million from C$47 million, primarily due to a C$50 million reversal of the general allowance in the year-earlier period and lower corporate recoveries this quarter.   Royal Bank said total revenue was up 15% to C$5.70 billion in the latest quarter as a result of solid growth in its wealth management and banking businesses.   The bank's dividend increase is effective with the dividend payable May 24 to shareholders of record on April 25.   -Judy McKinnon; 416-306-2100; AskNewswires@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  March 02, 2007 07:54 ET (12:54 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: MacDonald Dettwiler Gets U.K. Valuation Info System Pact
Story: DOW JONES NEWSWIRES   MacDonald Dettwiler and Associates Ltd.'s (MDA.T) U.K. subsidiary, xit2, has provided Savills Private Finance with a valuation information solution to manage the information exchange between Savills and its valuation advisers.   The value of the agreement wasn't disclosed.   MacDonald Dettwiler said its solution will replace Savills' current fax-based system, allowing advisers to conduct the valuation process in a more timely manner.   Savills Private Finance is the specialist financial services division of Savills PLC (SVS.LN), the UK's largest property consultancy business.   MacDonald Dettwiler, Richmond, B.C., provides advanced information solutions.   -Judy McKinnon; 416-306-2100; AskNewswires@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  March 02, 2007 07:12 ET (12:12 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: Two Hldrs In Brazil Steelmaker Usiminas Plan To Sell Shares
Story: SAO PAULO (Dow Jones)--Brazilian steelmaker Usinas Siderurgicas de Minas Gerais (USIM5.BR), or Usiminas, said in a regulatory filing late Thursday that two of its shareholders intend to register the sale of stakes in the company with local stock regulators.   Usiminas said that Brazilian mining giant Companhia Vale do Rio Doce (RIO), or CVRD, and Previ, the pension fund for workers at state-owned Banco do Brasil S.A (BBAS3.BR), plan to sell shares in a secondary offer.   However, Usiminas did not unveil a timetable for other details about the offer, which must be approved by the Brazil's Securities Commission, or CVM. The shares will be sold in Brazil and to institutional investors in the U.S.   The share sales were previously announced in November, when CVRD entered the controlling bloc of Usiminas' shareholders. The shares to be sold by CVRD do not represent the miner's position in the controlling group.   As part of the new shareholders' deals, CVRD agreed to reduce its stake in Usiminas by selling a portion of its shares to Nippon Steel, Votorantim Participacoes and Camargo Correa. The remaining shares would be sold in a public secondary offer.   In December 2005, CVRD said it was interested in joining the bloc in an effort to help define the flat-steel makers' future expansion plans.   CVRD holds a 12.4% stake in Usiminas, representing 5.9% of the controlling group's shares. Previ, which is outside the controlling bloc of shareholders, detains a 14.9% stake in Usiminas.   As of Nov. 24, Usiminas's controlling group of shareholders held 63.9% of the company's outstanding shares, or 71.7 million shares. The controlling group is lead by Nippon Usiminas, which represents a consortium of Japanese investors led by Nippon Steel Corp. (5401.TO) with a 24.7% stake.   Two local industrial conglomerates, Votorantim and Camargo Correa, are the second-largest participants in the controlling bloc with a combined 23.1% stake. The pension fund for Usiminas workers had a 10.1% stake.   The money raised from the sale of Usiminas shares would generate additional cash for CVRD to pay part of the bridge loan used to finance its $18 billion acquisition of Canadian nickel miner Inco Ltd. (N) in the fourth quarter of 2006. CVRD has already refinanced more than 80% of the $15.6 billion bridge loan.     -By Rogerio Jelmayer, Dow Jones Newswires; 5511-3145-1480; rogerio.jelmayer@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  March 02, 2007 07:39 ET (12:39 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: Govt To Rule On RWE Biblis Plant Lifespan Within 2 Wks -2
Story: The decision affects RWE's application to transfer 30 terrawatt-hours of generation capacity over to Biblis A from its Muelheim-Kaerlich nuclear plant. If approved, the transfer would effectively extent Biblis A's life span.   RWE has also filed an application for a transfer of generation capacity from its Lingen facility to Biblis A in case the Muelheim-Kaerlich doesn't get approval. The environment ministry didn't provide details about this application process.   Germany is in the process of gradually phasing out nuclear power by around 2021.   Biblis A is scheduled to go offline sometime in mid-2008 under the existing nuclear exit plan.     -By Andrea Thomas, Dow Jones Newswires; +49 (0)30 2888 410; andrea.thomas@dowjones.com   (Jan Hromadko in Frankfurt contributed to this report.)     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  March 02, 2007 07:14 ET (12:14 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: WSJE(3/2) E.On Expansion Options Shrink With Endesa Bid
Story: (From THE WALL STREET JOURNAL EUROPE)     By Mike Esterl   FRANKFURT -- A year ago, when it launched what was then Europe's largest ever cash-only bid for a rival, German power giant E.On AG thought it had solved the riddle of what to do with its huge cash pile.   That plan is now in disarray.   Italian competitor Enel SpA snapped up a big minority stake in Spain's Endesa SA this week, threatening to unravel E.On's 41 billion euros ($54.26 billion) tender offer for the Iberian peninsula's largest utility just when success seemed assured. E.On now finds itself with fewer strategic options for its cash. Its ambition to increase its heft faces a shrinking list of acquisition candidates, rising takeover premiums and meddlesome European politics.   The German company's share price has fallen nearly 10% in the past week amid no clear signs of a compelling "Plan B" if the Endesa takeover fails. The German bank WestLB published a research report on E.On under the heading "Mission Impossible?" as it lowered its recommendation on the stock following Enel's surprise move.   E.On declined to comment and hasn't said much publicly. It issued a brief statement Wednesday reiterating that it "remains committed" to acquiring Endesa. Its shares fell 1.5% to 97.63 euros Thursday on Germany's Xetra exchange.   E.On, of Dusseldorf, has banked heavily on acquiring Endesa to cement its position as Europe's largest power and natural-gas utility by revenue. Electricite de France SA, the continent's other leading utility, has a larger stock-market value.   Endesa would extend E.On's reach into faster-growing markets in southern Europe and South America. Until now, E.On has focused on Central Europe, the U.K., Nordic countries and the U.S.   Italy's Enel bought a 9.99% stake in Endesa late Tuesday. It secured rights to another 11.58% on Thursday through share-swap deals to boost its stake to 21.57%, pending Spanish regulatory approval. Enel's holdings, combined with a 21% stake held by Spain's Acciona SA, could make it all but impossible for E.On to secure control.   Under Spanish takeover laws, E.On also can't increase its current offer, which expires at the end of March. When that offer expires, the company is prohibited from making a new offer for six months unless another company makes a bid to acquire Endesa.   E.On may try to challenge the recent moves by Enel and Acciona in court, especially if there is any indication that the Italian and Spanish companies broke takeover rules by acting in concert to block the bid. But such a legal strategy is no sure thing and could drag out the dispute indefinitely. "If it takes years, this could be more of a negative than a positive," says Susana Penarrubia Fraguas, a fund manager who focuses on utilities at Deutsche Asset Management, a unit of Deutsche Bank AG. (She declined to say whether the fund owns E.On shares.)   Some analysts and investors say E.On may also try to sit down with Enel and Acciona to win their support by offering to share some of Endesa's assets or other holdings. But such concessions could prove costly and are no sure thing, especially if Enel or Acciona are intent on gaining control themselves, they add.   At the same time, E.On's management has less room to maneuver if another company makes a takeover offer for Endesa and the German company can make a renewed bid. E.On's current offer of 38.75 euros a share, raised twice during the past year, is already 41% higher than its original bid of 27.50 euros in February 2006. "Above 40 euros, I don't think many [E.On] investors would be happy with this takeover," said Stella Dombrowsky, a buy-side analyst in Zurich at the private bank Julius Baer.   But other acquisition targets also have become increasingly expensive after share prices of European utilities jumped by about a third in euro terms last year. Targets also have become increasingly scarce after E.On's bid for Endesa triggered a consolidation push in Europe's power sector.   Spain's Iberdrola SA recently agreed to a friendly takeover of Scottish Power PLC after E.On broke off talks with the U.K. utility in late 2005. Essent NV and Nuon NV of the Netherlands recently agreed to merge and France's Suez SA and Gaz de France SA are hoping to combine their businesses.   Governments still hold stakes in utilities in such countries as Italy, France, the Czech Republic and Finland, making takeovers even tougher as protectionist sentiment rises in Europe. Many politicians view utilities as strategic assets and want to keep them in the hands of national champions -- as has been the case in Spain, where the government set up frequent roadblocks in the past 12 months to slow down E.On's takeover bid for Endesa.   E.On's management has signaled it would like to tackle Russia's electricity market, enter Turkey and expand its small footprint in Italy. Analysts say E.On also could try to boost its exposure in the U.S. or pursue some companies on the privatization block in a handful of Eastern European countries.   But such investments could take a lot of time and likely involve lots of small steps instead of the quantum leap that Endesa represents. "You're not going to be able to get a quick fix," said Christopher Kuplent, a utilities analyst in London with Credit Suisse.   In the near term, say analysts and investors, E.On might be confined to buying back its shares and increasing dividends in a bid to keep investors on board if the Endesa takeover falls through.   E.On reported revenue of 49.45 billion euros and net income of 2.63 billion euros in the first nine months of 2006. It had a net cash position of 1.04 billion euros and 12.5 billion euros in liquid funds at the end of September.   ---   Keith Johnson in Madrid contributed to this article.     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  March 02, 2007 00:31 ET (05:31 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: Amgen To Invest SEK1B In Swedish Biotech Firms - Newspaper
Story: STOCKHOLM (Dow Jones)--U.S. biotech company Amgen Inc. (AMGN) is to invest 1 billion Swedish kronor ($142.4 million) in Swedish biotech companies, Swedish newspaper Dagens Industri reports Friday.   "We are ready to invest big money, about the size of what we invested in Biovitrum, about SEK1 billion," Peter Persson, head of Amgen Sweden, told the paper.   Amgen has so far invested SEK1 billion in Swedish biotech projects since 1995, of which its investment in Biovitrum AB (BVT.SK) is the largest, the paper said.   It says Amgen will launch a campaign in two weeks to present itself as an investor to Swedish companies.   Newspaper Web site: http://www.di.se     -Stockholm Bureau, Dow Jones Newswires; +46 8 545 130 90     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  March 02, 2007 02:46 ET (07:46 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: Bayer To Cut 6,100 Jobs Globally After Schering Buy >BAY -2-
Story: Bayer in March last year said it intended to buy Schering and expected to make about 6,000 job cuts, forecasting synergies of around EUR700 million from 2009 onward.   Bayer Friday said that of the 6,100 job cuts, 1,500 will be in Germany, where Schering employs around 7,000 people and Bayer has 37,600 employees.   Bayer didn't say exactly which locations of the combined group would be affected.   The company Wednesday said it was to cut 950 jobs in Berlin, the site of Schering's headquarters where 6,000 Schering staff are based.     (MORE TO FOLLOW) Dow Jones Newswires  March 02, 2007 04:19 ET (09:19 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: : Nokia Wins 3G Network Contract With RCS & RDS in Romania
Story: The Agreement Marks a New Customer for Nokia       ESPOO, Finland, March 2 /PRNewswire-FirstCall/ -- Romanian fixed and greenfield mobile operator, RCS & RDS, has selected Nokia as its WCDMA 3G core and radio network supplier. With Nokia's support the operator will be able to quickly enter the Romanian 3G mobile market and offer a wide range of services under the brand name Digi.Tel. RCDS & RDS has recently launched its 3G service.     "Fast time to market and cost-efficiency are of key importance to RCS & RDS in launching 3G services in Romania," says Alexandru Oprea, President of RCS & RDS. "Nokia's high-quality network and services provide us the support that we need in acquiring customers and offering them the best 3G mobile services in Romania."     "Acquiring new customers and generating customer loyalty depends largely on how reliably services are delivered. The technical service delivery machinery, the network, must be properly designed and assured. We are confident that RCS & RDS will be able to make a strong entry to the Romanian 3G mobile market thanks to Nokia's solutions such as the Nokia Flexi WCDMA Base Station and the Nokia MSC Server mobile softswitch," says Filip Rommelaere, General Manager for the Balkans, Networks, Nokia.     Nokia's WCDMA 3G radio and core network supply to RCS & RDS includes the Nokia Flexi WCDMA Base Station, the Nokia MSC Server mobile softswitch and the Nokia Flexi Intelligent Service Node (ISN). The network will be supported by the Nokia NetAct(TM) network and service management system. Nokia will also provide RCS & RDS with network planning, implementation, project management, maintenance, 3rd party support, hardware repair, and training services. Deliveries have started.     In WCDMA 3G, Nokia has 67 customers to date. Almost half of the commercially launched WCDMA 3G networks have Nokia equipment. Nokia Flexi WCDMA Base Station is a space-saving modular innovation that enables operators to make more efficient use of their base station sites, leading to significant site cost savings through reduced site construction work, quick base station installation and decreased power consumption. All these make the Nokia Flexi WCDMA Base Station an environmentally friendly solution.     Nokia is creating seamless personalized user experiences in fixed and mobile networks thanks to the Nokia Unified Core Network solution. With close to 130 customers for its mobile softswitching and over 50 live networks, Nokia is clearly the most experienced mobile softswitching supplier worldwide.        About RCS&RDS S.A.     RCS & RDS is one of the leading telecommunication service providers in Romania and the Baltics and offers fully integrated telecommunication solutions and services to business and residential users: cable and satellite television, Internet, data communication, and fixed and mobile telephony. The services are based on RCS & RDS' modern technology and self-operated network.     In December 2006, RCS & RDS won the contest for a 3G licence, issued by IGCTI (Inspectoratul General pentru Comunicare si Tehnologia Informatiei). In March 2007, the company launched its 3rd generation mobile communications service - branded as Digi.Tel. For more information, please visit www.rcs-rds.ro.        About Nokia     Nokia is a world leader in mobile communications, driving the growth and sustainability of the broader mobility industry. Nokia connects people to each other and the information that matters to them with easy-to-use and innovative products like mobile phones, devices and solutions for imaging, games, media and businesses. Nokia provides equipment, solutions and services for network operators and corporations.    www.nokia.com    SOURCE  Nokia       /CONTACT: Media Enquiries: Nokia, Networks, Communications, Tel. +358-7180-31399, Nokia, Communications, Tel. +358-7180-34900, Email: press.office@nokia.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  March 02, 2007 05:39 ET (10:39 GMT)

Headline: FATHOM FINANCIAL: Carrying Risk
Story: By Danny Gabay   Of Fathom Financial Consulting   LONDON (Dow Jones)--As with most things in life, the trick to economic forecasting is timing.   Had we known what was coming in the markets, this would not have been the week we would have chosen to publish our quarterly forecast for the G4 economies and their financial markets.   But publish we did. And on reflection that was the right thing to do. Because rather than undoing our analysis, if anything this week's events have served to highlight key issues that we want to draw investors' attention to.   It is with some irony that in the midst of the most turbulent week in financial markets in many months, perhaps years, we say that the central theme of our latest quarterly G4 forecast is an optimistic one.   Abstracting from this week's turbulence for a moment, lower oil prices play a large role in our thinking. We have interpreted the decline since mid 2006 as a positive supply shock, delivering stronger growth and lower inflation. Goldilocks, it seems, is back.   The major downside risks to the smooth running of the global payments system that have dogged financial markets in recent years, in the shape of a run on the dollar and a housing-led U.S. recession have receded, both in terms of their likely severity and in terms of the likelihood of their occurring.   It is not so much the actual change in asset prices that occurred this week that has got people worked up. All said and done, the net change in asset prices has been relatively small. But rather it is what it might portend.   As ever there are risks to this benign outlook, as this week has amply demonstrated. The major downside risk that we identified was an abrupt unwinding of the yen carry trade.   The yen today is perhaps the world's most undervalued currency. It recently hit a four-year low against the dollar and an all-time low against the euro. Its real trade-weighted value has fallen to its lowest level since at least 1985, the year of the Plaza Accord.   The Economist's Big Mac index suggests that the yen is some 40% undervalued against the euro. Our own modeling work suggests that it could be similarly undervalued against the dollar. Its weakness is of course linked to the increasingly ubiquitous carry trade.   At its simplest, the carry trade involves borrowing in yen at very low interest rates to buy higher-yielding assets, such as U.S. or New Zealand bonds.   This weakens the yen and strengthens other asset prices as investors sell the borrowed yen for other currencies. The existence of this carry trade is widely blamed for the surprising weakness of the yen, and the correspondingly surprising strength of other higher yielding assets.   To get an insight into the pervasive nature of the carry trade in today's financial system, Google "yen carry trade." You will get more than 70,000 hits, many including a bloodcurdling warning of impending financial disaster.   It is rather easy to see the attractiveness of the yen carry trade by using a real world example. Take an investor who went short yen and reinvested in dollars, unhedged. Ignoring transactions costs, he would have earned a cumulative return of 37% between January 2000 and January 2007.   Nonetheless, this upsets economists. Their textbooks more or less rule out the profitable existence of the carry trade.   In theory, foreign exchange markets operate under uncovered interest parity. At its simplest, this states that the interest differential between two countries should equal the expected exchange rate change, and hence investors should be indifferent between holding any one of two currencies. Under UIP then, a country with high interest rates is compensating investors for the risk that its currency will depreciate, and vice versa.   There are two plausible explanations for this apparent anomaly. The first is the traditional appeal to the exchange rate risk premium, which could dominate interest rate differentials.   The second, and in our view more pertinent explanation, is that the distribution of likely outcomes for the yen-dollar exchange rate is heavily skewed. For example, investors might put a 90% probability on the yen-dollar exchange rate remaining unchanged over the next year, but would attach a 10% probability to the yen appreciating by 40%.   The UIP condition is not violated, but investors could still make a profit by borrowing in yen and lending in dollars nine times out of 10.   However there will always be that 10% risk of a reversal. And that was the key message from this week's turbulence. In all likelihood, the global payments system should avoid a major crunch, but there is a small but significant risk that it could all end in tears.   Hence even though Japanese interest rates will remain incredibly low by international standards in all but the most extreme scenarios, carry investors are nonetheless vulnerable to low probability, high impact events. That is why the carry trade has been compared to picking up nickels in front of a steamroller.   This is not an entirely new phenomenon.   It used to be known as the peso problem during much of the 1980s and 1990s, when the Mexican peso was the favored counterpart to the dollar as it consistently offered a positive interest rate differential. Until that is events like the 1984 Latin American debt crisis and the so-called Tequila crisis of 1995 wiped out most of the preceding years' gains.   There is of course a more recent historical precedent.   Many credit a rapid unwinding of the yen carry trade with a good deal of ensuing financial turmoil in the final few months of 1998. The combination of Russia's default, the near-collapse of Long-Term Capital Management and the Japanese government's attempt to recapitalise Japan's ailing banking system, proved too much for those betting on a permanently weak yen.   The yen rose by 12% in just 3 days between the Oct. 5 and Oct. 8, 1998, pushing U.S. 10-year yields up by 65 basis points. Many also credit the then Fed Chairman Alan Greenspan with preventing a far more problematic credit crunch by swiftly cutting U.S. interest rates.   What is unclear is just how big the carry trade is. The problem is that these trades typically occur off-balance sheet via instruments like currency swaps, which makes its size very difficult to estimate. Estimates range from as little as $39 billion to $1 trillion.   But using 1998 as a guide, we find that depending on the size of the carry trade, an abrupt reversal could reduce U.S. growth by up to 1.4 percentage points. The ensuing financial market turmoil could of course outweigh the macroeconomic impact.   And in our view, the most likely trigger is rising yen volatility.   Of course there are risks to the upside, too. Principal among them is the risk posed by excess real money balances, which remain at close to multi-decade highs.   Again exceptionally low Japanese interest rates are a factor here, but European credit demand is also contributing. Despite tightening monetary conditions, euro area M3 growth shows no sign yet of easing.   The risk is that this monetary overhang begins to find its way through to higher nominal demand, and inflation in particular.   That could push already elevated inflation expectations up further, forcing even reluctant central banks to tighten monetary policy more than currently expected.   We attach a 52% chance to ECB rates reaching beyond 4% within the next year; and a 21% chance that U.S. rates reach 6%.   Despite this week's gyrations, we forecast that 2007 should be a bonanza year for equity markets. One of the key reasons for arguing this is valuations, which remain historically low.   Japan has the highest price-earnings ratio in our sample. But even that is only 20, roughly half what it was in the late 1980s or where it stood in 2000 for the Nasdaq.   By contrast, we expect this year to be another tough one for bonds. Valuations are high and despite lower oil prices, stronger global growth implies upward pressure on core inflation.   But beware those low probability, high impact events.     By Danny Gabay, 44-207-796-9561; danny.gabay@fathom-consulting.com   (Danny Gabay is director of Fathom Financial Consulting and was previously chief UK economist for JP Morgan Chase.)   Opinions expressed are those of the author, and not of Dow Jones Newswires.   This column is published for information only, and it neither constitutes, nor is to be construed as, an offer to buy or sell investments. The information and opinions expressed herein are based on sources the author believes to be reliable, but he cannot represent that they are accurate or complete. Any information herein is given in good faith, but is subject to change without notice. No liability is accepted whatsoever by Fathom Financial Consulting and employees for any direct or consequential loss arising from this article.     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  March 02, 2007 06:00 ET (11:00 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: : Diana Shipping Inc. Announces Off Hire Days in Connection With an Incident Pertaining to MV Coronis
Story: ATHENS, Greece, March 2 /PRNewswire-FirstCall/ -- Diana Shipping Inc. (NYSE: DSX), a global shipping company specializing in the transportation of dry bulk cargoes, today announced that the employment of one of its Panamax bulk carriers, the MV Coronis, has been temporarily disrupted due to a grounding incident during a ballast trip towards her next loading port in the Baltic Sea. The vessel suffered minor damage to the hull with no pollution resulting from the grounding and subsequent re-floating.     The vessel is on her way to a ship repair yard in Poland for dry-docking and hull repairs.     The ballast trip together with delays caused by the incident and consequent repairs are expected to result in approximately 22 days off-hire, which can be translated into an approximately $605,000 reduction in the Company's gross revenues. The repair and other expenses are currently estimated to be in the region of $500,000. All repair costs and related expenses in excess of $100,000 are expected to be covered under the vessel's Hull and Machinery Insurance Policy.        The MV Coronis is a 74,381 dwt Panamax dry bulk carrier built in 2006.        About the Company     Diana Shipping Inc. (NYSE: DSX) is a global provider of shipping transportation services.  The Company specializes in transporting dry bulk cargoes, including such commodities as iron ore, coal, grain and other materials along worldwide shipping routes.        Cautionary Statement Regarding Forward-Looking Statement     Matters discussed in this press release may constitute forward-looking statements. The Private Securities Litigation Reform Act of 1995 provides safe harbor protections for forward-looking statements in order to encourage companies to provide prospective information about their business. Although we believe that these assumptions were reasonable when made, because these assumptions are inherently subject to significant uncertainties and contingencies which are difficult or impossible to predict and are beyond our control, we cannot assure you that we will achieve or accomplish these expectations, beliefs or projections.     In addition to these important factors, other important factors that, in our view, could cause actual results to differ materially from those discussed in the forward-looking statements include the strength of world economies and currencies, general market conditions, including fluctuations in charter rates and vessel values, changes in demand for dry bulk shipping capacity, changes in our operating expenses, including bunker prices, drydocking and insurance costs, the market for our vessels, availability of financing and refinancing, changes in governmental rules and regulations or actions taken by regulatory authorities, potential liability from pending or future litigation, general domestic and international political conditions, potential disruption of shipping routes due to accidents or political events, vessels breakdowns and instances of off-hires and other factors. Headline: : Backlog Continues Growing for Intevac, Inc.'s 200 Lean(R)
Story: SANTA CLARA, Calif.--(BUSINESS WIRE)--March 02, 2007--   Intevac, Inc. (Company) (Nasdaq:IVAC) has received an order for a 200 Lean(R) magnetic disk sputtering system scheduled for delivery in the first half of 2007.     Intevac Chief Executive Kevin Fairbairn stated: "We are pleased to receive this order, which resulted from a customer's acceleration of a planned third-quarter delivery into the second quarter, and increases our backlog for shipment in the first half of 2007 to twenty-seven 200 Lean systems, or 35% more than the twenty 200 Leans shipped in the first half of 2006."     The 200 Lean is Intevac's latest-generation disk sputtering system that provides significantly enhanced capabilities relative to the installed base of Intevac(R) MDP-250 systems. The 200 Lean provides higher throughput from a smaller footprint, which enables more magnetic disks to be manufactured per square foot of factory floor space, and is designed to reduce overall cost of ownership. The 200 Lean's flexible and modular design accommodates the production of multiple sizes of both aluminum and glass disks, as well as the growing number of thin-film process steps required by the adoption of advanced technologies such as perpendicular recording.       About Intevac     Intevac is the world's leading supplier of magnetic media sputtering equipment for the hard disk drive industry and a developer and provider of leading-edge extreme low-light imaging sensors, cameras, and systems. For more information call 408-986-9888, or visit the Company's website at www.intevac.com.       200 Lean(R) and Intevac(R) MDP-250 are registered trademarks of  Intevac, Inc.       Safe-Harbor Statement     This press release includes statements that constitute "forward-looking statements" within the meaning of the Private Securities Litigation Reform Act of 1995 (the "Reform Act"). Intevac claims the protection of the safe-harbor for forward-looking statements contained in the Reform Act. These forward-looking statements are often characterized by the terms "may," "believes," "projects," "expects," or "anticipates," and do not reflect historical facts. Specific forward-looking statements contained in this press release include, but are not limited to, scheduled deliveries of 200 Lean systems, and performance, capabilities, and features of the 200 Lean. The forward-looking statements contained herein involve risks and uncertainties that could cause actual results to differ materially from the Company's expectations. These risks include, but are not limited to: failure to deliver systems as expected or failure of the systems to perform as expected, each of which could have a material impact on our business, our financial results, and the Company's stock price. These risks and other factors are detailed in the Company's regular filings with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission.        CONTACT: Intevac, Inc. Headline: JD Wetherspoon 1H Pretax Pft GBP32.9M Vs GBP27.4M -2-
Story: Edited Press Release     Chairman Tim Martin said: "Like-for-like sales increased by 7.4% in the period and sales at new pubs were in line with expectations. The operating margin before property transactions, interest and tax increased to 10.5% (2006: 9.8%), with higher sales leading to improvements in this area. Net interest was covered 3.5 times (2006: 3.2 times) by operating profit. Total capital investment was GBP33.2 million."   "Free cash flow, after capital investment of GBP10.5 million in existing pubs, GBP1.1 million in respect of share purchases under the Company's Share Incentive Plan and payments of tax and interest, declined to GBP25.6 million (2006: GBP28.6 million). This decline was due to higher operating profits off-set by higher expenditure on existing pubs, a higher tax charge, timing differences in respect of payments to trade creditors, resulting from the period ending later in the month than in the previous year and planned increases in inventory. This resulted in free cash flow per share of 17.0 pence (2006: 16.8 pence) before investment in new pubs, proceeds from pub disposals and dividend payments.  In the period under review, all our new pub capital expenditure was financed from free cash flow. In addition we purchased 7.8 million of our own shares for cancellation at a cost of GBP40.8 million, with a cash outflow of GBP37.3 million in the period. "   "The first half saw the opening of 8 new pubs with a full year target of approximately 20. We also completed the disposal of 3 pubs, which had previously been identified for sale, to end the half year with 662 pubs. As previously indicated, the rate of new pub openings is expected to increase to around 30 per annum from the new financial year. "   "For many years, the Company has paid a high percentage of its profits through bonuses and share incentives to all levels of employees. In the period under review, the company paid bonuses of GBP9.0 million to employees, 90% of which was paid to people working in our pubs. In addition, we purchased GBP1.1 million worth of Wetherspoon shares under the SIP Scheme; taking into account previous purchases made, this results in a total pool of shares held on behalf of employees worth GBP23 million. Pubs depend, above all, on high levels of service, and these profit and share schemes help us to achieve the highest level of average sales of any substantial pub company."   "The Company continues to extend the scope and range of its products and services. Average sales per pub have expanded from approximately GBP500,000 per annum at the time of our flotation to an annualised rate of approximately GBP1.36 million per annum in the current year. During this time food sales have increased from about GBP500 per week to about GBP6,700 per week at the current time. Including drinks sales which accompany a meal, approximately 50% of our overall sales now relate to food. In addition, in the last couple of years, we have sought to increase coffee sales and are currently selling approximately 450,000 coffees per week. We have also extended our opening hours and are offering breakfasts and sell approximately 230,000 of these per week."   "As regards our drinks offers, we are currently placing a strong emphasis on traditional ale sales and sell approximately 33 million pints of real ale per annum. Ale volumes are currently growing by around 5%. We have also introduced a number of products rarely available in British pubs including our top selling cider Kopparberg, the number one Swedish cider; Wetherspoon sells more Kopparberg than anyone in the world, including Sweden. Our fastest growing bottled beer range comes from Poland and we have also introduced a range of guest lagers on draught from around the world. This selection of bar products, combined with our substantial investment in new technology for keeping beer at the required temperature throughout the year, will help us to gain a commercial advantage in the future."   "The Company now operates 61 non-smoking pubs outside Scotland, which have either been converted from 'smoking pubs' or have opened in the last couple of years as non-smoking pubs. The converted pubs showed substantial declines in sales and profits in the year following their conversion, but have shown encouraging like-for-like sales and profits growth, above the Company average, in the period under review. Scottish pubs, in which smoking was banned by legislation in March 2006, have performed at a better level than expected, with like-for-like sales increasing by 5% in the period under review, and with profits at the same level as the previous year."     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  March 02, 2007 02:06 ET (07:06 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: Zurich Fincl Expands Farmers Business With US Buy
Story: By Goran Mijuk   Of DOW JONES NEWSWIRES     ZURICH (Dow Jones)--Zurich Financial Services AG (ZURN.VX) Friday said its U.S. unit Farmers Group Inc intends to buy Bristol West Holdings (BRW) for around $712 million, helping to beef up the Swiss insurer's U.S. operations.   As part of the transaction, Farmers will, however, immediately sell the underlying insurance business to the Farmers Exchanges, which Zurich Financial's Farmers Group unit manages but doesn't own.   Under the terms of the agreement, Zurich Financial said the shareholders of Bristol West are offered $22.50 per share in cash.   Zurich Financial said the transaction represents an equity value of $712 million exclusive of fees and will result in the delisting of Bristol West from the New York Stock Exchange.   "Adding Bristol's auto insurance business to the Farmers platform is a great fit and contributes to increase our outreach," said Farmer Group Chief Executive Paul Hopkins.   "We are delighted that Zurich and Farmers have recognized the strength of the company we have built over the last several years, and see it as a way of enhancing Farmers' non-standard auto insurance business", said Jeffrey J. Dailey, Chief Executive of Bristol West.   BRW is a provider of liability and physical damage insurance, focusing exclusively on private passenger automobiles across the U.S.   In 2006, the company, which operates in 22 states, reported gross written premiums of around $600 million and a combined ratio - which compares costs and claims to premium income - of 91%. A level below 100% means the company is profitable.   Zurich Financial said the closing of the transaction is subject to approval by Bristol West stockholders and regulatory approvals.   Meanwhile, Zurich Financial said that reference shareholder Kohlberg Kravis Roberts & Co. and its affiliates, which hold 42.18% in the U.S. group have agreed to vote in favor of the transaction.   The completion date depends on SEC filings, and insurance regulatory approvals and clearance, as well as other factors, Zurich Financial said.     Company Web Sites: http://www.zurich.com     -By Goran Mijuk, Dow Jones Newswires; +41 43 443 80 47; goran.mijuk@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  March 02, 2007 01:46 ET (06:46 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: : Aceto Announces Promotions at its Wholly Owned Subsidiary, Aceto Pharma Corp.
Story: LAKE SUCCESS, N.Y.--(BUSINESS WIRE)--March 02, 2007--   Aceto Corporation (NASDAQ:ACET), a global leader in the sourcing, regulatory support, marketing and distribution of chemically derived pharmaceuticals, biopharmaceuticals, specialty chemicals and crop protection products, today announced promotions at Aceto Pharma Corp, its wholly owned Human and Veterinary Pharmaceuticals company.       Those promoted were:       Brian Shapiro to Vice President - Human Pharmaceuticals       David Rimmler to Vice President - Veterinary Pharmaceuticals       David Petrocine to Vice President - Regulatory Affairs     Leonard S. Schwartz, Chairman, CEO and President of Aceto commented, "The promotions that we have announced today are designed to enhance the Company's capabilities and provide a platform for more robust growth for Aceto branded products in the United States."     On February 8, 2007, the Company previously announced that Aceto Pharma Corp. had successfully entered the market by launching its first Aceto branded generic product, isoflurane, an inhalable anesthetic for human and veterinary use with a current US market of more than $75 million.       ABOUT ACETO     Aceto Corporation, incorporated in 1947, is a global leader in the sourcing, regulatory support, marketing and distribution of chemically derived pharmaceuticals, biopharmaceuticals, specialty chemicals and crop protection products. With a physical presence in ten countries, Aceto distributes over 1000 chemicals and pharmaceuticals used principally as raw materials in the pharmaceutical, agricultural, surface coating/ink and general chemical consuming industries. Aceto's global operations, including a staff of 26 in Shanghai and 12 in India are unique in the industry and enable its worldwide sourcing and regulatory capabilities.     This news release contains forward-looking statements within the meaning of Section 27A of the Securities Act of 1933, as amended, and Section 21E of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended. These forward-looking statements are based on current expectations, estimates and projections of management. Aceto intends for these forward-looking statements to be covered by the safe-harbor provisions for forward-looking statements. Words such as "anticipates," "expects," "intends," "plans," "believes," "seeks," "estimates," or variations of such words are intended to identify such forward-looking statements. The forward-looking statements contained in this press release include, but are not limited to, statements regarding Aceto's enhanced capabilities and providing a platform for more robust growth for Aceto branded products in the United States, and prospects for long-term growth. All forward-looking statements in this press release are made as of the date of this press release, and Aceto assumes no obligation to update these forward-looking statements whether as a result of new information, future events or otherwise, other than as required by law. The forward-looking statements are subject to risks and uncertainties that could cause actual results to differ materially from those set forth or implied by any forward-looking statements. These uncertainties include, but are not limited to, the mix of products sold and the profit margins thereon, order cancellation or a reduction in orders from customers, competitive product offerings and pricing actions, the availability and pricing of key raw materials, dependence on key members of management, risk of entering into new European markets, continued successful integration of acquisitions, economic and political conditions in the United States and abroad, as well as other risks detailed in the Company's SEC reports, including the Company's Form 10-K and other filings. Copies of these filings are available at www.sec.gov. (ACET-F)        CONTACT: Aceto Corporation               Theodore Ayvas, 516-627-6000               Director of Corporate Communications & Investor Relations               www.aceto.com        SOURCE: Aceto Corporation  Copyright Business Wire 2007     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  March 02, 2007 06:59 ET (11:59 GMT)

Headline: Gap Blames Woes On Execs, Overspending And Centralization
Story: By James Covert     Of DOW JONES NEWSWIRES     (This article was originally published Thursday)     NEW YORK (Dow Jones)--Gap Inc. (GPS) said an internal strategic review has determined that its business has been hurt by poorly placed executives, too much corporate centralization and too much spending amid sluggish demand for its fashions.   "Bottom line, we were not clear about who we were," Bob Fisher, Gap's chairman and interim chief executive, told analysts on a Thursday conference call. "Our product and execution suffered and our financial results were unacceptable."   The San Francisco-based specialty apparel retailer launched a strategic review of its operations in January, shortly before ousting former President and CEO Paul Pressler, a former Walt Disney Co. (DIS) executive who won praise for ordering Gap's finances but who critics said knew little about fashion. Other Disney veterans hired by Pressler to senior positions at the Gap also have recently left the company.   "We did not have the right leaders in the right positions, and we lost too much talent," Fisher said.   Fisher said the company's board is close to appointing an executive search firm to lead its search for a new chief executive. In response to an analyst's question, Fisher said he won't be a potential candidate.   A second major problem for Gap has been an overzealous effort to cut costs by centralizing its operations, Fisher said. While this strategy worked in areas like finance and information technology, "it created bureaucracy and distractions" elsewhere, he said. One misguided effort was to centralize the buying of merchandise from overseas manufacturers at its Gap, Old Navy and Banana Republic brands.   "Ultimately, this slowed us down," Fisher said. "The brands were not able to make independent decisions based upon their own distinct product and merchandising strategies."   Gap said it also aims to rein in costs - particularly in marketing - which have risen too much given the retailer's disappointing sales. Nevertheless, the company said it expects to increase its square footage by 1% during its current fiscal year. It plans to open about 230 stores, mostly Old Navy locations, and close about 200 stores, mainly in the Gap brand.   Executives added on Thursday's conference call that the company aims to "lock down the customer target and get the product right" before it decides how it will "right-size" the Gap chain. While the company's capital spending budget will be higher this year, that's mainly driven by remodeling of older stores, executives said.   "Over the course of the year, our new business leaders will evaluate their brand's store economics which could, of course, influence the number of future store openings and closings," Chief Financial Officer Byron Pollitt said in a written statement given to Dow Jones Newswires.   The statement was given in response to a Dow Jones Newswires article published Wednesday, which reported that Gap has failed to renew some of its leases in higher-rent shopping areas, prompting speculation that the company is looking to conserve cash amid sagging sales.   Marka Hansen, the newly named president of the North American Gap brand, said she aims to narrow the customer demographic that's being targeted by the chain. While Gap has pursued customers between 18 and 35, that's an overly broad range, Hansen said. When the company settles on its target, "it clearly will not be the 18-year-old," she said.   While Gap's torrid growth in the late 1990s was fueled by the casualization of the workplace, Gap has since spurred imitators that have improved on its strategy of offering casual, stylish clothing.   "I absolutely know that we're not the brand of 10 years ago," Hansen said. But she added that she thinks Gap can "reclaim an authority position" in "things like denim, like clean bottoms, like being there for people who are either casual work or casual weekend."   Fisher said the company will focus this year on improving its products and stores, retaining and developing talent, and streamlining its organizational structure. Gap, which announced this week it will close its fledgling Forth & Towne women's clothing chain, said it expects to earn 76 cents to 86 cents a share for its current fiscal year, including a loss of four cents a share to close Forth & Towne.   On Thursday, Gap said net income for its fiscal fourth quarter plunged 35%, to $219 million, or 27 cents a share, from $337 million, or 39 cents a share, in the year-earlier period. Sales for the quarter rose 2.3%, to $4.93 billion from $4.82 billion.   Gap shares in after-market trades recently were at $19.25, up 22 cents, or 1.1% from 4 p.m. composite trading on the New York Stock Exchange.   -By James Covert, Dow Jones Newswires; 201-938-5360   james.covert@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  March 02, 2007 07:33 ET (12:33 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: : Alaska Airlines Mileage Plan Introduces One-Way Awards Systemwide and Creates New 7,500-Mile Award for Travel Within State of Alaska
Story: First Major U.S. Airline to Offer Convenience of One-Way Awards       SEATTLE, March 2 /PRNewswire-FirstCall/ -- The Alaska Airlines Mileage Plan has introduced one-way mileage awards for travel anywhere Alaska Airlines and sister carrier Horizon Air fly. The awards are the first of their kind offered by a major U.S. airline.     The new awards allow customers to book one-way travel for half the mileage of round-trip awards. For example, one-way coach travel within the United States and Canada is available for 10,000 miles for Saver Awards and 20,000 miles for Peak Awards. When traveling round trip, customers also can combine different types of one-way tickets, including Saver and Peak Awards, coach and first-class awards and purchased tickets. The new one-way awards are available at alaskaair.com or by calling (800) ALASKAAIR.     "We are pleased to break new ground by offering our customers one-way awards," said Rick Rasmussen, Alaska Airlines' director of customer loyalty. "These new awards support our vision to make travel easier and to offer our customers more choices when using their miles."     To celebrate Alaska Airlines' 75th anniversary, the airline today also created a new award level for travel between any of the airline's 20 destinations in the state of Alaska. Intra-Alaska travel is available for 7,500 miles one way and 15,000 miles round trip, 75 percent of the mileage previously required. The intra-Alaska awards are available exclusively at alaskaair.com.     "The new intra-Alaska awards and new ability to book one way are great benefits for our frequent fliers," said Bill MacKay, Alaska Airlines' senior vice president for the state of Alaska. "We're pleased to make these enhancements during Alaska Airlines' 75th anniversary."     Members of the Alaska Airlines Mileage Plan can earn and redeem mileage on more than a dozen airlines, including more major U.S. airlines than any other frequent-flier program. The program also offers opportunities to earn miles through an extensive network of partners, including Alaska Airlines Credit and Debit Cards, Mileage Plan Shopping, Mileage Plan Dining, Safeway, and more than 30 hotel and car-rental partners worldwide.     The Alaska Airlines Mileage Plan is consistently honored at the Freddie Awards, among the most prestigious consumer-generated awards in the travel industry. The program has been selected "Program of the Year" for three of the past four years and, in 2006, received the "Best Elite Level Program" and "Best Member Communications" awards.     Alaska Airlines and its sister carrier, Horizon Air, together serve 89 cities through an expansive network throughout Alaska, the Lower 48, Canada and Mexico. For reservations, visit alaskaair.com. For more news and information, visit the Alaska Airlines/Horizon Air Newsroom at alaskaair.com/newsroom.    SOURCE  Alaska Airlines       /CONTACT: Amanda Tobin Bielawski of Alaska Airlines, +1-206-392-5134; or Jen Boyer of Horizon Air, +1-206-431-4672      /Web site: http://www.alaskaair.com/     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  March 02, 2007 08:01 ET (13:01 GMT)

Headline: Airbus Germany Chief: Room To Renegotiate Restructuring Plan
Story: BERLIN (AP)--European Aeronautic Defence & Space Co.'s (5730.FR) troubled Airbus unit is generally willing to renegotiate its controversial restructuring program, said Airbus' head of German operations, Gerhard Puttfarcken, on German television ZDF Friday.   Airbus is at the beginning of a process, Puttfarcken said, adding it would be wrong not to leave room for negotiations.   Puttfarcken will Friday attend works' council meetings at the German Airbus sites of Laupheim, Varel and Nordenham, which the company intends to close or sell under the restructuring program which is dubbed Power8.   Airbus Tuesday unveiled a restructuring plan aimed at counteracting some of the damage done by production delays to its A380 superjumbo aircraft, as well as dollar weakness.   It is seeking to generate annual cost savings of EUR2.1 billion by 2010 and generate cumulative additional cash flow of EUR5 billion from 2007 to 2010 by cutting 10,000 jobs over the next four years and possibly selling or closing several manufacturing plants.     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  March 02, 2007 03:40 ET (08:40 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: : Bel Receives Supplier Excellence Award from Huawei-3Com
Story: JERSEY CITY, N.J.--(BUSINESS WIRE)--March 02, 2007--   Bel Fuse Inc. (NASDAQ:BELFB) (NASDAQ:BELFA) announced today that it has received an Excellent Quality Supplier Award from Huawei-3Com Co., Ltd. (H3C), a leading enterprise networking company based in China. The award cited Bel for its technology leadership, superior quality, on-time delivery and sales support while supplying a range of products including fuses, magnetic components, MagJack(R) modules and DC-DC power converter modules.     The award was presented to Bel by Mr. You Xue-Jun, vice president of Huawei-3Com R&D, director of Huawei-3Com quality management, on January 30, 2007 in Hangzhou, PRC. Bel achieved an "A" level quality rating for the past three quarters reflecting Huawei-3Com's satisfaction with Bel's technology and customer service. One of six suppliers to be so recognized, Bel was the sole supplier selected from its group of direct competitors.     "It's extremely gratifying to be recognized by H3C for both our product innovations and superior service, particularly since H3C is such a forward-thinking company that generates value for customers by supplying high quality, technologically advanced products," said Dan Bernstein, president and CEO of Bel Fuse Inc.       About Bel     Bel (www.belfuse.com) and its subsidiaries are primarily engaged in the design, manufacture and sale of products used in networking, telecommunications, high speed data transmission, and consumer electronics. Products include magnetics (discrete components, power transformers and MagJack(R)), modules (DC-DC converters, integrated analog front end modules and custom designs), circuit protection (miniature, micro and surface mount fuses) and interconnect devices (passive jacks, plugs and cable assemblies). Bel operates facilities around the world.       About Huawei-3Com     Huawei-3Com (H3C) is a leading global supplier of IP networking products and solutions. H3C's offerings include routers, Ethernet switches, wireless LAN, security, Voice/Video over IP products, SOHO products and network management systems. Headquartered in Hong Kong, with principal operations in Hangzhou, China, H3C employs 4,800 people worldwide. To maintain a level of innovation and technical excellence, the Company operates advanced R&D facilities in Beijing, Hangzhou and Shenzhen in China and Bangalore in India; invests more than 15 percent of revenues back into R&D every year and has about half of the workforce engaged in research and development. Additionally, nearly 4,000 patents and licenses back its commitment to excellence.        CONTACT: Editorial Contact:               Bel Fuse Inc.               Donna Marganella, 858-676-9650, x108               or               Investor Contact:               Neil Berkman Associates, 310-826-5051               info@berkmanassociates.com        SOURCE: Bel Fuse Inc.  Copyright Business Wire 2007     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  March 02, 2007 07:30 ET (12:30 GMT)

Headline: Airbus Halts Work On A380 Freighter
Story: By Steve McGrath     Of DOW JONES NEWSWIRES     (This article was originally published Thursday)     LONDON (Dow Jones)--Commercial plane maker Airbus Thursday said it has halted work on a freighter version of its giant A380 plane, saying freed up capacity will used for delayed passenger versions of the plane.   The move was not a surprise after United Parcel Service Inc. (UPS) last week postponed taking delivery of freighter versions of the plane. The only other two customers for the plane, FedEx Corp. (FDX) and International Lease Finance Corp., a unit of American International Group Inc. (AIG), canceled their orders last year.   EADS spokesman Michael Hauger told Dow Jones Newswires that Airbus remains committed to a freighter version of the A380, but "there is a new development schedule." He said the company sees sales potential for 400 models of the A380 freight aircraft in the next 20 years.   UPS hasn't heard anything new from Airbus since the two companies made last week's announcement, UPS spokesman Norman Black said. He reiterated that UPS originally was scheduled to take its first delivery of the 10 A380 freighters in 2009, but that last fall Airbus advised the company that the date was slipping and the earliest UPS could get an aircraft was 2010. Last week, the delivery date was pushed back again, Black said.   UPS disclosed in its 10-K filing late Thursday with the Securities and Exchange Commission that the revised schedule specifies delivery dates between 2012 and 2013.   Airbus has been beset by problems with the A380, which will be the largest passenger plane in the world. Wiring problems have caused average delays in deliveries of the plane of two years and caused Airbus to slash profit forecasts as it pays out compensation for the delays to customers.   However, stopping work on a freighter version of the plane will take some of the pressure off the plane maker, allowing it to utilize the capacity for passenger versions of the plane.   The first passenger version of the A380 is set to fly with Singapore Airlines Ltd. (S55.SG) in October of this year. It currently has 166 orders for the plane in total. Earlier this month, Airbus chief operating officer for customers, John Leahy, said the plane maker expects to sell 20 more of the A380s this year.   However, compensation for existing customers for the delays is set to hit Airbus hard.   Thai Airways International PCL (THAI.TH) said earlier this month Airbus had offered it a discount of more than $10 million on each of four A330 aircraft as compensation for delays in the delivery of six A380s. Cash compensation of $28.08 million will be deducted from payments for the order, the airline said. The list price for an A330 is $140 million, but airlines typically negotiate discounts on the list prices.   Airbus Tuesday announced a restructuring plan aimed at counteracting some of the damage done by the A380 delays, as well as dollar weakness. It is seeking to generate annual cost savings of EUR2.1 billion by 2010 and generate cumulative additional cash flow of EUR5 billion from 2007 to 2010 by cutting 10,000 jobs over the next four years and possibly selling or closing several manufacturing plants.   -By Steve McGrath, Dow Jones Newswires; 44-20-7842-9284; steve.mcgrath@dowjones.com   (Desiree J. Hanford contributed to this story.)     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  March 02, 2007 07:33 ET (12:33 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: ATP Oil & Gas Swings To 4Q Loss, Rev More Than Doubles
Story: DOW JONES NEWSWIRES   ATP Oil & Gas Corp. (ATPG) swung to a fourth-quarter loss of $20.1 million, or $1.24 a share, from a year-earlier profit of $6.42 million, or a penny a share.   The Houston offshore oil and gas development and production company said revenue more than doubled to $132.9 million from $49.9 million last year.   In 2007, ATP said it will continue to pursue acquisitions. Also, efforts will be spent completing and bringing to production at least two more wells at Gomez and Ship Shoal 351 and an additional well at South Timbalier 77.   -Jennifer Tershak; 201-938-5400; AskNewswires@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  March 02, 2007 04:05 ET (09:05 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.
